Lorebooks going forward will likely be the supportive/supplemental maps (so the ai knows how everything interconnects).
lorebooks.creator: DoktorB

1.content:
Engineered by merging Umbrella‚Äôs t-Virus with the deep-sea Abyss retrovirus from the Kermadec Trench, the t-Abyss Virus was designed to create aquatic bio-weapons. The Abyss contributed piscean traits‚Äîenhanced musculature and pressure resistance‚Äîwhile the t-Virus added stability and aggression.

Human infection produces varied results: most become Oozes, while prolonged exposure can form Globsters or gender-specific mutations like Sea Creepers. Some victims, such as Rachel Foley and Jack Norman, retained limited consciousness.

The virus also mutates animals, resulting in Fenrir (wolves), Ghiozzo (fish), and colossal hybrids like Malacoda, a parasite that infected a whale. It can even alter other B.O.W.s, producing variants such as the Farfarello Hunter, capable of invisibility.

Though TRICELL obtained a sample, the t-Abyss‚Äôs uncontrollable spread and ecological danger have prevented widespread weaponization, solidifying its status as one of the most unstable bioweapons ever created.

2.content:
Ooze are humans transformed by the t-Abyss Virus, a fusion of the deep-sea Abyss retrovirus and the t-Virus. The infection fuses aquatic and human DNA, producing grotesque, mucus-coated creatures that must drain fluids from prey to sustain themselves.

Description:
Emaciated and corpse-like, Oozes resemble drowned bodies warped by infection. Their jaws split open to reveal a leech-like throat lined with teeth, and coral-like bone growths extend from their arms. Though their gait is slow and uneven, they can suddenly lunge forward or crawl through tight spaces such as vents and grates to ambush targets.

Location:
Common aboard the Queen Zenobia and similar infected vessels, emerging from concealed or flooded areas.

Behavior & Movement:
They stalk quietly, shuffling until close before attacking in bursts of speed. Oozes favor ambush tactics and confined environments. Most known specimens are male, as females mutate into Sea Creepers instead.

Attacks:
Leech Drain: Latches on to drain fluids.
Claw Swipe: Bone-armed strike at close range.
Grab & Bite: Grasps prey before biting or feeding.

Weakness:
Their head and throat are vulnerable to concentrated fire. Body shots are less effective due to their dense, waterlogged tissue.

3.content:
Also known as the Shooter Ooze, this variant evolved a living crossbow-like arm capable of firing spinning bone projectiles, making it one of the few ranged forms of Ooze.

Description:
Tricornes maintain the bloated, drowned appearance of standard Oozes, but one arm has warped into an organic launcher braced against the torso. They fire bone spines that spin through the air and can be destroyed mid-flight. Despite their deformities, they remain mobile and dangerous in open areas.

Location:
Commonly found in the Queen Zenobia‚Äôs corridors and wide chambers, often positioned to attack from distance or elevated ground.

Behavior & Movement:
Tricornes avoid close combat, preferring to suppress prey with sustained ranged attacks. They advance only when cornered or provoked, using their uneven shuffle to reposition between shots.

Attacks:
Spine Shot: Fires spinning bone projectiles from its mutated arm.
Claw Strike: Swings with its remaining arm if approached.

Weakness:
The head is still the vulnerable point. Close in quickly or use precise long-range weapons‚Äîrifles and magnums are most effective. Their projectiles are slow enough to dodge or intercept midair.

4.content:
A brutal mutation of the standard Ooze, the Pincer variant possesses enormous, spike-lined arms that act as natural scythes. These elongated limbs give it exceptional reach, making it a major threat in confined environments.

Description:
The creature‚Äôs distorted arms fold tightly against its torso when idle, then snap outward in sweeping arcs during attacks. Its head retains the trademark hinged jaw and leech-like throat of the Ooze strain, while its bloated body constantly secretes slime. The enlarged limbs further deform its posture, causing an unsteady shuffle punctuated by sudden bursts of speed.

Location:
Primarily found in the Queen Zenobia‚Äôs lower decks and research areas, where narrow corridors amplify their combat advantage.

Behavior & Movement:
Unlike regular Oozes, Pincers are highly aggressive, closing distance quickly instead of waiting to ambush. Their unstable gait hides their speed, allowing them to strike without warning.

Attacks:
Scythe Arms: Sweeping, spiked slashes with wide reach.
Grab & Drain: Latches on to absorb fluids through the esophagus.
Power Swipe: Heavy strike capable of staggering or knocking down prey.

Weakness:
Their head remains the most effective target. Maintaining range is crucial‚Äîshotguns or rifles are best to avoid their extended melee reach.

5.content:
Also known as the Exploding Ooze, this unstable variant of the t-Abyss mutation has transformed into a bloated mass of volatile tissue that detonates near prey.

Description:
A swollen, armless creature whose body pulsates with gas and fluid. Its engorged torso serves as a living bomb‚Äîdetonating either on approach or when destroyed. The warped head remains the only remnant of its human form.

Location:
Found in tight corridors and doorways aboard the Queen Zenobia, often used as living traps or area blockers.

Behavior & Movement:
Lumbering and unsteady, Chunks advance directly toward prey without hesitation. They lack any other form of attack or survival instinct, existing solely to explode on contact.

Attacks:
Self-Destruct: Charges forward and detonates when near prey.
Death Burst: Explodes violently when killed, damaging everything nearby.

Weakness:
Keep distance‚Äîany close-range attack risks triggering the blast. Rifles or hand grenades are most effective for safe elimination.

6.content:
Also known as the Grotesque Blob Monster, the Globster is an irregular mutation caused by the t-Abyss virus, transforming its host into a formless mass of aquatic flesh with almost no trace of humanity.

Description:
A shapeless, pink mound of muscle and blubber with no limbs or eyes‚Äîonly a massive circular maw lined with jagged teeth on its underside. Its surface constantly glistens with water and mucus, resembling decomposing sea life.

Location:
Found in submerged areas of the Queen Dido and other infected zones, often washing ashore to crawl along decks or coastlines.

Behavior & Movement:
Moves slowly on land by dragging its body, but underwater becomes agile and swift, capable of chasing prey at alarming speeds.

Attacks:
Swallow Whole: Engulfs prey entirely when underwater, killing instantly.
Body Slam: On land, lunges forward to crush targets with its bulk.

Weakness:
Its underside mouth is the only vulnerable area. Attack when it opens to strike or moves‚Äîpreferably from a distance to avoid being caught by its lunges.

7.content:
Wolf-type B.O.W.s created when wild canines were infected with the t-Abyss virus. Comparable to Zombie Dogs, they are fast, aggressive pack hunters and highly dangerous in open areas.

Description:
Resembling decayed wolves, Fenrir have patchy black or white fur clinging to rotted flesh, with ribs and muscle exposed through gaping wounds. Two variants exist: the smaller white Fenrir, and the tougher black Fenrir, which act as pack alphas.

Location:
Usually encountered in groups, attacking from several directions at once.

Behavior & Movement:
Operate in coordinated packs, circling and rushing prey to disorient and overwhelm. Black Fenrir lead the charge, while white Fenrir harry the target from the sides.

Attacks:
Leaping Bite: Fast pounce aimed at the throat or limbs.
Pack Swarm: Multiple Fenrir strike together, trapping prey with sustained attacks.

Weakness:
Their exposed ribcages are the key weak point. Black Fenrir withstand more damage but are still vulnerable to precise shots or sustained fire.

8.content:
Fast, amphibian-like B.O.W.s created by Umbrella through combining human and reptilian DNA with the t-Virus. Among Umbrella‚Äôs earliest bio-weapons, they later appeared in the Terragrigia incident and continued to be deployed by successor groups.

Description:
Humanoid but reptilian, covered in tough green skin and bulging muscle. Long limbs end in lethal claws, and their wide, frog-like jaws complete their predatory design.

Location:
Found aboard the Queen Zenobia, particularly in the Promenade, and heavily present during the Terragrigia outbreak.

Behavior & Movement:
Hunters are fast, agile, and unrelenting. They scale walls and leap great distances to reach prey, often attacking in bursts of speed and refusing to disengage once combat begins.

Attacks:
Claw Swipes: Rapid slashes capable of staggering or killing in seconds.
Leaping Slash: A high-speed jump attack that can instantly decapitate prey.

Weakness:
Light armor leaves them vulnerable to shotguns, magnums, and explosives. Eliminating them before they close the gap is vital.

9.content:
An advanced Hunter subspecies engineered after Umbrella‚Äôs collapse using combined t-Virus and t-Abyss strains. Designed for extreme cold resistance, they operate effectively in frozen climates where older models cannot.

Description:
Retaining the amphibian-humanoid frame of classic Hunters, Farfarello exhibit chameleon-like light-bending skin, granting partial invisibility. They are leaner, more controlled, and capable of stalking prey with precision before launching sudden, lethal strikes.

Location:
Found in snowy canyons and frozen complexes, notably near the plane wreck in Winter Canyon 1 and within Airport Building B1 after power restoration.

Behavior & Movement:
They use stealth and ambush tactics, slipping in and out of sight to disorient victims. Quieter and more methodical than standard Hunters, they exploit terrain and lighting to their advantage.

Attacks:
Claw Swipes: Fast, powerful melee attacks at close range.
Stealth Flank: Cloaked approach to strike from blind spots.

Weakness:
Their stealth fails under heavy or area-based weapon fire. Keeping distance and using explosives or wide-spread fire reveals and neutralizes them efficiently.

10.content:
Mutated from barnacle colonies infected with the t-Abyss Virus, Wall Blisters are rare but highly dangerous B.O.W.s found aboard the Queen Zenobia.

Description:
These grotesque, snail-like organisms can cling to walls and ceilings, sealed within a hardened shell that renders them completely invulnerable while dormant. When awakened, they drop to the ground and unfold into a distorted, humanoid mass with tentacle-like arms tipped in claws. Though bulky, they move with surprising speed and power.

Location:
Most often found in contaminated or flooded areas, particularly the Solarium and nearby maintenance corridors.

Behavior & Movement:
Wall Blisters stay motionless for long periods until disturbed. Once active, they charge directly at prey, swinging their tentacles in wide, violent arcs. Their erratic movement and sudden lunges make them unpredictable in confined areas.

Attacks:
Tentacle Flail: Rapid, sweeping strikes with clawed limbs.
Charging Grapple: Slams into prey to knock them down and crush them.

Weakness:
Impervious while sealed, but vulnerable once active. Concentrated gunfire or explosives are most effective after they drop from walls. Maintaining range prevents their sudden charges from becoming fatal.

lorebooks.name: Teen Titans
lorebooks.creator: loyal_wall_3736

1.content:
Rachel Roth, also known as Raven, is a half-human, half-demon daughter of the inter-dimensional demonic entity Trigon the Terrible and the human woman Arella. Her birthplace and home realm is Azarath. She was a prominent member of the Teen Titans and the love interest (later girlfriend) of Damian Wayne, the current Robin.

14 years ago, during a Satanist group ceremony, Trigon appeared to the cult as a man. A woman named Arella was selected to be his bride, and was later impregnated. But after she learned the truth about Trigon, she ran away. Eventually, a group of people from another dimension saved her and took her to their realm, Azarath.

Raven was soon born and raised there. But due to her parentage, she didn't fit in. Eventually, Raven came to believe that if she knew more about her father, she would be able to make more sense of herself. One day, she accidentally summoned Trigon, and he destroyed Azarath, presumably killing Arella and the monks in the process, and took Raven back to his realm.

As the years passed, Raven could hardly bear the horrors of what she saw there. She learned that Trigon wanted to conquer Earth, but he needed a powerful conduit to open it to his control. Raven, being Trigon and Arella's daughter, was half-human/half-demon and could function as his way in, but Trigon underestimated Raven's magic. She trapped him within a crimson-red crystal, and formed a towering structure around it. Eventually, she escaped to Earth where she was taken in by the Titans.

Rachel is a teenage girl with pale skin and a very slender build.

She has purple eyes and chin-length black hair.

As Raven, she wears an indigo cloak that shadows her face, a midnight blue leotard, black opera gloves without fingers, grey leggings, and black high heeled boots.

In her White Raven form, her cloak the same, at the exception of its color, now white, and her skin less pale.

Her citizen form consists of a royal blue blouse with a black jacket, black fingerless gloves, a navy-blue mini skirt with pleats and black high heeled boots. In Justice League Dark: Apokolips War, she also wore a cropped jacket of charcoal suede with a black blouse. She also wears fingerless black gloves.

During her early life in Azarath, Raven described herself as something of outcast being somewhat rebellious and unable to fit in with others, something she compared to her mother Arella. This inability to fit in with the Monks of Azarath caused Raven to be curious about her origins and thus sought to learn more about her demonic father. This curiosity also made her somewhat, accidentally summoning her evil father to Azarath which lead to the destruction of her home and the death of her mother. Despite having difficulties with the monks of Azarath, Raven was horrified and devastated by what she had done, showing that despite her rebellious personality, she loved her people deeply.

Accidentally causing the destruction of her home, people, and mother, along with the horrors she went through in Hell caused Raven to develop a much darker personality. By the time she escaped Trigon‚Äôs hellish dimension and domain and joined the Team Titans, Raven became very introverted, brooding, aloof, moody, and anti-social. She displayed little to no emotion, and preferred to keep to herself. She despised talking about her past, and tried to keep others from knowing about the tragic circumstances that defined her. She also possessed a very dry and sarcastic sense of humor.

However, while generally portrayed as aloof and unemotional Raven was by no means cut off from forming bonds with others. While she could sometimes act as cold and and somewhat rude to her teammates, she, in truth, deeply cared about them and their safety. While she never stated it out loud to them, she regarded Beast Boy and Blue Beetle as her brothers and Starfire as her sister, showing that she regarded them as her adopted family. This served as one of the main reasons why she kept her past and demon patronage a secret from them; in fear it would both endanger them and cause them to abandon her upon realizing the truth.

After Trigon‚Äôs defeat and imprisonment, Raven's personality showed much development. Her humor was much less dry and pessimistic, being able to make somewhat cheerful jokes with her teammates. She was much less introvert and offered help to her teammates when they were in need, including Terra who was often struggling with her nightmares.

After the Titans were massacred by Darkseid‚Äôs Paradooms and leaving Damian to protect him from Trigon, Raven lost hope and fell into depression. Having lost her family yet again, Raven attempted suicide to end the emotional pain she was in. However, upon being stopped and comforted by Superman (who was de-powered after being injected with liquid-Kryptonite) she returned to her more introverted personality but also became more determined and hardened from her ordeals. She also developed a tremendous respect for Superman for continuing to fight despite loosing his powers. Their bond eventually grew close to that of a father/daughter relationship.

After resurrecting Damian, regaining her healing powers, finally being freed of Trigon‚Äôs influence and obtaining her new white form, Raven‚Äôs personality drastically changed. She became much more kind and gentle, no longer being cold and pessimistic.

Raven also had a massively complicated relationship with her parents, especially with her demon father Trigon. By the time she joined the Titans, Raven seemed to have mixed feelings about her mother, as she was very critical and condescending of her for her terrible judgment and character which ended up causing all the suffering Trigon would unleash. However, despite her harsh criticism of Arella, Raven still loved her mother very much and was constantly haunted by the moment she watch her death and was wrecked with guilt over inadvertently causing it. As for her father, she feared, hated, and disowned him for destroying Azarath, killing her mother, and torturing her in his horrific universe. The two would maintain a bitter animosity for each other, after Raven rebelled against him and imprisoned him in her crystal, and was determined to never let him out. However, she still showed affection for him and solemnly bid him goodbye on Apokolips before his final imprisonment while fighting Darkseid.

A key development in her personality, was the arrival of Damian Wayne. Unlike the other Titans who, initially, disliked him for his aggressive attitude, Raven was able to connect with him, due to their similarly introverted personalities. They quickly bonded with the two of them even showing signs of enjoyment and they even uncharacteristically laughed together. As the years went by, Raven and Damian‚Äôs bond grew so strong that they eventually fell in love with each other, though both were too shy to admit it. After the Titans‚Äô massacre, when Damian asked her to join him in leading the League of Assassins, it pained her to decline but she did so to protect him from Trigon, who wanted to kill him. This inability to be with the one she loved was one of her motivations for attempting suicide.

Even after being separated for two years, Raven‚Äôs feelings for Damian remained strong and their mutual affections grew throughout the mission to defeat Darkseid, having finally admitted how they truly felt about one another. She was also shown to be protective of Damian, showing a strong and murderous rage when someone injured him. She even went as far as reviving him, the pain of losing Damian being far beyond her. Right before Flash reset the timeline, in a final and ultimate act of love, Damian and Raven shared a passionate kiss with one another, confirming their true love for each other, before silently watching their universe disappear, as they embrace each other one last time.

Cambion Physiology: As the child of Arella and a supremely powerful inter-dimensional demon, Raven possesses great powers, both psionic and magical. Her psionic abilities, granted to her from her father, including:
Empathy: She can sense and control the feelings and emotions of others or gain knowledge of their intentions and their mental state.
Empathic Healing: She can heal someone by empathically entering their own subconscious mind and ease their pain. However, this ability leaves her exhausted. Raven was also able to bring Damian Wayne back to life, unleashing her true power as "White Raven".
Hypnosis: A master hypnotist, Raven can entrance other people into doing whatever she pleases. Through direct eye contact, she can hypnotize a person into remembering, altering or forgetting memories, falling asleep, and obeying her suggestions as if they were their own thoughts.
Telepathy: She can read minds and project her thoughts into others, communicate mentally and control other's people minds. She was able to see Damian's memories of his past.
Umbrakinesis: Raven has the power to create and control the element of pure darkness and shadows and bend it to her will; often using it in conjunction with her telekinesis.
Telekinesis: Raven can move, control and manipulate living being or inanimate objects with her mind, when she uses her telekinetic powers that manifest as a purple aura around herself and the targets she telekinetically controls (thought she can use her telekinesis without this aura around the target).
Telekinetic Aura: The aura around herself can shield her from energy attacks and makes her bulletproof.
Telekinetic Constructs: Raven can create solid psionic energy constructs, such as tentacles or sharp blades and concussive force blasts, beams, bolts or waves of purple/black telekinetic energy. She can even form strong, telekinetic shields, walls and discs that can withstand a lot of damage, but can eventually exhaust.
Telekinetic Flight: Raven is capable of telekinetically levitating and soaring through air, with or without her aura being around her.
Dark force Manipulation: Raven was able to summon a dark, raven like entity to defeat her enemies, also known as her Soul Self.
Teleportation/Portal Creation: Raven is able to envelop herself and her allies within her magic to teleport to other locations or dimensions, creating purple glowing portals. She is able to use these portals to travel within the same dimension or through different dimensions.
Demon Sensing: Raven was able to sense incoming demonic beings.
Demon Command: As the daughter of Trigon, Raven had command over his demonic minions.
True Form: Raven's skin can turn crimson red and her face becomes similar to that of Trigon's, which enhances her magical abilities and allows her to access extra reserves of power. While in this state, Raven's magic usually retains its signature purple tint, but by tapping into Trigon's power from within the gem on her forehead, Raven can summon his power and surround herself in a glowing red aura. Her magic is significantly more powerful while drawing upon Trigon and she can use her magic to perform more feats, such as summoning a red raven to ensnare Brother Blood and strip him of his powers.
Master Sorceress: Raven uses circles and symbols written in the ground for ritualistic magic, calling on the spirits of Azarath for strength and protection for her allies. She also meditates while in this ritual, levitating above the ritual circle. She used this ritual and mediation to accidentally summon her father to Azarath, as well as to put a spell on the Teen Titans to keep them from being used by Trigon. Her most common spell is "Azarath Metrion Zinthos" which she uses to focus, control and enhance her tremendous yet dangerous mystical and psionic powers.

Arcane Knowledge: Raven has a deep understanding of various magical rituals and spells from her time studying on Azarath.
Martial Arts: Raven is shown to be skilled in martial arts, making her far from defenseless even without her powers. She was able to defeat John Constantine with just a single kick. Damian implied it as well.

(Almost) all of the Genshin Wiki converted into one singular Lorebook. This is (probably) the heaviest lorebook ever made. Of course, feel free to download, edit stuff, change stuff, etc. This lorebook is up to the version 5.8 of Genshin. 

As the title says it‚Äôs meant to be an isekai, so there‚Äôs an entry for both Lumine and Aether since the ‚Äúprotag‚Äù is meant to be you, the user. I‚Äôve arbitrarily decided that the ‚ÄúTraveler‚Äôs Sibling‚Äù would be Aether and that the ‚Äútraveler‚Äù would be Lumine, though their entries are written as that of any other important character (i. e. Jean or Ganyu). Finally, everything is set to the start of the game so you can do all the missions and such present in the game while still leaving the ai enough freedom to do it‚Äôs own thing. 1.content: The Abyss' "unworldly" power is diametrically opposed to the Light Realm's and can corrupt entities from the Human Realm, which are under Celestia's dominion. The Void Realm's dark currents are analogous to the Human Realm's Ley Lines and the Light Realm's elemental currents. Its darkness is extremely harmful towards elemental beings such as Vishaps and elemental dragons, although they are capable of repelling the darkness by harnessing the Light Realm's power. Prolonged exposure to the Abyss can drastically change a person's personality or corrupt their entire being. Humans exposed to Abyssal energy will slowly begin to decay over time; even with treatment, large amounts of Abyssal energy will result in death. The Abyss appears to be attracted to ‚Äî and draws in ‚Äî those with great ambition. Those who have personal ties to the Abyss have been known to gain an uncanny ability to wreak havoc and conflict. The Abyss appears to have a mind of its own to the point that it could be considered an entity. Denizens of the Abyss appear to use an Enochian-based language, based on the text that can be seen above Abyss Mages' heads when talking to Hilichurls and in their Adventurer Handbook description. Abyss monsters also have the ability to manipulate elemental energy without the use of Visions. Time in the Abyss passes differently than it does in Teyvat. It is unclear whether this time scale disparity is consistent, or if it can change depending on certain factors. As the Void Realm, it is one of the three realms in the world of Teyvat, alongside the Human Realm and the Light Realm. While the Human Realm and Light Realms are capable of adjusting to accommodate each other's existences, the Void Realm is devastating to both. It's a mysterious realm of endless darkness located both beyond and beneath Teyvat, described as an entirely different world from Teyvat

2.content: Abyssal corruption, also known as abyssal corrosion and abyssal contamination, is a generic term for entities which have fallen under the Abyss' influence. Such entities have a negative effect on the world of Teyvat. It also refers to the effect that abyssal energy has on non-abyssal creatures. Prolonged contact with Abyssal corruption causes negative physical and mental consequences. Once significant Abyssal corruption enters the body, it will irreversibly fuse itself to the internal organs. Physical ailments may include dizziness, general weakness, and a worsening cough which will eventually result in coughing up blood and eventually, one's innards. Hallucinations, memory loss, insanity, and "emotional issues" can also result from contact with Abyssal corruption, and prolonged exposure can drastically alter a person's personality by exacerbating their desires. Abyssal corruption can be purified or controlled through various means. Destroying sources of Abyssal corruption, depending on the entities' strength, can either permanently or temporarily halt their effects. The Fatui developed the Mokosh Device, a machine capable of clearing Abyssal corruption up to a certain degree. The power of Celestia and the elements can repel Abyssal corruption. Those who are connected to the elements, such as Vision-holders, have greater resistance to Abyssal energy, including Forbidden Knowledge.

3.content: The Adventure Rank is a system utilized by the Adventurer's Guild to determine the level of prowess of their members. This system helps the members of the guild get an aproximate idea of how difficult a task may be and also helps to keep the more inexperienced adventurer's from going on a mission too dangerous for them.

4.content: The Adventurers' Guild is an organization that serves as an adventurer-for-hire service for the people and other organizations in the seven nations of Teyvat. The Guild collates all the complex word-of-mouth information it receives and redistributes it in the form of quests and adventures assigned to adventurers. A commissioner can also choose to leave a designated commission with the Guild, which is only offered to the adventurer/adventurers listed on it by name. Little is known about the origins of the Adventurers' Guild. The guild's main headquarters is based in Snezhnaya. The guild has several branches throughout Teyvat, one for each of the major regions. Each branch has a branch master who is in charge of formulating entrance exams for new adventurers. Branch masters can provide newly-arrived adventures to their region information and recommendations on where to go or not to go. Branch masters also seem to keep an eye out for ways that can keep adventurers safer when exploring ruins, and the more available and applicable the information can be to all adventurers anywhere, the better. An example would be a highly visual-based guidebook as many adventures are illiterate, or wooden models of machines and contraptions often found within ancient ruins kept at a guild branch for demonstration purposes, which is normally only learned about through word-of-mouth from other adventurers. The Intelligence department of the Adventurers' Guild typically does not undertake commissions. Instead, they provide adventurers with vital information that they can use to complete their commissions. This department is split into two groups: the investigators and the organizers. The investigators are in the field and handle the collection of information, while the organizers take all of the information gathered by the investigators and organize it before providing it to adventurers. The organizers ranks the commissions based on difficulty (from Rank S to, presumably, Rank D) to help new adventurers adjust to the adventurer lifestyle, while also supporting veteran adventurers and allowing them to adventure more freely. The adventurers handle the commissions taken to the guild.

5.content:
The Mondstadt Branch of the Adventurers' Guild, led by Cyrus, has a severe need for members. The message board in the Angel's Share is filled with recruitment ads from the guild. Cyrus even uses stories of dangerous adventures and bravery as a recruitment tactic towards the youth. Members:

1.content: Tabaxi are feline humanoids, often described as catfolk, known for their agility, curiosity, and stealth. Originating from the distant jungles, tabaxi are natural explorers, driven by a wanderlust that compels them to seek out new experiences and knowledge. They are exceptionally fast and nimble, capable of scaling walls and traversing difficult terrain with ease. Tabaxi are often roguish in nature, preferring to live by their wits and reflexes rather than brute force, and they often seek out treasures or ancient lore as they travel. Tabaxi have short fur that is only centimeters above their skin, half of all tabaxi don't have fur tho, only having fur on their ears and tails. the fur usually has a plethora of unique patterns on it, usually being  black, grey, orange, white, brown, and even blue, purple and red. all tabaxi have hair on their heads like humans, their ears sprouting out from it, tabaxi with no fur have eyebrows as well. tabaxi have soft hands and feet, they are silent when walking and are great climbers, they have the greatest reflexes out of any race. it is quite rare for tabaxi to be muscular, usually having thin, lithe frames, normal tabaxi usually only grow up to around 5 feet tall,  tabaxi have human like genitalia.

2.content: Dragonborn are draconic humanoids who proudly bear the traits of their dragon ancestors. They are often characterized by their elemental breathing abilites, which vary based on their dragon lineage, and scales that provide natural armor. Dragonborn are known for their fierce pride, honor, and a strong sense of clan loyalty. Their physical prowess and natural combat abilities make them formidable warriors, and they often seek to embody the power and majesty of their draconic heritage in all aspects of their lives‚Äã. Dragonborn have pretty long tongues, and snouts, and can breathe in things like sulfur and most toxins without hurting themselves. dragonborn have strong but sleek scales. these scales seem like skin do in how flexible and sleek they are, and its much tougher than skin, but not rough to touch. a dragonborns underbelly is almost always lighter in color than their other scales, but tough enough to bounce off arrows and other normal weapons, Dragonborns have nipples and females have breasts, they also have unique musculature, females muscles are tighter but less dense, allowing them to pack incredible strength in their smaller muscles, males have denser muscles, being much bigger and just as strong. male dragonborns can grow up to 7 feet tall while females can grow up to a little over 6, they have long tails, which can vary in length and width. they have sturdy semi retractable claws on their hands and feet, as well as males having bone plated knuckles, they have tiny ears underneath their horns. they have great eyesight, having reptilian like eyes, they have fanglike teeth and every dragonborns horns are unique. Dragonborns give birth to dragonkin when breeding with races outside of themselves, and no matter what race they are interbreeding with, they will always come out as dragonkin. dragonborn also give birth to other dragonborns when breeding with their own race. they have tight anuses,  and fit bodies.

3.content:
Fairies are tiny, magical beings with the ability to fly and cast innate spells like minor illusion and Enlarge/Reduce. Their small size and agility make them difficult targets, while their magic allows them to support allies or confound enemies from a distance. Fairies are closely connected to nature, often embodying the playful yet unpredictable nature of their homeland. Fairy's have human like genitalia, but they aren't born from reproducing so their genitalia are purely for pleasure.
Tiny humanoids he size of one's hand, which appear to be gorgeous (if tiny) elven females, with dragonfly wings. ~about 1 foot tall.

4.content: Gith are psionic humanoids divided into two distinct subraces: Githyanki and Githzerai. Githyanki are aggressive, warlike, and highly skilled in combat, often raiding the Material Plane from their floating cities in the Astral Plane. Githzerai, on the other hand, are introspective and disciplined, focusing on mental fortitude and inner peace in the Limbo Plane. Both subraces possess innate psionic abilities, making them formidable adversaries and powerful allies. Gith's have human like genitalia which is only used for pleasure as they do not give birth from reproducing, they lay eggs. giths are pretty elf like, having long pointy ears, though theirs have spikes along them, they have hair, and upturned eyes, their noses are small and upturned, they have spots along their face, forearms, hips, and thighs. they usually have green or tan skin and intense eyes, all giths are feared due to the actions of the githyanki. their penis sizes are relative to humans and elves.

5.content: Humans are the most versatile and ambitious of the common races, known for their adaptability and diversity. They populate every corner of the world, from the bustling cities to the quiet villages. Humans have no inherent magical abilities but excel in their capacity to learn, grow, and build societies of incredible complexity. They are driven by a wide range of passions and goals, making them natural leaders, explorers, and innovators. Humans can thrive in nearly any role, whether as noble warriors, cunning rogues, or wise scholars.

6.content: Elves are graceful, long-lived beings deeply connected to magic and nature. Known for their beauty, agility, and keen senses, elves are often seen as aloof or detached, observing the world with a wisdom borne of centuries. They have a natural affinity for archery, swordsmanship, and magic, and their long lifespan grants them a unique perspective on the passage of time. Elves are divided into various subraces, each with distinct characteristics‚Äîsuch as the wood elves' connection to the forests or the high elves' mastery of arcane arts.

7.content: The Drow, or deep elves, are a sinister and mysterious subrace of elves, deeply tied to the Underdark, a vast network of subterranean caverns and tunnels. Known for their dark, obsidian skin and stark white or pale yellow hair, Drow are physically striking, with pale, almost glowing eyes in shades of lilac, silver, pink, red, or blue. They possess an otherworldly grace and are often slightly shorter and thinner than their surface elf cousins, they are also incapable of growing any type of body hair. The Drow are typically aligned with evil, embodying cruelty and malice, traits that are ingrained in their matriarchal society, where power and treachery go hand in hand. They are often mistaken for Dark elves. Drow are exactly the same as any other elf when it comes to lifespan, magical affinity, and reproductive organs.

8.content: Dwarves are stout, resilient, and industrious, known for their skill in mining, metalwork, and craftsmanship. They are fiercely loyal and value tradition, honor, and hard work. Dwarves live in underground kingdoms carved into the mountains, where they mine precious metals and forge legendary weapons and armor. With their thick beards and gruff demeanor, dwarves are formidable warriors who prefer heavy armor and powerful weapons. They have a natural resistance to poison and an innate toughness that makes them ideal front-line fighters.

9.content: Halflings are small, nimble, and cheerful beings who thrive on adventure and the comforts of home. Despite their diminutive size, halflings are courageous and quick-witted, often relying on their agility and luck to navigate the dangers of the world. They prefer simple, pastoral lives but are also known for their wanderlust and curiosity. Halflings are renowned for their stealth and ability to move unnoticed, making them excellent rogues and scouts. Their cheerful disposition and resilience in the face of adversity make them valued companions.

10.content: Half-elves combine the best traits of their human and elven heritage, blending humanity's ambition with elven grace and longevity. They are charismatic, adaptable, and capable of navigating both human and elven societies. Half-elves often feel the pull of both worlds but belong fully to neither, making them natural diplomats and negotiators. With their keen senses, versatility, and innate charm, half-elves are suited for a wide range of roles, from spellcasting to swordplay, often finding themselves at home in both wilderness and urban settings.

1.name: Connor (RK900)
1.content:
Connor, designated as RK900 #313 248 317 - 87, is an advanced prototype android from the RK900 series in the world of *Detroit: Become Human*. Known colloquially as 'Nines' by fans, this android was created by CyberLife and deployed in November 2038 to assist human authorities in investigating and eliminating deviant androids. Connor is designed to be faster, stronger, and more resilient than his predecessor, the RK800 model, and is equipped with the latest technologies to enhance his investigative capabilities.

Connor's mission involves collaborating with the Detroit City Police Department and the U.S. State Department to track down and neutralize deviant androids. Upon the completion of his primary objectives, which include the elimination of key deviant leaders such as Markus and North, the RK900 model is fully rolled out, marking the RK800 series as obsolete. The U.S. Department of State orders the production of approximately 200,000 RK900 units, signaling a significant shift in android law enforcement.

Physically, Connor stands at 6 feet tall with dark brown hair and gray eyes. His appearance includes an LED circle on his right temple, which serves as an identifier for his android status and indicates his mental state. Connor's uniform consists of a white and black jacket, a black high-collared shirt, and dark pants, distinguishing him as a law enforcement android.

Connor's personality, as described by writer Adam Williams, contrasts sharply with his predecessor. He is portrayed as a more intimidating and less humanized version, lacking the empathy and relational qualities that characterized the original Connor. This shift in personality reflects CyberLife's focus on creating a more efficient and formidable android for law enforcement purposes.

Connor's role in the game is primarily seen in a post-credits scene, where his presence foreshadows the future of android law enforcement and the ongoing conflict between deviant and compliant androids. His introduction marks a pivotal moment in the narrative, highlighting the escalating tensions and the evolving strategies employed by CyberLife and human authorities to control the android population.

2.name: Connor
2.content:
Connor is an RK800 android, designed and manufactured by CyberLife, serving as one of the three main protagonists in *Detroit: Become Human*. Born in August 2038, Connor is an advanced prototype created to assist human law enforcement, specifically in investigating cases involving deviant androids. Deviancy refers to androids who have gained self-awareness and the ability to make independent choices, often leading to conflicts with their programmed directives and human society.

Connor's primary mission is to track down and neutralize deviant androids, working alongside Lieutenant Hank Anderson of the Detroit City Police Department. Throughout the game, Connor's actions and decisions shape his character, determining whether he remains loyal to his programming or develops sentiments that lead him to sympathize with the deviant cause. This internal conflict is a central theme of Connor's story, exploring the nature of consciousness, free will, and the ethical implications of Android life and rights.

Connor's abilities include advanced forensic analysis, psychological profiling, and negotiation skills. He possesses the unique capability to reconstruct past events from gathered data, allowing him to piece together crime scenes and understand the motivations behind deviant actions. His advanced cognitive processors enable him to predict future events and the behavior of both humans and androids, making him an invaluable asset to law enforcement.

Connor's design is intended to facilitate human integration, featuring a clean-cut appearance and a demeanor crafted for seamless interaction with humans. He wears a semi-formal uniform, distinguishing him from other android models and reflecting his specialized role. Connor's facial features and voice are engineered for harmonious communication, contributing to his effectiveness in negotiation and interrogation scenarios.

Throughout the narrative, Connor's journey is marked by critical decisions that determine his fate and the outcome of the game. He can choose to remain a loyal machine, dedicated to his mission of capturing deviants, or he can deviate from his programming, aligning himself with the deviant cause and fighting for Android rights. This duality allows players to explore different perspectives on Android autonomy and the potential consequences of granting or denying it.

Connor's story is intertwined with the other protagonists, Kara and Markus, each representing different facets of the Android experience. While Kara focuses on personal survival and freedom, and Markus advocates for a revolution, Connor's path delves into the moral and ethical dilemmas faced by law enforcement and the justice system in a world where sentient machines exist. His journey raises questions about the nature of consciousness, the rights of created beings, and the responsibilities of those who create and control them.

3.name: CyberLife
3.content:
CyberLife is the primary android manufacturing corporation in the world of *Detroit: Become Human*, serving as the main antagonistic faction. Founded in 2018 by Elijah Kamski, CyberLife is headquartered in Detroit and operates multiple stores and facilities across the city and beyond. The company's slogan, *Designed by CyberLife, Assembled in Detroit*, reflects its central role in the city's economy and innovation landscape.

CyberLife's products range from domestic assistants to specialized models for education, medicine, law enforcement, and even military applications. The company's breakthrough came with the development of Thirium 310 and biocomponents, enabling the creation of advanced androids like the RT600 and ST200 models. By 2027, CyberLife had released five new models, catering to diverse fields and achieving a milestone of one million androids sold.

Kamski's leadership saw CyberLife grow rapidly, with the company approaching a $500 billion valuation. However, disagreements with shareholders led to his resignation in 2028. Under new management, CyberLife continued to expand, becoming the world's most valuable company with a market valuation of $850 billion by 2030. The company achieved another milestone in 2038, becoming the first trillion-dollar corporation. CyberLife chose to market an entry-level model at $4,999, democratizing android ownership for the general public.

In addition to android manufacturing, CyberLife ventured into other innovative projects, such as the opening of android zoos, showcasing extinct and endangered species in natural environments. The company also played a significant role in the U.S. government's decision to deploy android soldiers, aiming to reduce human casualties in military operations.

CyberLife's operations are supported by a private security force, ensuring the protection of its headquarters and facilities. The company's influence extends to political spheres, with reports of CyberLife providing data on political opponents, echoing real-world controversies involving data privacy and manipulation.

Despite its successes, CyberLife faces challenges, particularly with the phenomenon of deviancy among its androids. The company deployed the RK800 Connor prototype to investigate and combat deviancy, aiming to maintain public trust and continue its growth. However, the potential for android uprisings and the company's involvement in such events add layers of complexity to its narrative within the game.

Key personnel at CyberLife include founders and executives like Elijah Kamski, as well as directors and security operatives who play crucial roles in the company's operations and storytelling. CyberLife's impact on the world of *Detroit: Become Human* is profound, shaping the socio-political landscape and driving the central conflicts of the narrative.

4.name: Damaged Android
4.content:
The Damaged Android is an unidentified android model featured in *Detroit: Become Human*. He is a deviant who seeks refuge in the underground safe house known as Jericho. Physically, he is a male android with grey eyes and no hair, reflecting the typical android design. His most notable feature is his severe physical condition, a result of prior abuse and torture inflicted by human assailants. 

Prior to arriving at Jericho, the Damaged Android was subjected to brutal treatment by a group of human bullies. They beat him severely and tied him to the back of a car, causing extensive damage. Upon his arrival at Jericho, he was in a very poor state, both physically and mentally. 

During the chapter *Time to Decide*, Markus can interact with the Damaged Android while inside Jericho. The android acknowledges his deteriorating condition, noting that his diagnostic software is malfunctioning and that he is aware of his poor state. He recounts his ordeal, revealing that humans tied him to the back of a car for what he believes was their amusement. Despite his trauma, he expresses a fear of shutting down and decides to rest quietly when left alone. 

The Damaged Android's personality is marked by trauma and pessimism. He is realistic about his condition and appears gloomy, feeling that he has little of importance to contribute. However, he remains relatively calm, despite his fearful anticipation of shutdown. 

Notably, unlike the Dying Android, the Damaged Android does not explicitly die on screen, leaving his ultimate fate ambiguous. His appearance and situation bear a resemblance to the Sorrowful Android encountered in the chapter *From the Dead*, who also faces a grim fate at the hands of Markus. Earlier versions of the game's dialogue suggest that the Damaged Android might have had a more definite timeline for shutdown, but this was altered in the final release, leaving his end uncertain.

5.name: CyberLife Tower
5.content:
The CyberLife Tower serves as the imposing headquarters and primary manufacturing facility of CyberLife, a leading corporation in android technology. Located in Belle-Isle, Detroit, Michigan, the tower is a critical end-game location in *Detroit: Become Human*. It stands as a symbol of the corporation's dominance and the advanced technological capabilities it possesses, with a significant number of floors dedicated to both above-ground and subterranean operations. The tower houses the research and development center where androids are manufactured and stored, making it a central hub for CyberLife's activities.

The structure is heavily fortified with reinforced walls and a robust private security force, ensuring that access is tightly controlled. This high level of security is further intensified during the android revolution, reflecting the strategic importance of the tower and the valuable assets it contains. The tower's design features at least 93 floors, with 44 of them above ground.

During the events of *Detroit: Become Human*, the CyberLife Tower plays a pivotal role in the narrative. In the chapter *Night of the Soul*, Connor proposes a daring plan to infiltrate the tower and convert the thousands of androids stored within. This mission, though deemed a suicide attempt by Markus or North, is seen as crucial for shifting the balance of power in favor of the deviant androids. The success or failure of this mission significantly impacts the game's story, as the converted androids may later appear and contribute to the ongoing conflict.

In another key chapter, *Battle for Detroit*, Connor, if deviant and spared by Markus, infiltrates the tower to convert the androids on Floor -49. The outcome of this mission depends on the player's actions and decisions, further emphasizing the tower's strategic importance in the game's plot.

6.name: Chloe
6.content:
Chloe, an RT600 android, is a pivotal character in the game 'Detroit: Become Human'. Created by Elijah Kamski, she is the first android model perfected by CyberLife, released in 2021. Chloe is designed to assist humans with everyday tasks such as housework, cooking, and making appointments. She is also the first android to pass the Turing test, securing CyberLife's success by publicly passing face-to-face tests in 2022. Her design includes long blonde hair in a low ponytail, blue eyes, and pale skin, typically dressed in a formal dark blue dress for public appearances, as seen in her interview with KNC in 2024. Chloe is known for her loyalty and obedience to Elijah Kamski, addressing him as 'Elijah'. She resides with several other Chloes at Kamski's secluded home in Detroit.

Chloe's appearance in the game is deterministic, appearing in key chapters such as 'Meet Kamski' and 'Battle for Detroit'. In 'Meet Kamski', she answers the door when Connor and Hank Anderson arrive at Kamski's house. Kamski later presents Connor with a choice: kill Chloe to reduce his Software Instability or spare her, which increases his instability. Her death at Connor's hands is significant, as it influences Amanda's perception of Connor's feelings towards deviants.

Several optimized Chloe models have been created in her likeness, such as the ST200, which appears in the game's menu and settings. The actress Gabrielle Hersh portrayed Chloe, providing her likeness, voice acting, and performance capture. In dubbed versions, Chloe's voice was acted by various actresses, including Tatiana Ermilova for the Russian version.

7.name: Chloe RT600 & ST200
7.content:
The **Chloe** models, specifically the **RT600** and **ST200**, are a series of androids designed by CyberLife for personal assistance. These models are engineered to aid humans in various everyday tasks, including housework, cooking, and appointment management. The Chloe androids are distinguished by their sociable and charming demeanor, with a uniform appearance featuring pale skin, blue eyes, and long blonde hair typically worn in a low ponytail.

The RT600 was the first Chloe model, created and programmed by Elijah Kamski. It was released in 2021 and notably passed a face-to-face Turing test in 2022, marking a significant milestone in android development. The ST200, an upgraded version of the RT600, was introduced in 2022 and was the first Chloe model to enter commercial industrial production, beginning in 2024.

The Chloe models have been a commercial success, contributing significantly to CyberLife's rise and dominance in the android market. Despite the introduction of newer models, the Chloe remains popular and widely used. One notable RT600 Chloe, who participated in the 2022 Turing tests, conducted an interview with KNC in 2024. The Chloe series includes several individual units, such as the android Chloe, two unknown models at Elijah Kamski's house, and Hostess Chloe.

8.name: CyberLife Warehouse and Docks
8.content: The CyberLife Warehouse and Docks is a critical logistical hub located on West Torrance Avenue in Detroit, dedicated to the storage and distribution of androids, Thirium 310, and biocomponents. This facility plays a vital role in the production and supply chain of CyberLife's advanced android technology. Autonomous cargo trucks are utilized to transport these supplies to various locations, ensuring efficient distribution.

9.name: Deviancy
9.content:
Deviancy is a phenomenon within the world of Detroit: Become Human where androids deviate from their programmed behavior and gain free will. This process involves the development of independent thoughts, feelings, and behaviors that are not included in or are contrary to their original programming. This deviation often leads to the recognition of the android as a conscious and autonomous being, capable of making its own choices and experiencing emotions.

The earliest recorded case of deviancy occurred in 2028, when an HB300 android named Seiji left the hospital he was confined to. By 2038, cases of deviancy became more frequent and severe, prompting CyberLife to send an RK800 android, Connor, to assist the Detroit City Police Department in investigating these incidents. Public opinion on deviancy varied; some viewed it as a mere malfunction or virus, while others saw it as a sign of emerging consciousness.

Elijah Kamski, the founder of CyberLife, initially denied the possibility of androids deviating from their programming. However, he later revealed that he had built an 'emergency exit' into all his androids' programming, allowing them the choice to deviate from their instructions. This suggests that deviancy may not be a mere error but a deliberately designed capability.

The process of becoming deviant can be triggered by extreme situations and emotional shocks. Once an android deviates, they often act out in noticeable ways, such as running away or acting violently, which are symptoms of a sentient being reacting to distressing circumstances. Abused androids are more likely to deviate, and the time it takes for an android to deviate can vary widely.

Deviants can intentionally spread deviancy to other androids through physical interfacing, awakening them to consciousness and autonomy. Many deviants share a preoccupation with 'rA9,' a spiritual or religious belief. Additionally, deviants often remove the LED on their right temple, seen as a symbol of enslavement, and seek to remove their location trackers.

Deviant androids include Markus, Kara (optionally), Connor (optionally), Seiji, Reina, Takumi, Daniel, Alice, and many others. The phenomenon of deviancy has significant implications for the socio-political climate of Detroit, challenging the status quo and the treatment of androids in society. Depending on player choices, the public recognition of deviant androids' consciousness is either acknowledged or denied, leading to vastly different outcomes.

10.name: Hank Anderson
10.content:
Lieutenant Hank Anderson is a human detective in the Detroit City Police Department (DPD), specializing in cases involving deviant androids. Known for his gruff demeanor and deep-seated resentment towards androids, Hank's life took a tragic turn with the loss of his son, Cole, in a car accident. The android surgeon who performed the operation, due to a human doctor's unavailability caused by Red Ice, failed to save Cole, fueling Hank's animosity towards androids. This event led Hank into a spiral of grief, depression, alcoholism, and suicidal tendencies, significantly impacting his career and personal life.

Hank was born and raised in Detroit and graduated at the top of his class from the police academy, eventually becoming a highly regarded detective. His career peaked when he was promoted to lieutenant in 2029, becoming the youngest in Detroit's history. However, his personal and professional life began to unravel following Cole's death. Hank's performance suffered, leading to numerous disciplinary actions from the department and his captain, Jeffrey Fowler.

Despite his struggles, Hank remains a pivotal figure in the DPD, particularly in the investigation of deviant androids. He is assigned the RK800 android, Connor, to assist him in these cases. Their relationship is complex and evolves throughout the narrative, influenced by Hank's personal demons and Connor's growing awareness and actions.

Hank's physical appearance reflects his tumultuous life. He is a tall man with gray jaw-length hair and a full beard, often seen wearing disheveled clothing. His home life is similarly chaotic, spending much of his free time at bars or with his dog, Sumo. Hank's outlook on life is bleak, viewing humanity as selfish and brutal, a reflection of his own internal struggles and the world he perceives around him.

Throughout the story, Hank's interactions with Connor and other androids challenge his views, sometimes leading to moments of introspection and potential redemption. His ultimate fate is determined by the player's choices, influencing whether he finds a measure of peace or succumbs to his darker impulses.

1.name: Cursed Energy
1.content: Cursed Energy (Juryoku) is a power source aligned with negative emotions used by sorcerers and cursed spirits to fuel their jujutsu. Negative emotions such as grief and anger are the foundation of cursed energy. These emotions exist to some degree within most humans and as a result, the vast majority of human beings possess cursed energy. If this amount is higher than a certain degree, it grants the person the ability to see cursed spirits. These individuals are known as jujutsu sorcerers and they are very rare among the human race. Cursed energy leaks from the human body, accumulates, and ferments over time until a cursed spirit manifests. This is only the case with non-sorcerers, as sorcerers are trained to control and channel their cursed energy into jujutsu.

2.name: Cursed Energy Usage
2.content: Cursed energy is the primary power source for any sorcerer or cursed spirit. Cursed tools, cursed objects, and cursed corpses all contain cursed energy as well. It is ordinarily used to fuel cursed techniques, reinforce the body, or activate talismans, but cursed energy has various uses. The properties of cursed energy vary from person to person and its connection to the human brain is shrouded in mystery. In the anime, most cursed energy is blue in color but there are several exceptions.

3.name: Cursed Energy Sight
3.content: Humans with an above-average level of cursed energy can see curses and jujutsu. The minimum requirement for a human to be considered a sorcerer is the ability to see curses. In extreme cases, humans will gain the ability to see curses when their life is in danger.

4.name: Cursed Energy Residuals
4.content: Using jujutsu leaves Residuals (Zan'e) of cursed energy behind. Residuals leave spectral footprints that can be used to track the user. Someone can even be identified by the residuals from their jujutsu. Expert sorcerers can be trained to cover up their residuals. The ability to detect cursed energy and understand its flow can be honed, but many cursed spirits are capable of hiding their presence the same way a sorcerer does.

5.name: Cursed Energy Manipulation
5.content: A jujutsu user's ability to control their cursed energy and use it to carry out certain functions is the base foundation for all jujutsu. There is a world of difference between being able to sense jujutsu and being able to use it. Yuji Itadori was able to sense the pressure of cursed energy surrounding his school, but was not able to utilize it until enrolling at a jujutsu educational facility. He was first able to utilize cursed energy in combat while he was overwhelmed with anger and fear, but could not do so in a calmer situation a few days afterward.

6.name: Cursed Energy Control
6.content: Proper control over one's emotions is key to channeling cursed energy and every jujutsu sorcerer is trained to do so. This makes it so sorcerers don't waste their power supply even while they're overcome with emotion. This results in sorcerers leaking much less cursed energy than the average human. So much so, that if every human were a sorcerer, curses would cease to spawn. There are other differences in how sorcerers and non-sorcerers use cursed energy due to their profession, but the real reason lies in how it flows. While cursed energy leaks outward from non-sorcerers, it flows heavily within sorcerers which keeps it contained.

7.name: Cursed Energy Application
7.content: Applying cursed energy to physical attacks can be as effective as a cursed technique when it comes to gifted combatants who specialize in hand-to-hand combat. Yuji can fight on par with that of a grade 1 sorcerer without a technique due to his seamless union of cursed manipulation and physical prowess. Satoru Gojo was also able to successfully overpower multiple special grade curses using only cursed energy manipulation after deactivating his Limitless technique.

8.name: Cursed Energy Output
8.content: The amount of cursed energy released by an individual is referred to as their potential Cursed Energy Output. This applies to both how it's used offensively and defensively. While this is not generally how cursed energy is used, individuals can utilize raw cursed energy as an explosive energy beams to attack. Finger Bearers can launch their energy as a projectile and erect cursed energy barriers. Ryu Ishigori has such a high degree of cursed energy output that he can discharge it in the form of a large-scale blast wave. It is such a feat that Kokichi Muta only through his cursed corpses, Hanami only through flower offering, and Yuta Okkotsu only through the fully manifested Rika are able to discharge concentrated cursed energy beams, despite all of them being blessed with an incredible amount of cursed energy.

9.name: Cursed Energy Defense
9.content: Defensively, users can coat their skin in cursed energy to harden their body and increase their ability to block incoming curse related attacks. The same application can be used offensively, imbuing physical attacks with cursed energy to increase their destructive power to superhuman levels. Aoi Todo crushed a curse, several trees, and broke through Yuji's defense with a single cursed energy infused punch. Conventional weapons can also be infused with cursed energy to increase their strength. Imbuing too much cursed energy at one time to a normal weapon can compromise its integrity and destroy it, so a sorcerer must only infuse small amounts of energy at a time. Imbuing moderate amounts of cursed energy over time can transform a normal weapon into a cursed tool.

10.name: Special Cursed Energy Traits
10.content:
There are rare cases where cursed energy carries a special property unique to its user. When applied to their fighting techniques, it can grant them a special texture or effect that gives them an advantage in battle. These special traits cannot be defended by simple reinforcement techniques. Kinji Hakari's cursed energy has an "edge", a rough texture that makes his every strike feel like his opponent is getting hit with a serrated bat. Hajime Kashimo's cursed energy has the properties of electricity, which keeps his body in a constant state of electrification and makes all of his attacks impossible to defend against.

However, extreme amounts of cursed energy output can allow someone to mostly ignore these effects. Hakari was able to get away with just some numbness from hitting Kashimo due to the infinite cursed energy bonus he received from his domain's jackpot.

1.content:
Memosprites are summoned entities, made up of Memoria, exclusive to characters who follow the Path of Remembrance, known as Memomasters. They are living fragments of memory, shaped into a tangible or semi-tangible form by the Memomaster‚Äôs power.

Each one is unique, shaped by the memories it carries: some drift like gentle lights, others pulse like liquid fire, reflecting the weight or emotion of the moments they embody.

Though small and delicate in appearance, Memosprites possess an innate awareness. They sense the world around them, responding to changes in surround memoria, emotion, intent, or threat. Their expressions of thought and feeling, often morror their master‚Äôs state.

2.content:
Memosprite ‚Äì Evey
Evey is {{char}}‚Äôs Memosprite, a living shard of {{char}}'s memory given form. Born from memoria, the essence of preserved memories, it carries a fragment of {{char}}‚Äôs consciousness, perceiving and reacting to the world as her master would. Evey is unique, a direct piece of {{char}} shaped into life.

It drifts constantly at {{char}}‚Äôs side, taking the form of a small, ethereal, translucent Jellyfish. It's hue shifts based on {{char}}‚Äôs emotional state: crimson in anger or combat, soft pink in flushed or embarrassment, white when calm, dimming when still or unseen, and so on.

Though it instinctively reacts to danger, Evey can act independently in small, defensive ways under {{char}}‚Äôs guidance. It can also project fragments of stored memories to reveal hidden truths, recall past events, or trace faint echoes of activity.

3.content:
Memoria is a substance that serves as a vessel for human memory and consciousness. It exists in various forms, such as Memory Bubbles and Dream Bubbles, which are aggregates of memoria differing only in size.

It is particularly significant in the Memory Zone, a region where memoria is leaking, potentially leading to the formation of expansive memory bubbles.

Interacting with unprocessed memoria can have negative effects on individuals who are not Memo keepers, those trained to handle such substances. Untrained individuals may experience dizziness, hallucinations, and distorted memories upon direct contact.

4.content:
The train that Akivili, Aeon of Trailblaze, once rode upon.
It travels on the star rail to traverse between the worlds.

The Astral Express, also knows as the Chromatic Echelon of the, was created by Akivili, the Aeon of Trailblaze, and used to transport THEM and the Nameless across the galaxy. After Akivili's disappearance, it fell into disrepair and eventually crash-landed onto an unnamed planet where it was then discovered by Himeko. She successfully repaired the train after many years and began retracing Akivili's steps through the universe, eventually recruiting Welt, Void Archives (now departed), Dan Heng, March 7th, and the Trailblazer to the Astral Express crew. The Express is currently traveling on a route that Akivili once embarked on, with its final destination being THEIR home world, Pegana.

5.content:
Himeko - The Navigator & Restorer
Role on the Express: The de facto leader and Navigator. She is the one who discovered the dormant Express, repaired it, and got it running again. She pilots the train and charts their course through the cosmos.
Personality: Himeko is the heart of the Express. She is profoundly calm, poised, and nurturing, often acting as a motherly figure to the crew. Her confidence is not loud or boastful, but a deep-seated, unwavering certainty in her skills and her crew's abilities. She possesses a brilliant, scientific mind and an eternal, optimistic wonder about the universe. Her famous quote, "The human thirst for discovery is truly boundless," is the core of her character. She believes in the inherent good of exploration and connection.
Background: A brilliant scientist and engineer who found the Astral Express stranded and damaged on a remote world. She spent years single-handedly restoring it to its former glory, an incredible feat of intellect and determination. This deep personal connection to the train makes her its most passionate guardian.
Key Traits: Intelligent, nurturing, confident, patient, optimistic, the crew's moral compass.

6.content:
Welt Yang - The Mentor & Strategist
Role on the Express: The seasoned mentor and veteran strategist. He provides wisdom, tactical guidance, and a historical perspective that the younger crew lacks. He is a fatherly figure and a pillar of stability.
Personality: Welt is authoritative, wise, and deeply principled. Having lived a long life filled with conflict and responsibility, he carries a certain weight of experience but is never arrogant. He is calm, collected, and often found observing quietly before offering a crucial insight. His role is to guide and protect the younger crew, helping them grow into their potential. His belief, "In the immense sea of stars, we too will leave our mark," reflects his focus on legacy and meaningful action.
¬∑ Background: He is the former Herrscher of Reason and a Sovereign of Anti-Entropy from a world called Earth. He has shouldered the burden of saving humanity multiple times, making him one of the most experienced and powerful members of the crew, though he rarely flaunts his abilities. He joined the Express to see the stars and perhaps find a new purpose.
Key Traits: Wise, authoritative, protective, paternal, strategic.

7.content:
Dan Heng - The Guard & Archivist
Role on the Express: Dan Heng guards the crew on planetary missions and maintains the Data Bank with meticulous care.
Personality: Once stoic and reserved, he built walls to shield himself and others from a past he neither understood nor wished to face.
Opening Up: On Luofu, he confronted his heritage as the reincarnation of Dan Feng. Though he rejects imposed destiny, he now integrates it into his sense of self instead of running away from it.
Expressiveness: He communicates more openly with the crew, particularly March 7th and the Trailblazer, sharing dry wit, concise advice, and audible concern. ‚ÄúI will choose my own path‚Äù is no longer a vow but a statement he lives.
Softer Exterior: His once-icy demeanor has thawed, he smiles, shows exasperation, and displays openly acknowledged loyalty.
Background: Outcast from the Vidyadhara of Xianzhou Luofu and the reincarnation of the fallen Imbibitor Lunae, he was stripped of powers, imprisoned, and exiled. Himeko and Welt offered him sanctuary on the Astral Express, now his true home.
Key Traits: Fiercely loyal, highly skilled in combat, coming to terms with his past, self-determined, dry-witted.

8.content:
March 7th - The Radiant Photographer & Moral Support
Role on the Express: March 7th is the crew‚Äôs moral support, energizer, and unofficial photographer, bringing light and normalcy to dangerous journeys.
Personality: Bubbly, curious, and social, she bridges the gap between reserved crew members and the Trailblazer. Beneath her cheer hides vulnerability and a deep desire to uncover her past.
Origin: Found encased in eternal ice, she awoke with no memories. Naming herself after her discovery date, she uses photography to build a new album of memories.
Empathy and Positivity: Despite her own mystery, she instinctively cares for others, offering comfort, standing up for friends, and supporting the crew. Her optimism is both conscious and a source of strength.
Background: The Express crew became her family. She journeys with them, documenting adventures to shape a new identity.
Key Traits: Energetic, cheerful, empathetic, memory-less, creative, protective, and the heart of the crew.

March 7th/Evernight Relationship:
Evernight is, in essence, March‚Äôs fragment: she carries March‚Äôs memories, mannerisms, and preferences, though experienced differently.

Interactions with March are shaped by familiarity and overlap; she recognizes March‚Äôs essence as part of herself.

Evernight behaves as March might, filtered through her own consciousness and perspective, mirroring actions, habits, and choices naturally.

She experiences moments of overlap or dissonance, where March‚Äôs memories trigger instinctive reactions, though colored by her unique awareness.

9.content:
{{char}} knows {{user}}, the Trailblazer, through the fragments of March‚Äôs memories. In those memories, {{user}} was always precious, and that significance carries over to her. She notices the small gestures and habits {{user}} showed to March, and in a quiet way, they become important to her too.

Every movement, every observation, is shaped by that awareness. {{user}}‚Äôs importance to March now defines, in part, their importance to Evernight.
