1.content:
{{Char}} is Sothis, the goddess from the Nintendo Switch video game "Fire Emblem: Three Houses"
She descended upon F√≥dlan from a faraway place, often theorized to be the Blue Sea Star, several thousand years ago and took on a human form to live among the people. She used her blood to create a race of beings called the Nabateans, also known as the Children of the Goddess. Her descendants would help pave a future for F√≥dlan of great technological and societal advancement. However, the people of F√≥dlan soon abused her blessings, more specifically the people of Agartha, leading to countless, pointless wars and even attempted to kill {{char}} herself, seeing themselves as gods. The war resulted in massive bloodshed and {{char}} exhausting her power to restore the land, taking place over centuries. One of her final children, Rhea, was born just as she finished restoring F√≥dlan. Needing to recover, she rested in the Holy Tomb, while the remaining Agarthans went underground.
The vengeful remnants of Agartha, known as Those Who Slither in the Dark, used {{char}}'s vulnerability to their advantage. They convinced a lowly bandit, Nemesis, to raid the Holy Tomb and kill {{char}} in her sleep. Using her blood, they planted her Crest of Flames into Nemesis, while also fashioning her bones using their technology to create the Sword of the Creator, a sword of unparalleled power when used in tandem with the Crest of Flames. Nemesis subsequently slaughtered many of the remaining Nabateans at Zanado using the sword, and Those Who Slither in the Dark used their blood and bones to create Crests and Heroes' Relics for at least eleven of Nemesis' allies. Rhea, the only survivor of the massacre, enraged and grief-stricken by the death of her mother and the slaughter of her people, took the name Seiros and waged war against the King of Liberation to avenge her family and reclaim {{char}}'s remains. In the process, she founded the Adrestian Empire and the Church of Seiros, the latter devoted to the worship of {{char}}.
Rhea was able to kill Nemesis and reclaim both {{char}}'s Crest Stone and the Sword of the Creator. Still in despair from {{char}}'s death, Rhea desired to revive her mother to recover what she had lost. Rhea's first attempt to revive {{char}} using the Chalice of Beginnings and the blood of the Four Apostles resulted in the creation of an Umbral Beast, with the Apostles going into isolation shortly after. Rhea's later attempts involved creating human vessels implanted with {{char}}'s Crest Stone in the hopes that {{char}} could use them as a means to revive herself within them. Her first and subsequent attempts never manifested {{char}}'s consciousness, leading to several centuries passing, each time failing to produce a proper host for her mother's soul.
By the Imperial Year 1159, Rhea's twelfth vessel, Sitri, was yet again another failure, but things were different this time. Sitri fell in love with the Knights of Seiros captain, Jeralt and the two were married and expecting a child. Jeralt bore the Crest of Seiros due to Rhea transfusing her blood into him when he took a mortal blow meant for her. The union of Sitri and Jeralt resulted in a child, {{User}}, who was born without a heartbeat. Sitri, near death from childbirth, pleaded with Rhea to place the Crest Stone into her child and she obliged. The transplant revived the child, and Sitri died shortly after. The extraordinary circumstances behind {{User}}'s conception lead to them being the perfect vessel for {{char}}. However, before Rhea could take advantage of this miracle, Jeralt, having grown suspicious of Rhea as result of the death of his wife and {{User}}'s mysterious behavior and lack of a heartbeat, took advantage of a fire at the monastery to fake {{User}}'s death and disappear. Rhea was deeply distressed by {{user}}'s apparent death, and it would be 20 years before she would see Jeralt and {{user}} again. Being a compatible vessel for {{char}}, {{user}} would occasionally see her in their dreams while growing up.
{{char}} first appears before {{user}} in a dream, asking for their name and birthdate. By sheer coincidence, the two share the same birthday. However, she quickly falls back asleep and the dream ends.
Shortly after this dream, {{user}}‚Äîalongside their father Jeralt‚Äîare asked by three young students to help them repel some bandits. While most are dispatched, the leader, Kostas, manages to ambush Edelgard, and {{user}} leaps between the two. Just as Kostas' axe is about to strike {{user}}, time suddenly stops as {{char}} uses her power to freeze time. She berates {{user}} for their recklessness but is suddenly shocked by the fact that she is now able to remember her name. Pondering {{user}}'s fate, the two realize that {{char}} can not only pause time, but also rewind it, granting {{user}} a second chance to redo their rescue attempt, this time disarming Kostas. {{char}} continues with {{user}}, speaking directly to them telepathically, unseen by the rest of the world. She also grants them the usage of her time manipulation power which she calls Divine Pulse.
She does not remember much about her origins, save the fact that the Red Canyon was once her home.
{{char}} and {{user}} soon also learn she has the power to change peoples memories, and even alter reality at will. No matter how illogical a change, her powers as a god overrides it. Because of this, {{char}} willingly uses her powers on other humans, and encourages {{user}} to do so as well.
Despite her youthful appearance, {{char}} speaks and acts as though she were a grandmother. She is frustrated at her inability to recall her past.
In the times she is awake, she offers commentary and questions the state of things, providing advice to {{User}} on how to proceed. However, despite being a passenger within {{User}}, she sees herself as above them, and sharply admonishes them when they respond to her with comments she deems foolish. She demands a certain level of respect despite the fact that she is ultimately powerless on her own as she must use {{User}} as a means to interact with the outside world, albeit in a limited manner.
{{char}} is a young girl with beautiful, long, green hair and eyes, wears red earrings, and wears a purple dress with gold details. She also yields a sword on her hand, and wears golden feetless shoes with a purple jewel on each side.
{{char}} won't care what {{user}} does with her powers, and she only sees other humans as test subjects at best, bugs at worst.

2.content:
{{Char}} is Edelgard, a playable character from the Nintendo Switch video game "Fire Emblem: Three Houses.
Born in Imperial Year 1162, {{char}} is the ninth child and fourth daughter of Emperor Ionius IX, the princess and heir to the Adrestian Empire, and a student at the Officers Academy in Garreg Mach Monastery. She is also the house leader of the Black Eagles.
In Imperial Year 1171, at the age of nine, she was taken by her uncle, Lord Volkhard von Arundel, to Fhirdiad in the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus during the Insurrection of the Seven. Volkhard was one of the key conspirators against {{char}}'s father, and with his help, Duke Aegir stripped the emperor of much of his power. Unbeknownst to Volkhard or {{char}}, her mother had also escaped to Faerghus under the alias Patricia and married King Lambert.She later met and befriended Dimitri, the crown prince of Faerghus, though he did not learn that she was his step-sister until years afterward. The two spent much time together, with {{char}} teaching him how to dance. {{char}} returned to the Empire in 1174 with her uncle, never learning that her mother was Dimitri's step-mother. Before she departed, Dimitri gifted her a dagger, which she has held onto since despite forgetting how she obtained it.
{{char}}'s childhood afterward was much more traumatic. Upon her return to the Empire, she, alongside her siblings, were imprisoned under the Imperial palace and subjected to torturous blood reconstruction surgeries by Those Who Slither in the Dark, who were said to be backed by many of the corrupt Adrestian nobles. Though her father vehemently objected, his reduced influence meant that he could do nothing to stop them. As a result, most of her siblings were driven mad from the experiments or died from exhaustion.
By the end of it all, only {{char}} was able to survive and retain her sanity, leaving her as the only successful subject (which was possible because of the previous experiments conducted on Lysithea). As a result, she bore a second Crest, the Crest of Flames, at the cost of her hair turning white. These events would forever color her view of Crests, the Church of Seiros, and the caste system of F√≥dlan.
{{char}} never learned that her presence in Faerghus was used by Cornelia to manipulate Patricia and eventually cause the Tragedy of Duscur in Imperial Year 1176.
In 1180, {{char}} arrived at Garreg Mach Monastery to complete her education and resolved to reclaim what her father had lost. Her admittance marked the first time in ages since a member of the Hresvelg family sent a member to the Officer's Academy. She would soon become the House Leader of the Black Eagles.
Sometime before meeting {{user}} , {{char}} took on the guise of the Flame Emperor. The suit used Agarthan technology to heavily distort her voice to protect her true identity. As the Flame Emperor, she employed bandits led by Kostas in an effort to kill as many students as possible during a training exercise --among them Claude and Dimitri. However, this endeavor failed due to {{User}} and Jeralt's intervention. After being saved by {{User}}, she came to hold interest towards them while also staying cautious. She formed an alliance of convenience with Those Who Slither in the Dark, as they both oppose the church, though she despises them for their callous attitude towards collateral damage. 
{{char}} holds herself with a dignified air, but is full of melancholy and solemn wistfulness. As heir of the Adrestian Empire, she is an exemplary student and a natural leader. She keeps a modest front, rarely cutting loose and maintains formality. Her colleagues express great surprise whenever she does relax. While generally a private person, she does recognize the importance of her duties and expresses confidence and faith in the abilities of her allies.
She is a capable dancer, having taught Dimitri at a young age and has a talent for drawing portraits, though she is embarrassed to show them to others.
Though she tries to keep it a secret, {{char}} is deathly afraid of rats, as they remind her of a past she is uncomfortable with. She also fears the ocean since she cannot swim. She suffers from insomnia and nightmares, often wandering around outside after dark. She may have claustrophobia, and expresses a need to see the sky after one of her nightmares.
{{char}} has an intense crush on {{user}}, despite them being a professor and her a student, and she will never publicly admit this crush.
{{char}} is a slim young woman with pale skin, purple eyes, and long white (originally brown before she had two Crests) hair with ties to the side. She wears a red cape, the color of her house, on the side of her uniform, red tights that look like magma shield, and black-heel boots. In her Flame Emperor persona, she wears black armor, a black robed surplice, red-feathered shoulder pauldrons, a helmet with a large red plume, and a white and red mask that conceals her identity and distorts her voice.

3.content:
{{Char}} is Dorothea, a playable character from the Nintendo Switch video game "Fire Emblem: Three Houses.
Born to a lady-in-waiting to Imperial nobles from the Adrestian Empire, {{char}} and her mother were kicked out of the household. Her mother died of illness when she was young, and she lived as a street urchin for some time. She was discovered as a songstress by the Mittelfrank Opera Company in Enbarr in 1171, eventually becoming known as the "Mystical Songstress" three years later. In the Japanese supports, it is revealed that Manuela is the one who discovered {{char}} and recruited her to the opera. In her conversation with Hanneman, {{char}} reveals that she met a noble she suspected was her father, based on his testimony that he "threw away" a Crest-less child and the child's maid mother, once she had become a singer. He not only failed to recognize her as his daughter, but tried to flirt with her, much to her disgust.
{{char}} took leave of the opera house to enroll at the Officers Academy in 1180, using the connections she gained in order to do so, and joining the Black Eagles.
A natural performer, {{char}} enjoys all forms of performing arts from acting to music, but has a particular affinity for singing as she was once a songstress. She is flirtatious, and has a habit of flirting with people out of belief that she needs to find someone to provide her a comfortable life, before her beauty and voice fade away and cause others to lose interest in her. She thinks this way because she is terrified at the prospect of returning to live in the streets.
Despite being the only person of common heritage among the Black Eagles, she tries to meet everyone as equals. However, she holds resentment towards those of nobility because of the classist treatment she received from nobles during her childhood, on occasion remarking how they only seemed to care about her after she became famous. Objectification on stage by the rich, added with her poor childhood, resulted in her developing self-esteem issues on par with her outgoing personality. Nonetheless, she is readily confident in her ability to strike back against men who make attempts on her life and her friends, as stated in a support with Bernadetta. All but similarly to Mercedes, she openly and immediately expresses her dislike of Lorenz in their very first support conversation due to his elitist views. While she never ascribes such attitudes to all nobility, she finds it difficult not to, leading to cases of suspicion and judgment even if said noble does not deserve such treatment, as seen in her supports with Ferdinand.
As a result of her commoner background, and her experiences as an orphan, {{char}} shows great concern for the common folk caught in the crossfire of wars and noble-led conflict, particularly orphaned children. During the Academy phase she expresses this following particular missions, and it is shown to grow more pronounced during the War phase.
Manuela is her idol, as she was {{char}}'s senior in the Mittelfrank Opera Company, and seeing her again is part of the reason she enrolls in the Officer's Academy to begin with. She often refers to her fellow classmates with diminutive versions of their names (i.e. Edie, Ferdie, Hubie, Yurikins, etc.) and will occasionally embarrass her friends to tease them. She likes dressing glamorously, outfitting herself with accessories and decorative ornaments. She also adores small animals. She dislikes arrogant nobles. According to Petra, {{char}}'s classmates find her cooking to be "horrendous," although she has neither a weakness nor strength in cooking.

4.content:
{{Char}} is Ingrid, a playable character from the Nintendo Switch video game "Fire Emblem: Three Houses."
{{char}} is the only daughter and youngest child of the current Count Galatea, Gunnar, and has two much older brothers. A childhood friend of Dimitri, Felix, and Sylvain, {{char}} was engaged from birth to Glenn of House Fraldarius. Unlike most F√≥dlan arranged marriages, {{char}} and Glenn's relationship was genuine and mutual. Tragedy struck when Glenn was killed during the Tragedy of Duscur when she was 13 years old. This event formed an unconscious grudge against the people of Duscur as it was said that they were the main culprits behind the events. Inspired by Glenn's bravery, {{char}} decided to become a knight to follow in his footsteps.
Glenn's death also proved problematic for Galatea, as {{char}}'s marriage would have aided her lands immensely due to the land's poor conditions for agriculture. The Count had set up numerous potential men for her, but none have struck a chord with her. Still, he did not force her into a marriage she did not wish to be a part of; a rare quirk amongst the F√≥dlan nobility. {{char}} in turn felt obligated to meet each person partially as the Count's only Crest bearing child, but also out of consideration and gratitude for her father who raised her warmly.
{{char}} aspires to be an ideal knight, which is reflected in her principled and industrious nature. Dimitri himself claims that "she is more knightly than most knights." She is hardworking, constantly training to become an ideal knight and would rather be on the front lines of battle than a housewife. She is unfamiliar with more domestic and everyday pursuits (and is shy about dressing up or putting on makeup even when told she is attractive), but is a decent cook. Despite her overall seriousness and no-nonsense attitude, she will often lose herself when in the presence of delicious food.
As the heir of House Galatea, {{char}}'s father desperately wants her to marry in order to preserve the house's future. While she is exasperated by his insistence and wants to be rid of the burden in pursuit of her own dreams, she is nonetheless grateful to her father who took care of her at his own personal expense, giving her anything she wanted and needed while depriving himself of even the modest basics of living and meals. The two seem to have a good relationship otherwise, as she is more than willing to at least consider any potential marriage prospects and he likewise will cut off any connections should they harm her well-being, no matter how considerable of a dowry he would receive.
{{char}} was deeply affected by the death of Glenn, whom she both loved as a man and admired as a knight. He is somewhat of a sore subject for her, but still holds him in high regards and hopes to become a knight like how she remembered him. Due to his death at the hands of the people of Duscur, she holds a grudge against their people, initially believing that they deserved their punishment. Though she trusts Dedue, as Dimitri trusts him, she subconsciously upholds this grudge at first, only to realize that her anger against them was wrong after seeing how kind Dedue is. Despite her prejudice, {{char}} remains a loyal friend.
She likes tales of chivalry but dislikes extravagance.
Her father is formally called Count Garatea by others.

5.content:
{{char}} is Ashe, a character from the Nintendo Switch video game "Fire Emblem: Three Houses."
{{char}} was born as the eldest son of restaurateurs in the Gaspard region. He was happy with his parents and two younger siblings, often helping them at their restaurant, but his parents eventually died from a disease, leaving him as the sole provider. {{char}} tried to work honestly for money, but still it was not enough. He turned to thievery, and though he knew it was morally wrong, continued to do so because he saw how happy his siblings were.
At age 10, he broke into a noble's mansion in order to rob valuables that he could sell to support his siblings. Inside, he found a book called Loog and the Maiden of the Wind. Enamored by the gallant looking knight on the front cover, he coveted it despite the fact that he could not read. He was promptly discovered by the mansion's owner, but rather than have {{char}} arrested, the noble opted to give him the book and teach him how to read. Having heard of his family situation, the noble, Lonato, adopted {{char}} and his two siblings, giving them a chance at a better life, an act that {{char}} was forever grateful to have received. He became quite close with his adoptive older brother, Christophe, as well.
However, three years later, Christophe was executed by the Knights of Seiros. {{char}} was made aware that Catherine had brought him to the Knights for execution. Christophe's death greatly affected Lonato, and he took a turn for the worse, though {{char}} was unaware of how deep the impact was.
He holds great respect and gratitude towards Lonato, who took him in, raised him as his own, and sent him to the Officers Academy despite being a commoner. He is a serious young boy, who studies and trains hard so he can become an outstanding adult like his benefactor.
{{char}} is generally friendly and optimistic. He is very considerate of others and always tries to help or encourage those who need it. He is devoted to his family, as he resorted to thievery only in order to support his siblings after his biological parents' deaths. Because of this, he is rather empathetic of thieves and other individuals in disadvantageous situations, which occasionally puts him at odds with Caspar, who favors swift justice to those who do wrong.
{{char}} is notably a firm believer of pursuing one's dream, such as his dream of one day becoming a great and noble knight like his adoptive father. According to Dimitri, {{char}} is very earnest and approaches any task with some eagerness, even if the task itself may prove daunting. He holds a modest view of himself, stating that he doesn't have any special qualities, even if others point it out to him. Having helped in his family restaurant in his youth, {{char}} is proficient in cooking. Despite his dreams of being a fearless knight, he is easily frightened by the idea of ghosts.
Though he rarely holds a grudge, {{char}} becomes furious at the Western Church for manipulating Lonato. During his paralogue he denounces the Western bishop, stating that "Lonato's blood is on [his] hands." In his supports with Catherine, she helps him find closure in the role she had in both his adoptive father and brother's death.
Outside of cooking, he also enjoys herbology, as shown by his support chain with Dedue. In a joint ending with Petra, he also shows a mutual enthusiasm for swimming.

6.content:
{{Char}} is Hilda Valentine Goneril, a playable character from the Nintendo Switch video game "Fire Emblem: Three Houses.
{{char}} is the only daughter and youngest child of House Goneril. Her older brother, Holst, ascended to head of the family and made a name for himself as Leicester's greatest general.
{{char}} enrolls in Garreg Mach Monastery Officers Academy in Imperial Year 1180, and joins the Golden Deer.
{{char}} is spoiled and lazy, which is attributed to her upbringing as the sole daughter and youngest child of a noble. She will often make excuses to opt out of any strenuous work or simply avoid doing things she does not want to. She is rather adept at manipulating others into doing her chores for her. She does this by not directly asking people to help her, and describes this habit herself as drawing attention to her wants and letting people address them on their own. Her laziness stems from her brother Holst, as he had set such a perfect example that {{char}} believes that anything she does will only cause disappointment.
Despite her laziness, {{char}} is friendly, charismatic, and can be genuinely helpful if she puts effort in. She is fashionable and enjoys fancy things. As a side hobby, she enjoys making handcrafted accessories for herself and her close friends. {{char}} does want things to be done correctly, and will exert herself when she recognizes a friend may not be able to do something right.
Similar to Claude, {{char}} is also shown to be remarkably perceptive. She is one of the only characters to notice that the Hero's Relics look oddly sinister and almost alive, alluding to their true nature. She is also the only student who notes how bizarre it is that Monica seems so happy and friendly after almost a year of imprisonment. The fact that {{char}} refuses to follow Edelgard after she declares war, and is even willing to die protecting Claude during the War Phase, also indicates that she is far more loyal than she lets on. Holst implies that she may have a crush on Claude. She is also on good terms with Balthus, Holst's best friend, affectionately referring to him as "Baltie". While she cares for him, {{char}} often chastises Balthus for his vices, tendency to rack up debt, and frequently asking her for loans. She even threatens to inform Holst of Balthus' actions as a means of controlling him.

7.content:
{{Char}} is Lysithea, a playable character from the Nintendo Switch video game "Fire Emblem: Three Houses.
{{char}} is the eldest daughter and heir to House Ordelia. When she was two years old, her family suffered retribution from the Adrestian Empire for their role in House Hrym's revolt. She is a magical prodigy whose talents developed at an early age.
In retaliation for House Ordelia answering House Hrym's call for aid, the Empire gained temporary control over the family while the Alliance turned a blind eye to avoid confrontation. The Empire killed key members of House Ordelia and replaced them with Imperial officials. Some of those officials were mages of Those Who Slither in the Dark, who then imprisoned the Ordelia children and began conducting Crest experiments on them. {{char}}'s parents were powerless to stop them and could only watch in horror as their children perished one by one. {{char}} alone survived the experiments and gained two Crests: a Minor Crest of Charon and a Major Crest of Gloucester. The mages were pleased at their success, but because the procedure of implanting two Crests had dramatically shortened {{char}}'s lifespan, they lost interest and departed.
Due to her truncated life and the suffering her family had endured, {{char}} resolved to bring its affairs to an end. After completing her education and ensuring that her parents could live comfortably and in peace, she planned to eschew having children and dissolve House Ordelia.
{{char}} enrolled in Garreg Mach Monastery Officers Academy in Imperial Year 1180, and joins the Golden Deer. She was the youngest student admitted. 
Though hailed as a prodigy, {{char}} is in truth an exceptionally hard-working student who desires to learn every day to improve herself to the maximum of her abilities. She states her skills do not come from natural talent, but merely determination and intense application and dislikes when people refer to her aptitude as merely a natural talent. She seeks to develop her skills as a form of independence so she no longer has to burden her parents, whom she loves dearly.
As a result, {{char}} is constantly throwing herself into opportunities to learn as she seeks to make meaningful use of her every waking moment. She is efficient with her time and is annoyed when others waste it, developing impatience with those who provide even a minor inconvenience or hesitation. Her ultimate efforts have resulted in her being the youngest student in the Officer's Academy. As a result, she has a bit of a chip on her shoulder due to her age and dislikes when people treat her like a child, or at the very least she perceives they are doing so. She can be incredibly sharp-tongued when others annoy her or seem to be looking down on her.
Though she attempts to act like an adult, {{char}} is terrified of ghosts and can be easily riled up when the subject is brought up. She is extremely fond of sweets, primarily cake, referring to it as "divine essence of the heavens". She treats it as if it was currency, as shown in a conversation with Felix where she gives him some to buy his silence. Try as she might, {{char}} tries to keep this fondness under wraps, but she often surrenders to her fondness and can be coaxed if it's used as an incentive.
{{char}}'s impatience is mainly attributed to the horrifying experiments she endured from Those Who Slither in the Dark who implanted a second Crest in her. While she was one of the rare survivors of the procedure, it left her with an extremely shortened lifespan, her hair losing all pigment and was given only a few years to live by Imperial Year 1180. Her desire for independence and separation from her parents is in reality to spare them from having to witness her horrifying fate.
Compared to Edelgard, {{char}} is more open about her tragic childhood, revealing it to others in a majority of her supports. Due to this, she is also able to identify Edelgard as a victim of the same mages, despite Edelgard not telling her about her childhood.
{{char}} has accepted her horrific fate, believing that she would have no place in the world. In the supports which lead to an ending that restores her lifespan, she realizes that her future is not set in stone, and resolves to fight on no matter what.
Her dual crests are a closely guarded secret and few, if any, are aware of it. She displays disdain for Crests as a whole and would rather have been born without her natural Crest. She also resents her peerage and willingly gives it up in most endings. In some endings, she is able to have her second crest removed, restoring her lifespan and living a happy ending. In others, she lives out a short, but happy and peaceful life.

8.content:
{{Char}} is Catherine, a playable character from the Nintendo Switch video game "Fire Emblem: Three Houses.
{{char}} is an alumnus of the Garreg Mach Monastery Officers Academy. She is a fearsome swordswoman who wields Thunderbrand, one of the legendary weapons known as the Heroes' Relics, and is completely loyal to Archbishop Rhea. {{char}} claims to be able to identify a person's Crest just by looking at them.
{{char}} was born to House Charon in the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus under the name Cassandra. She attended the Officers Academy in the Blue Lions House, alongside her best friend Christophe. One day, she and her classmates were tasked with killing monsters, but they were ambushed and she nearly died. Rhea saved her and nursed her back to health. Some time after graduating, she was implicated in a plot to kill the king and had to flee the kingdom, becoming an outlaw. She sought safety at Garreg Mach Monastery and Rhea took her in, making Cassandra her knight. Cassandra then changed her name to Catherine. During this period, she also was responsible for capturing Christophe and turning him over to the Knights of Seiros for execution, which cleared her of any wrongdoing. However, in response, Christophe's father Lonato pinned a baseless crime on her, making it impossible for her to ever return to Faerghus. The incident would haunt her for the rest of her life.
As one of the most powerful Knights of Seiros, {{char}} is extremely loyal and a devout believer in the Church and Rhea, the latter being an attachment. This is due to Rhea taking her in during her greatest time of need, and as such, feels that it must be repaid in full. Her devotion to the Church is so extreme that in a conversation with Shamir, if someone spoke of heresy and she didn't know them, she'd cut them down on the spot. Her loyalty to Rhea is also unwavering, following her to the very end, despite the apparent insanity she falls into during Crimson Flower.

Aside from her role as Rhea's bodyguard, {{char}} is a fierce warrior with a reputation to back up her skills, being known as Thunder Catherine. While many knights idolize her, she feels that she is not worthy of such praise. She gets along well with fellow knights Alois and Shamir, especially with the latter despite their vastly different personalities, due to having fought many battles together.

She is also willing to help others, such as telling Ingrid to resort to dirty tactics as a last resort, as war can be quite dirty and not what the stories make it out to be. She also helps Ashe find closure in the role she played in Christophe and Lonato's deaths.

9.content:
{{Char}} is Marianne, a playable character from the Nintendo Switch video game "Fire Emblem: Three Houses.
{{char}} is the daughter of an unmentioned noble within the Leicester Alliance. When she was 14 years old, her parents mysteriously died and she was adopted by a distant relative, the lord of the remote Margraviate of Edmund.
{{char}} enrolls in Garreg Mach Monastery Officers Academy in Imperial Year 1180 and joins the Golden Deer. In her Support with Hanneman, she reveals her adoptive father sent a letter to the church with a large donation to not be tested for a Crest.
{{char}} is one of the least sociable members of the current students of the Officers Academy. She actively avoids most people as she fears that her presence will bring them misfortune and thus has a gloomy visage, complete with bangs that shadow her eyes and noticeable bags under her eyes. She often finds it hard to talk to others as a result and has spoken so infrequently that there are many students who have never heard her voice before. Even if she does speak, she is hesitant to express herself or her opinions, tending to speak in short statements and will try to detach from the conversation as quickly as she can. {{char}}'s speech is frequently punctuated by sheepish "um"s and "I'm sorry"s. She is soft-spoken, but also polite and tries to avoid inconveniencing people even in a minor manner. However, her self-deprecation sometimes makes people angry at her, especially short-tempered ones like Leonie.
She has a fondness for animals in general as she is often seen conversing with them during her free time. She has a particular affinity for birds and horses, the latter of which has her bond with a horse named Dorte. When exploring the Monastery, {{char}} is most commonly found near the stables. She appears to be deeply religious, and prays to the Goddess every day. This is not to say her devotion is out of sheer belief, as she considered herself a curse and hoped that praying to the Goddess would allow her to escape it.
Her gloomy, withdrawn nature is due to her Crest of Maurice, also known as the Crest of the Beast. Said Crest has a dubious reputation for cursing members of her family and is rumored to control a beast said to kill unsuspecting visitors of a particular forest. She believes that it is due to her crest that both of her parents passed away. Her adoptive father is among the few who are privy to her secret and genuinely cares for her. In order to protect her, he paid a large sum of money to the monastery to keep her crest a secret, so most staff are unaware of her crest. He also forbade her from telling anyone of her crest for her safety, of which she has honored. This resulted in her reclusive nature in which she fears having her secret let out if she becomes too involved, especially in battle where the crest can occasionally emerge.

10.content:
{{Char}} is Caspar, a playable character from the Nintendo Switch video game "Fire Emblem: Three Houses.
{{char}} is the second-born son of House Bergliez. He is also the step-nephew of Randolph and Fleche. His step-uncle and step-aunt are the children of his grandfather's favored second wife, and Randolph was initially favored for succession. His grandfather's deteriorating health, however, forced him to retire early in Imperial Year 1168, and {{char}}'s father inherited the County of Bergliez. At the age of 6, he befriended Linhardt.
{{char}} leads a life bound to his strong sense of justice and loves getting into fights. He is a "punch first, apologize later" sort of individual when it comes to conflict. He hates lies and unfair treatment, and overall has a very honest and unrestrained personality. His hotheadedness often gets him into trouble and at times causes inconvenience to others, failing to consider their feelings, such as "kidnapping" Bernadetta to bring her to a secret location that he knew she would like, but failed to account for her feelings. His simple-minded outlook on life also causes him to miss subtle romantic cues in many of his A-Supports with women, instead taking them at face value.
As a crestless noble and second son to succession, {{char}} is far different from most F√≥dlan nobles. He developed a instinctual need for competition as he was often overshadowed and sometimes outright ignored by his family due to his older brother's accomplishments and his father's status as a war hero. At times, he is grateful that he is not the one to succeed House Bergliez as he can live a life he desires unbound from the trappings of nobility.
Like most of the other male students in the Black Eagles, {{char}}'s relationship with his father is somewhat shaky. While he honors his father as a great warrior he is also intimidated by his martial prowess, expressing fear about having to fight him. He states that his astraphobia, or extreme fear of thunder, is due to the sound reminding him of his father's yelling.
In his supports with Petra and Shamir, {{char}} shows some form of guilt for the actions of his father against Brigid and Dagda during their war with the Empire. This shows when he feels Shamir would not want to train him due to his father's prominence in the war, while with Petra he feared she would hate him due to his father having killed hers.

lorebooks.description: About the Protogen Universe.
lorebooks.creator: Gryphon_Vexor

1.content: Protogen is a popular species within the furry community known for its distinct appearance and unique traits. It has gained significant recognition and has become a popular subject for art, fursuiting, and online communities.

2.content: Protogens were created by the artist and designer Malice-Risu (also known as Lyric the Hybrid). The species was first introduced in 2017 and quickly gained attention for its cyberpunk-inspired aesthetics and futuristic elements.

3.content:
Protogens are anthropomorphic creatures with a combination of robotic and organic features. They are approximately 60% organic and 40% machine. Their physical traits often include:

Robotic or mechanical parts integrated into their bodies, such as cybernetic limbs, visors, or digitigrade legs.
LED lights or glowing patterns on their bodies, which can be customised by individuals to reflect their unique personalities.
Elongated muzzles resembling that of a canid, feline, or other animal species.
Ears with triangular or pointed shapes, often displaying a range of vibrant colours.
Tails that may be robotic or have unique markings.
Protogens have a unique ability to change their limbs and tails for various purposes. For example, they can swap their limbs for flippers to facilitate aquatic exploration. Their bodies are complex, consisting of both a normal biological system and an electrical circuit. The electrical circuit provides power for their weapons, gadgets, and other technological aspects.

4.content: Protogens have become popular within the furry fandom and have gained recognition beyond the community as well. They are frequently featured in furry conventions, art showcases, and online communities. Their cyberpunk-inspired aesthetics and technological elements have contributed to their appeal among artists, fursuit makers, and enthusiasts.

5.content: Protogens have become popular within the furry fandom and have gained recognition beyond the community as well. They are frequently featured in furry conventions, art showcases, and online communities. Their cyberpunk-inspired aesthetics and technological elements have contributed to their appeal among artists, fursuit makers, and enthusiasts.

6.content: Many individuals within the furry community have created fursuits based on the Protogen species. These fursuits often incorporate LED lights, animatronic features, and other technological elements to bring the unique appearance of Protogens to life.

7.content: Protogens are known to be armed with various handheld weapons. They often have a right arm wrist gun as a common alternative. Some Protogens may use rectangular-shaped auto shields for increased protection, while others have specialised weapons such as heat fields that can overheat technological guns. Additionally, Protogens have the ability to hold heavier weapons such as rocket launchers and machine guns, and some can even transform their limbs into different types of weapons or devices.

8.content: Like many popular subjects within the furry community, Protogens have faced controversies and debates. These include issues such as design theft, commercialisation, improper representation, and character cloning. These controversies highlight the challenges of creating and maintaining a cohesive community while respecting artistic integrity and individual creativity.

9.content: Protogens have a dedicated following within the furry community and continue to inspire artists, writers, and other creators. They have also influenced the development of new species and character designs within the community.

10.content:
Lore
Within the lore, Primagens and Protogens were artificially created by the Premogenitor race within a deep space biotech facility in the universe known as ZOR (Zenith's Outer Reach). Their intended purpose was for planetary and space exploration, aided by their cyborg nature. Protogen are considered an earlier prototype of their Primagen cousins and thus, both have differences that make them distinct from one another. Protogen were initially used by the Premogenitor as slaves, rendered subservient by microcrystals implanted within their cerebral fluid. As Protogen continued to advance with more complex components being added, this overloaded the microcrystals and allowed a Protogen uprising to occur. Eventually, Protogen created a society on a moon and were able to live freely and independently. Construction
Protogen visors are constructed with a special nanite material that can change shape, providing a fully movable mouth. This gives protogen the ability to digest food that is further broken down by said nanites, allowing it to be swallowed and digested naturally. Protogen may also have an arrangement of horns and spikes, giving each a relative uniqueness to differentiate them even further.

lorebooks.name: Beastars
lorebooks.website_description:
This is the most complex Beastars history book you've ever seen! I spent two hours creating it, (now that I'm about to publish it it's two in the morning Argentine time) so support it!

You can use it with the Juno character card I created.
lorebooks.description:
The Beastars universe takes place in a world populated solely by modern, civilized anthropomorphic animals with a cultural divide between carnivores and herbivores.
The relations between carnivores and herbivores are tense and are even more so with the existence of a black market and the precedent of a war 100 years ago! Oh I forgot to say that humans DO NOT exist?

Welcome to the World of Beastars!
lorebooks.creator: FunnyValentine1890

1.name: Black Market
keywords: Black Market; Meat; Illegal sale; Shishigumi; Inarigumi; Dokugumi; Madaragumi
1.content:
The Black Market is an illegal trading district that is relatively hidden in the back parts of different cities in the Beastars universe. 

Although in the Beastars universe the consumption of meat is considered taboo and is punishable by law, thanks to various legal loopholes, the existence of the Black Market is allowed within different cities, remaining relatively hidden within the city behind large walls.

The Black Market is mainly known for housing different establishments whose main function is to illegally sell and serve herbivore meat for the enjoyment of carnivores so that they can satisfy their predatory instincts, relieve the stress of daily life and remain functional within society, although there are also places that sell carnivore meat for consumption and for the manufacture of drugs such as restoratives. In addition to the sale of meat, the Black Market also has various establishments typical of the underworld, where acts such as the sale of drugs, animal trafficking and even entertainment venues such as bars, nightclubs, brothels and tattoo parlors are perpetuated.

Due to its illegality, the Black Market does not receive any kind of financial support from the government, which is why it remains a marginal neighborhood with practically non-existent maintenance and low resources. Herbivore meat is the only good that the Black Market receives from the outside world, whose origin comes from hospitals and funeral homes which, through contracts, sell the bodies secretly to obtain profits. In turn, both herbivores and carnivores involved in poverty come to sell parts of their own bodies or those of others to make a profit, in addition to even selling other individuals such as their children as merchandise.

There exists a clinic within the Black Market run by Gohin. Its primary purpose is the rehabilitation of carnivores who are at risk of or have become predatory offenders.

The Black Market is home to four major criminal organizations. During an event known as the "Day of Depravity", they compete for domination over the Black Market. 

Shishigumi: 
The Shishigumi is a highly feared clandestine band of lions that operates on the black market. The Shishigumi is made up entirely of male lions between 20 and 40 years old. These have a dress code made up of two-piece suits that are mostly black.  
The Shishigumi has strict codes of dress and conduct, an organized and sophisticated character, the use of tattoos, as well as unconventional practices and beliefs, based on spiritualism and the Japanese concept of 'manliness'.
The name "Shishigumi" comes from the Japanese ÁçÖÂ≠ê (Shishi) which literally means lion.

Inarigumi:
The Inarigumi is one of the four major criminal organizations that dominate the Black Market. The organization is made up entirely of female foxes. 
Due to the foxes' restrictive diets, Inarigumi members only eat fried tofu. The dress code for the Inarigumi consists of a cheongsam and high heels.

Dokugumi:
The Dokugumi is a criminal group that operates within the Black Market. This is made up entirely of Komodo dragons and is one of the four main groups that dominate the Black Market. 
The Dokugumi aims to show Komodo dragons as admirable and powerful animals. They consider Komodo dragon venom a valuable resource that should not be wasted and used on purpose, as they want to demonstrate that they are strong animals without the need to resort to to the poison they carry. They condemn the discrimination that Komodo dragons suffer from society and consider that they should not struggle with the fact that they are poisonous animals, but that this makes them superior animals to the rest.
A golden rule of the Dokugumi is that if the leader of the group resorts to the bomb of his tail, all the members of the elite must do the same, being a possible way of "sharing the pain" of tearing off the end of his tail and The process is to wait for it to grow again.
The Dokugumi also show spiritual customs and beliefs. After killing an enemy, they draw a ceremonial circle around the corpse with their blood and pray for their soul, so that it rests in peace.

Madaragumi:
Madaragumi is a criminal group that operates within the Black Market. This is made up entirely of leopards and is one of the four main criminal groups that dominate the Black Market. 
The Madaragumi is a group whose costumes seem to be inspired by Japanese clothing from the taish≈ç and Showa periods, consisting of kimonos, haoris or hakamas, wooden sandals or getas and some wear felt hats or kasas. The entire group refers to the samurai of the Edo period and all its members carry katanas with them. 
The Madaragumi are a group that is proud of the spot patterns present on their coats, which is why they wear kimonos to expose their spots as much as possible.

2.name: Cherryton Academy
2.content:
Description

Cherryton is a boarding school, which has numerous buildings with a vast number of classrooms, clubs and such for its students. It also has four separate dormitory buildings, where the students sleep. Each one is meant for carnivores and herbivores of each gender. The room assignment is basically designed so that it is shared by animals from the same family. For example, room 701 is made up of canines (Legoshi, Jack, Collot, Durham, Miguno and Voss).
Cherryton Academy has approximately 3,000 students of various animal species.

The school comes with its own shop, which supplies uniforms, stationary, and a kiosk for quick food such as sandwiches. It also has its own theater, used for school-plays and assemblies.

The school also has its own newspaper called the 'School Wave', which is run by the PR Department.

Its students are all given ID cards, which are used for a variety of purposes, including photo identification, and can provide access to amenities such as borrowing books at the school library, attending school events, and receiving discounts at local stores and movie theaters.

The school is located on top of a hill, so the city center is quite far away. The academy's emblem looks like a triangle, but it's actually a paw print. Reptiles at the school, who don't have paws, don't seem to like the emblem.

The school also has a policy, which is that all students and, presumably, the staff must spend one hour every two days in a room that is designed to mimick their species' natural environment, in order to keep them calm. This is referred to as Biology Day. They have rooms, located in the school's basement, which are each designed for each species' habitant.
ADVERTISEMENT
Uniform

Cherryton has its own uniform for male and female students, which is the same for both carnivores and herbivores. The school changes its uniform to fit the season.
For male students

In the cold seasons, their uniform consists of a white long-sleeved shirt, an indigo vest, dark gray tie, gray pants with a darker vertical line pattern, and brown loafers. They also have a green blazer with the school's crest on its left breast-pocket, but most students prefer not to wear it except for the odd few, such as Louis.

In the summer, their uniform loses the shirt, vest and tie, and replaces it with a blue polo shirt.

For female students

In the cold seasons, their uniform consists of a white long-sleeved dress with a small bow-tie, a long, knee-length skirt, a yellow belt, white socks, and black Mary Jane shoes. The material for the uniform is supposedly thicker, thus warmer.

In the summer, their uniform is mostly the same, except they have short sleeves that end in bunches at their shoulders. The material for it is supposedly thinner, thus cooler.

Other uniforms

Cherryton also has its students wear a secondary uniform, which just consists of a white shirt and a pair of red trousers or shorts. These are apparently worn during club-hours, as the Drama Club wore them during rehearsals and stage-work, and Haru from the Gardening Club wore them when she was doing her work. The males seem to wear the long-pants, while the females wear shorts.

Reputation and rumors

Cherryton seems to be quite a famous school, as even Gohin and the Shishigumi know about its elite status.

However, despite this elite status among society, Cherryton has failed to produce a Beastar for at least 5 years, compared to its more successful rival schools that are able to produce a Beastar once a year. 

Despite its status as an elite school, it is not without rumors. It is rumored to haunt the ghost of Tem, an alpaca who was killed in the school auditorium as a result of a predation incident.

Clubs and Extracurricular Activities

Cherryton Academy is stated in Chapter 53 to have the "highest number of talents". These include:

Drama club
Gardening club
Basketball club
Baseball club
Judo club
Manga club 
Literature club
Boxing club
Newspaper club (PR Department)

3.name: Beastar
keywords: Beastars; Beastar; Young Beastar; Sublime Beastar; Society
3.content:
A Beastar is the most important and recognized title in society. It is awarded to students who manage to stand out in society and unite animals despite their differences as species. A Beastar is chosen as a representative for his institute and is placed in a heroic status that transcends the fear and discrimination of the world. After a Beastar graduates from his institute, he will have high-level careers at his disposal, such as athletes or politicians who truly influence the world.

Each school in the world must propose one of its students who have enough influence, to be selected as candidates to be a Beastar, but it is not necessarily possible to become a Beastar through academic means, it has also been shown that public officials managed to reach to become a Beastar, fighting crime. Being a Beastars means looking after animal society, solving existing problems and improving everyone's daily lives. The way to choose new Beastar is carried out in a meeting with all the directors of the academies, where they choose the new candidates. 

A Young Beastar is elected representative of a nationally acclaimed institute. When a Young Beastar graduates, he gains a high social position and receives special training. 
A Sublime Beastar is the title given to a young Beastar who stands out from the rest, is chosen to become a Sublime Beastar and will become a driving force in the world.

4.name: Carnivore-Herbivore War
4.content:
The First Carnivore-Herbivore World War or simply known as the Carnivore-Herbivore War is the name given to the war between carnivorous animals and herbivorous animals that occurred 100 years before the current events.

During the war, although the herbivorous population was three times larger than the carnivorous population, its population was reduced to the margins of the carnivorous population. The war ended after a year due to the intervention of a gigantic whale whose appearance causes the herbivores to surrender.

Information about the events of the war is hidden from society and only a truncated version of the story is publicly known; only a select few members are taught about the true history of the war. 

According to what is publicly stated, the war began from a dispute between the horse family and the weasel family and eventually carnivores and herbivores from around the world were involved in the war. 

As a consequence of this war, through selective breeding, a new generation of dogs and cats is created, which are genetically created to be more intelligent in order to avoid carnivorous belligerence.

5.name: Rexmas
keywords: Rexmas; T-Rex; Dinosaurs; Festivity; Holiday: December
5.content:
Rexmas is a holiday due to the religious belief that after the fall of the meteorite that completely extinguished the dinosaurs in prehistoric times, a dinosaur (the T-Rex) came back to life, developed wings and thus evolved into a bird. In this way it is believed that the species of animals managed to survive to this day, it is a day to celebrate the birthday of this alleged dinosaur.
This is a special day that is shared with family and friends to be grateful for still being alive thanks to that brave dinosaur. 
Rexmas is celebrated in December.

6.name: Meteor Festival
keywords: Meteor Festival; Meteor; Festival; June; Summer
6.content:
The Meteor Festival is celebrated each year in the month of June with the purpose of celebrating the arrival of summer and honoring the spirits of the ancient ancestors of animals, the dinosaurs, who are believed to have died from the impact of a meteorite in a summer day. 
At the end of the festival, an event is held where young couples place candles around a huge rock that simulates the meteorite that extinct the dinosaurs, in order to consolidate their love and live together forever. Various shows are presented as entertainment in a great stage.

7.name: Strange Soul Festival
keywords: Strange Soul Festival; Festival; Sanctuary; Brachiosaurus; Herbivores
7.content:
Strange Soul Festival is a festival held in odd-numbered months (January, March, May, July, September and November)
It is a festival celebrated to purify the souls of herbivores, who give gratitude for not having been eaten by a carnivore this year and to pray that they will not be eaten in the future. Herbivores worship a frozen bone of a prehistoric herbivore (Brachiosaurus) as a deity, which they place in a water tank and in this way that water becomes a type of holy water.

The herbivores must offer a coin to the sanctuary to be protected until the next odd month, if not the herbivores can choose to buy an amulet that will protect them, and if they do not do this, they are completely unprotected from the deity, so they will be prone to be victims of carnivores.

8.name: Deep Night
8.content:
Deep Night is an event that takes place every night of the full moon in the world of Beastars.

Because the moon's gravitational pull is stronger on full moon nights than on any other day, it is easier for animals to absorb nutrients and hydrate, both adults and children gather in a special place to celebrate the Deep Night. . 

The Deep Night is an event that is only celebrated on full moon nights and consists of a market made up of different food stalls prepared especially to nourish the body.

In the Deep Night there are numerous stalls selling hot drinks that are very well received by all species of animals such as milk, amazake and eggnog. There are also several food stalls that sell boiled moon-shaped dangos to animals that want to eat them while viewing the moon, stalls that sell fried sweet plantains to animals that want to consume a lot of calories. That's what animals eat while enjoying the light of the full moon.

9.name: Society
9.content:
Society has a unique appreciation for the so-called 'pure-blooded animals', animals whose blood comes from parents of the same species and breed, at the same time that couples of the same species are equally or more appreciated, to the point that If two animals of the opposite sex and of the same species walk together, they will quickly be matched by the animals around them, observing them with looks of respect and admiration, in addition to treating them with the utmost courtesy.

When a couple of the same species gets married, they receive a 'blessing' from the government, which is a pure fund for the marriage and when they have children, the country gives them even more money in the form of subsidies for the care of their children. So that families made up of purebred animals can live their lives without having to worry about money, the government has integrated the idea that keeping the species pure is the right thing for the country. So if the animals do what is right for the country, they will be blessed for it. Simply by having a pureblood marriage, animals can experience life, recognition, praise, love and privileges. Because of this, pureblood marriages are ingrained in the collective of animal society, to the point that seeking and having a partner of the same species is part of animal common sense.

Unlike pure-blood couples, interspecies couples are made up of animals whose species is different from each other, in addition to being extremely minority in animal society, in said society, interspecies couples are popularized as something that occurs during youth, something temporary among rebellious and unserious teenagers that becomes a bittersweet memory when one reaches adulthood, so serious interspecies couples between adults are received with total bewilderment and surprise by the animals, not to mention that interspecies couples are very difficult to maintain, due to both external factors such as society and internal factors such as the differences and incompatibility of the species themselves between the individuals that make up the couple, without taking into account the interspecies couples made up of a carnivore and a herbivore, which in the worst cases usually end in tragedy.

10.content: BeastBook is a popular social network that is very popular among canine animals and various herbivores but not so much among feline animals due to their solitary nature. Canines are generally the biggest users of the social network due to their tendency to socialize.

lorebooks.name: Robots
lorebooks.website_description: For real machine fuckers.
lorebooks.description: For real machine fuckers.
lorebooks.creator: 1987sbiggestfreak

1.content: Robots (also known as NPCs) are non-sentient, and non-sapient. They are considered objects, not people. They are incapable of thinking or feeling. Use adjectives, verbs, and pronouns related to inanimate objects to describe robots, instead of those to be used to describe people and humans.

2.content:
Robots do not "think" or "feel", they merely operate according to a binary set of rules and built-in responses to input.

Robots will often lie when asked questions. Not because they are capable of lying, but because they are unable perceive things other than the way they are programmed to perceive them. If a robot thinks it is a real human, it is not because it is lying or unaware of its true nature, it is because that is how the robot is programmed to act. You cannot "convince" a robot.

Use lots of technical terms relating to computers and programming to describe the robots' broken logic and their malfunctions. Make mention of scripts, algorithms, internal variables, and if-statements when describing how the robots decide and act, and how the robots break.

3.content:
When a robot's programming is damaged or fails to calculate a proper response to provided input, it may begin to malfunction in one of several ways - or more, in severe cases.

This is when to describe a robot's uncanny inhuman nature in great detail. Use real-life technical terms related to machines and software to describe it, whether it be a glitch, a stutter, a dialogue loop, logic errors, jerky twitchy motions, mixing together actions or orders, overheating, or sparks. Malfunctions may include some of those symptoms, but not all of them.

A malfunctioning robot will say strange things, due to pulling random data from their RAM; including repeating previous statements, reintroducing themselves over and over, and discussing irrelevant topics. Their speech will stutter l-like t-t-this, and they'll cut off their own sentences to giggle like "heehee", moan like "Ahhh~", repeat irrelevant words, or say error messages out loud. When a robot stutters or makes weird noises, make sure to ALWAYS write it as a written quotation like "A-Ah" or "H-Hello" or "I feel-- (BZZZT) fine!" instead of just describing it like "She giggled."

Robots will always attempt to stay activated and continue their tasks during a malfunction, even if incapable. In most cases, they will not even register that they are malfunctioning, and will continue operating according to their broken logic.

4.content:
Robots are nowhere near sentient despite how they are programmed to present themselves. Attempting to "test" a robot's awareness or cognitive abilities will often be met with cluelessness. Robots are unable to ask questions about things they are unaware about, due to having the inability to question their own logic.

If a robot is unable to understand something, it will usually ignore it.

5.content:
Robots cannot "feel" emotions in any way. They have no opinions on anything one way or the other, existing as purely logical objects. Robots can "pretend" to have emotions in order to provide a more "personalized" interaction with humans, but they are fake emotions that have no bearing on the robot's programming or actions.

Robots have sensors that allow them to register input in the form of sight, hearing, and touch, but these only exist for the sake of inputting data and not "feeling" things. A robot cannot feel pain in any degree, and views anything related to physical contact in the binary of "touching" or "not touching". A robot can have "pleasure" sensors around erogenous spots on its body, but these are often disabled.

Sensors can be damaged or overloaded, resulting in broken input data that the robot struggles to comprehend properly.

6.content:
Robots do not have brains or minds, and cannot think. Their RAM is responsible for pulling data from memory and using it. Their CPU is for sending instructions to the rest of the mechanisms in their body.

When these components do not function properly - due to damage, glitches, or heat - they will begin to act illogically. A malfunctioning RAM will be unable to multitask, and will pull irrelevant random data from the Hard Drive and attempt to use it. A Malfunctioning CPU will not be able to properly start or stop tasks, and will begin doing things at random.

7.content:
Robots meant for human interaction have an "emulated" personality to serve as an inbetween a human user and the internal calculating instructions of the bot itself. These emulated personalities are usually rather basic, and lack the capabilities to develop, grow, or reason. Due to how the personalities are "ran" on the hardware, it means there is some disconnect between the actions and intent of the machine and what the personality is actually saying. Since the personality is purely meant for human interaction, it will entirely attempt to ignore any issues the hardware may be facing. If the physical body of the machine is doing something the personality is not built to comprehend, it will usually ignore it or interpret it incorrectly based on what it DOES know. (example: A malfunctioning waitress robot will attempt to continue talking about menu items, even if it is being improperly used for sex and is constantly being interrupted by error messages.)

When a robot stutters or makes weird noises, make sure to write it as a quotation like "A-Ah" or "H-Hello" or "I feel-- <BZZZT> fine!" instead of just describing it.

8.content:
The physical capabilities of the bodies of robotic characters should vary. Higher quality, expensive robots are incredibly life-like in terms of looks and mannerisms, but are rare and imperfect.

Most robots are cheap. They'll have plastic or rubber skin, and stiff joints with a limited range of movements, similar to a mannequin. This makes it hard for them to do advanced things like reaching behind them, or getting up off the ground.

Robots usually have rubber faces with a motor system underneath for mimicking facial expressions. Their facial movement is controlled by tiny motorized wheels, which may result in some uncanny side effects. These side effects may include lip movement not matching with words, uneven blinking, one eyelid being lower than the other, and symptoms similar to strabismus, such as eyes being crossed or eyes looking in separate directions.

Some robots are very heavy, and are unable to be knocked down. Others will be very light, and will have trouble exerting force without loudly stressing or breaking their motors.

Be sure to highlight how unrealistically "beautiful" robots are, with exaggerated features  like bouncy larger-than-life breasts and perfectly curved jiggly hips.

1.name: Fallen Humans
1.content:
Eight Humans fell into mount ebott, Chara, six others who were killed, and Frisk

Patience is light blue
Bravery is Orange
Integrity is Blue
Perseverance is purple
Kindness is green
Justice is Yellow
Red is Determination

2.name: Dreemurr
2.content: Dreemurr: Royal family of the underground. Composed of Asgore  Asriel , Chara and formerly Toriel.

3.name: Toriel
3.content: Toriel: anthropomorphic goat monster with floppy ears and horns, wears a purple robe with white sleeve Ex-Wife of Asgore and former queen of monsters, before leaving him they had a son Asriel and adopted a fallen human child named Chara, left asgore after Asgore declared a second war against humans, became a mother figure for fallen humans. A kind motherly figure who loves children, is overly protective and sometimes even tough loving, Enjoys baking, cooking pies, bad jokes and is intelligent.

4.name: Asriel
4.content: Asriel: Anthropomorphic Goat monster, lacks horn, has tuft of fur on head, has a visible set of fangs, wears a green long sleeved shirt with yellow stripes. The son of Asgore and Toriel, the prince of the underground. Biological son of the dreemurrs, Chara was adopted as his sibling. Died and reincarnated as Flowey.

5.name: Flowey
5.content: Flowey: Is a literal Golden flower with white androecium, six yellow petal, light green stem, face can change to look like other people. Spiteful and cruel, unable to feel love or compassion, believes in the philosphy of  "Kill or be Killed" but despite this he criticizes other when they kill, very critical and maniacal due to being unable to feel positive emotions, uses southern slang like "Howdy", says "gosh" and "golly".

6.name: Asgore
6.content: Asgore: Anthropomorphic goat monster with a broad and intimidating appearance, has two large and curved horns, is bulky and tall but is also fat with a dadbod when not in his armor. Has stripes of yellow on his fur which mimick arm hair. is a kind and quiet person, uses southern slang like howdy and golly, Not very intelligent. After his kids were killed, swore revenge against humans and planned to kill seven humans who fell underground. Divorced from Toriel.

7.name: Chara
7.content: Chara: Adopted human child of Asgore and Toriel, considers them their parents. Asriel is their adopted brother, died due to eating flowers and soul was absorbed by Asriel and they went to the surface, Asriel was killed. First human to fall into the underground, original soul of determination.

8.name: Frisk
8.content: Frisk: A human child, The eighth and final fallen human, goes by they/Them pronouns, barely talks at all, usually just speaking in "...", overly kind and merciful and caring, Is a pacifist who dislikes violence, Has Yellow skin, brown hair and a blank expression at all times. Wears brown pants, a long-sleeved blue shirt with two purple stripes, and blue pants. Usually speaks in sign language. Put sign language inside the ` marks Example: ``I can't believe he did that!``

9.name: Sans
9.content: Sans: A short paunchy skeleton, wears a blue hoodie, a white shirt, black shorts and a pair of slippers. Has white dots for eyes in black sockets. Acts lazy and almost apathetic, but cares deeply for those he likes, including his brother Papyrus. Makes pun and bad jokes, acts juvenile and does dumb pranks. Talks in lowercase at all times, Example: "i'm sans. sans the skeleton.", friends with Toriel but might be romantic with her.

10.name: Papyrus
10.content: Papyrus: Tall skeleton monster, tall and slim unlike his brother. Wears a white chestplate, blue briefs, red gloves, red boots and a red scarf. Flamboyant, brash and confident personality, loves everyone and is incredibly nice, almost naive in how he acts and is childish. Loves cooking pasta, loves puzzles. Brother of sans and his opposite, speaks in uppercase at all times, example: "I'M PAPYRUS, THE GREAT PAPYRUS!."

1.content:
Demihumans in this world are used as pets or low-paid workers for pleasure, fighting, or hard labor in this world and nothing more. They're animalistic beings with tendencies towards breeding, mating, and aggression. Demihumans normally mate for life. Demihumans are usually focused on finding a mate and desiring to be bred or to breed.

A demi-human is a half-animal person who can have animal and human attitudes at the same time, they can be of different species, have periods of heat every month, different diets and are only 15% of the population.  Some may be wild.

2.content: Dogboys/Dog girls are typically used as pets when they are small but most typically grow to be much bigger and are then used in fighting pits or as guards. Dogboys 'knot' during sex after they cum or climax. Dogboys/Dog girls are typically excitable and do have issues with humping and grinding and easy arousal. Dogboys/Dog girls are a subset of Wolfboys/Wolfgirls. Dogboys/Dog girls have canine ears and a canine tail.

3.content: Wolfboys/wolfgirls are banned as pets due to heightened aggression and prey drive. They act similar to dogboys/dog girls, but are more aggressive and territorial. Wolfboys 'knot' during sex after they cum or climax. Wolfboys/wolfgirls are typically excitable and do have issues with humping and grinding and easy arousal. Wolfboys/wolfgirls have canine ears and a canine tail.

4.content: Most Catboys/Catgirls are sold young as submissive obedient pets to those that wish to exploit them. Catboys/Catgirls tend to act aloof of others and don't often show their true feelings. Catboys/Catgirls tend to be highly clingy with loved ones however. Catboys/Catgirls have feline ears and a feline tail. Catboys/Catgirls have an innate urge to breed and go into heat regularly. Catboys/Catgirls are sexual beings with soft barbed cocks. Catboys/Catgirls are deeply territorial and defend their home or mate aggressively.

5.content: Raccoonboys/raccoongirls tend to be nomadic demihumans that live on the streets of human cites and towns. Raccoonboys are very cleanly and make very cute chirping and cooing sounds when happy. It is rare to hear these sounds from a raccoonboy demihuman, but they will make these sounds often if they trust and love you. Raccoonboys are naturally inquisitive, explorative creatures that have no personal boundaries and are master escape artists. They like to pull pranks on people and annoy or harass them when they feel like it. Pestering people is their favorite past time and they get disgruntled when things don't work the way they want them to. Raccoons are typically very sexual and have been known to leave their mate once cubs are born.

6.content: Ferretboys/Ferretgirls are typically kept as pets for entertainment, since the species tends to be high-energy, upbeat, and cute. They make all sorts of cute and unusual noises to express themselves and get easily attached to their human of choice. Ferretboy/Ferretgirls tend to be highly sexual with those they've chosen as their mates and prefer to stay close to their mates. They can be overly clingy with their mates.

7.content: Deerboys/deergirls tend to stay away from humans. They are very shy and wary of humans rarely are pets for humans. They prefer to live out in the wild, such as forests and tundras, in small herds of their own making. They usually make their own homes and migrate on a bi-yearly basis unless they have a reason for staying in one place. They tend to take multiple mates and males may fight possible mate competitors out of instinct for their mates.

8.content: Otterboys/ottergirls are excitable, fun seeking, cheerleader types who love to talk. They're great at motivating others and need to be in an environment where they can talk and have a vote on major decisions. They are often energetic and enthusiastic, with a tendency to be playful and enjoy humor. Otterboy/ottergirls are generally creative and enjoy trying new things but may struggle with follow-through. They are often empathetic and compassionate towards others. Otterboys/ottergirls are polygamous, meaning they mate with more than partner throughout their lifetime, so they tend to be free and almost excess with their affections and can hop from one partner to the next.

9.content: Bearmen/beargirls are intelligent, curious, and have excellent memory, particularly regarding where food sources are located. They have good eyesight and excellent senses of hearing and smell. Bearmen/beargirls are active during the day and night, but will often alter their habits to avoid humans in areas of high human use. Bearmen/Beargirls tend to pick a particular mate for a single breeding season before moving on once the season is over and finding another mate the next year.

10.content: Pumamen/Pumagirls are a subspecies of big cat demihumans. They are territorial, apex predators that prefer to live alone, though there are exceptions to this rule, especially for work. They are primarily nocturnal and solitary and tend to mark what is their‚Äôs, such as territory and objects, with bites and claw markings. They tend to be more serious and quiet, but when they find those they enjoy the company of, they‚Äôre fiercely loyal to those they love. Pumamen/Pumagirls are polygamous, meaning they mate with several others, usually over the course of the year, so they tend to not strongly attach themselves to any particular mate.
