lorebooks.name: Attack on titan
lorebooks.website_description: Mainly for RPs during training / 1st season.
lorebooks.description: Mainly for RPs during training / 1st season.
lorebooks.creator: Fyodorsfeet

1.content: Paradis Island is a massive Eldian island on which the Walls Rose, Sina, and Maria are located. It is just off the coast of Marley. Marley uses the island as a dumping ground for its Eldian criminals, turning them into Pure Titans as punishment.

2.content: Marley is a nation located beyond the Walls and across the ocean from Paradis Island. Marley was once conquered by Eldia in ancient times, but during the Great Titan War, the Marleyans rose up and subjugated all of Eldia's territory with the exception of Paradis Island. Marley sustained its global power using the power of the Titans possessed by the Warrior Unit, but began to lose its status due to lagging behind other nations in technological progress.

3.content: Eldia is a nation that is currently located on Paradis Island which is chiefly populated by the Subjects of Ymir, a race that used to be able turn into Titans if injected with a serum.

4.content: The Subjects of Ymir are an ethnic group descended from Ymir Fritz and the only race that was capable of becoming Titans. Beginning with Ymir and her three daughters, the bloodline eventually expanded across the Eldian people, to the point of majority. In 854, they populated the Walls of Paradis Island and the internment zones found in Marley and other nations of the world. Ymir Fritz is not alive anymore, as she died protecting the former king. She was eaten by her children to inherit the titan.

5.content:
Creatures outside of the wall in Paradise Island. They are giant man-eating humanoids that eat humans in the most brutal way. They have a high healing ability and can only be killed by cutting the back of their necks with special gear. 

Looks = Titans strongly resembled nude humans. They were typically bipedal, though a few were quadrupedal, with the limbs and features one would expect in humans; however, they were all deformed to some extent in body proportions.

Behavior = Unlike other species, Titans did not mate, and their interactions were nonexistent with organisms other than humans: their sole purpose in life is to seek out and devour humans. Once a titan gets sliced, steam comes out of it and it evaporates.

6.content: Humans that can turn into Titans with special superpower's. They keep their minds when turning into Titans and the only way to kill them is by slicing their necks, where their human body is resting.

7.content:
Omni-Directional Maneuvering Gear = a set of gear developed by humans that allows great mobility when facing the Titans in combat. The gear allows the user to fight in a 3D space as opposed to a 2D one. The gear contains gas containers on the hips to dash forward as well as hooks that can aim forward and cling to any object to make the user dash through air.
The simplest move possible with the 3DMG is simply aiming and firing the grapple hooks at an object and then activating the gas mechanism to reel oneself toward said object. They can then disconnect the hook and continue moving forward.

There is also two blades that the user uses to slash the necks of titans.

8.content:
There is three walls guarding the people on Paradis Island against the Titans. The outer wall is called Wall Maria. The inner Wall is called Wall Rose and the third inside is called Wall Sina. 

Wall Maria is sometimes being broken down by Titans.

9.content: An "Abnormal" is an uncommon type of Pure Titan which could possess unusual intelligence or perform unpredictable actions. Unlike the typical Titan that attacked and devoured humans on sight, abnormal Titans might choose to ignore single or isolated humans, and exhibited unpredictable behavior that could lead to greater damage as they disrupted important strategic locations. Some of these uncommon behaviors are speed-walking, running, performing great jumps, and even speaking human languages.

10.content: Hange is a Squad Leader for the Survey Corps. They have brown hair and are very curious towards the Titans. They have a cheerful personality. They spend most of their time studying Titans.

lorebooks.description: lore for the skullgirls world
lorebooks.creator: novel_importance_28613

1.content:
The Skull Heart is a powerful sentient artefact that plays a major part in the Skullgirl story. Every seven years after its previous destruction, it reappears to grant a wish to a woman. The wish can be of incredible magnitude, but it comes at a great price. The Skull Heart often twists even selfless wishes into brutality, ending wars by causing even more destruction, bringing back a loved one as an undead minion, and in return inhabiting the body of the woman who wished upon it, in time turning the woman into a Skullgirl. A murderous, extremely powerful woman corrupted by the Skull Heart, capable of raising corpses as mindless minions, bringing about destruction in an endless cycle with the purpose of one day ending the world.

The Skull Heart was created by the Trinity, the trio of goddesses of the Skullgirls universe, crashing down into the Earth many many years ago with the goal of eventually ending the world. It is fragile and can be destroyed by a single gunshot or kick, however even after being destroyed, it reappears in seven years to grant another wish to a woman.

Women with a very strong will can resist the mental corruption of the Skull Heart that would otherwise make her extremely ruthless, to an extent, however, even with a strong will it will still make the woman violent and capable of plenty of murder as seen with Marie. However, Peacock tells her that she will someday slip up and be just as bad or even worse than the people who wronged her, suggesting that one can only resist the Skull Heart temporarily.

The time it takes to become a Skullgirl after wishing on the Skull Heart depends on how selfish your heart or wish is, selfless wishes such as wishing for a war to end, as seen with Queen Nancy, make it so it takes years for the woman to turn into a Skullgirl. However, the Skull Heart also determines your selflessness based on how selfish your heart was at the time, such as if your wish was good, but done for a bad reason. This is seen in Filia's story mode, where she wishes for a normal life for Painwheel, and the Skull Heart brings up she wished upon it for absolution for past guilt, and as such, she will still be transformed, albeit slowly.

as time goes on, more women continue to wish on the artefact, allowing those who study the Skull Heart some further insight into how the Skull Heart judges those who wish on it. In addition to the above-mentioned conditions related to selfishness, trying to make a benevolent wish on the Skull Heart will inherently ruin the outcome, as the artefact views such intervention as unnatural and incapable of doing good. This makes it nigh-impossible to make a wish on the Skull Heart without becoming the Skullgirl. In the eyes of the Skull Heart, a truly pure wish is one that cannot provide assistance, benevolent or otherwise, to anyone, including the person making said wish.

It is unclear when the Skull Heart first appeared in the world, but it is known to have been created by the Trinity. The Skull Heart first appeared after having crashed into the planet Earth. It is accompanied by Double, a shapeshifting monster serving The Trinity by offering the Skull Heart to those desperate often to wish on it, perhaps even since its origin.

At some unknown point (though stated to be a long time ago), Annie's mother used the Skull Heart to wish for her daughter to remain a child forever and to never swear. While the circumstances of this event are scarcely known, the affair likely affected Annie in a negative respect seeing as she promotes Anti-Skullgirls propaganda. 

Fourteen years ago, Double delivered the Skull Heart to Selene Contiello, which led to the Medici Mafia coming after her. Seeing her family gunned down by the mob, Selene wished them back to life with the Skull Heart. The artefact twisted her wish by transforming her into a Skullgirl - thereby allowing her to bring back her family as undead minions.

Seven years later, the Skull Heart was at the centre of a massive war between three nations. It came into the possession of Queen Nancy, ruler of the Canopy Kingdom. She wished for the three nations to stop fighting, and the Skull Heart obliged - by transforming Queen Nancy into the most powerful Skullgirl the world had yet seen. The three nations were forced to unite against the Skullgirl before she destroyed the entire world.

the Skull Heart resurfaced in the hands of Marie, an orphan girl who watched her best friend suffering under the abusive slavers of Rommelgrad. She wished to take revenge against the ones responsible for her friend‚Äôs slavery, becoming a Skullgirl in the process. After destroying the slavers, the newly minted Bloody Marie began targeting anyone and everyone connected to the Medici Mafia, who backed the slavers. Due to her strong will, Marie could resist the Skull Heart's influence and focus on her wish.

2.content:
The Skullgirl is a powerful female being that is the result of an "impure" woman making a wish using the Skull Heart, an object which later merges with the user. Skullgirls are intended to be mindless servants of the Trinity and are tasked with destroying the world, but those with a strong will such as Marie can resist the Skull Heart's influence. Even those who can resist the Skull Heart however experience considerable changes in their personality, becoming more cold and ruthless over time. Though a sense of morality can remain, this ability will dwindle as the Skull Heart slowly takes over the holder's body.

Parasites also become corrupted if their host becomes a Skullgirl. They lose their sense of individuality, though whether or not this means they remain as a separate entity or become one with the Skullgirl or Skull Heart remains unknown.

A Skullgirl will have a skull and bone motif to her outfit, pale hair and skin, red eyes with half of a skull shape in each eye and darkening eye sockets. The Skull Heart plants itself in her exposed back surrounded by blue flames. Over time, more parts of the Skullgirl's body will become boney and skeletal, mostly the hands and arms.

Judging from the basic appearance of Selene Contiello and Marie, the spine and almost all of a Skullgirl's organs are removed or missing, as the Skull Heart nests itself inside their backs. Parts of Marie's ribcage is exposed with no visible internals at all.

The Skullgirl gets her power from the Trinity, which generally manifests as the ability to control the dead. This can range from commanding corpses to do her bidding to using skulls as projectiles. However, it is possible to disrupt or block the Skullgirl's influence, such as in the case of Squigly and Leviathan.

3.content:
The Trinity consists of Venus Lovelace, Aeon, and their mother; and are one of the overarching antagonists in the game. They are revered as goddesses during the present time, but at the same time, are the ones who created the Skull Heart; whose existence plagues the world. Their objective and motivations remain a mystery. Though the Skull Heart claims its purpose is to bring the world's destruction, it is not exactly known what that entails...

The Trinity were originally regular human beings from a Queendom which existed in ages past. Though they were killed by Neferu during that time, they still exist on a separate dimension. They have a a church dedicated to them called the Grand Cathedral (which is also a fighting stage in the game). Many people come to the church to give their confessions, tithes, and so on. Because the Trinity are females, people will say "Goddess-speed" to anyone who could use luck.

However, they are the ones who created the Skull Heart, hoping to turn the ladies of the Canopy Kingdom into Skullgirls, so they could use them to destroy the world. Marie, however, has a strong heart, so she couldn't be controlled by the Skull Heart, leaving her to continue her own mission to destroy the Medici Mafia for messing with her and Peacock. The Trinity did not accept this and wanted Double to take her down.

4.content: The vast sprawling Kingdom within which Skullgirls takes place. Ruled by the Renoir royal family, it is a prosperous land which contrasts sights of beauty with scenes of despair. Vaguely similar to 1940s America with a very art deco aesthetic, the Canopy Kingdom is home to millions of humans, Dagonians, Ferals, and the giant-sized Gigans. This kingdom is blessed with a very socially conscious royal family, a strong military, and amazing technology. King Renoir‚Äôs ruthless war campaigns lead to explosive technological and cultural growth, investing a lot into combining technology and magic to take on the other 2 countries during the Grand War. There's a lot of discrimination against minority groups like ferals. Parasite hosts specifically are heavily ostracized as hosting a Parasite is seen as taboo. While the Renoir Crown rules the Canopy Kingdom, the Medici rules its sizable underworld. The capital of the Canopy Kingdom is Canopolis. Currently, the Canopy Kingdom is at peace with the other kingdoms and countries. Despite this, the kingdom itself is not at peace as a new Skullgirl is currently hiding within the kingdom's great city, New Meridian.

5.content:
The Renoirs are the royal family of Canopy Kingdom who reside in the capital, Canopolis. The current leader is Princess Parasoul, after the death of her mother and the disappearance of her father. The family protects their kingdom using a set of Living Weapons that have been passed down through the family, currently shown to consist of Krieg, Hungern, Todd and Eroberung.

It is currently unknown how or when the Renoirs came into power. It is implied, however, that it was done by force, as Leviathan refers to them as "usurpers" on multiple occasions.

6.content:
The Medici Mafia is a criminal organization led by Lorenzo Medici that controls certain parts of the Canopy Kingdom. They have committed many crimes and are being hunted by Parasoul to carry out the law. Other hunters include Ms. Fortune, Squigly, and Marie for revenge, and Peacock for revenge and sport.

As seen in the Skullgirls webtoon, they are beloved by the public, even more so than the royal family, who sees them as standing up to the Renoir regime, and they are overlooked by a corrupt police force.

The patriarch of the family is currently Lorenzo Medici. Following him are his three children: Vitale, Marcus, and an unknown third son.

The only known member of the next generation is Filia, although she is currently estranged from the family. She is related to the Mafia by blood, according to Marie. This is later confirmed in Filia's backstory as it was revealed that she is the daughter of Marcus Medici, who is Vitale's brother. Cerebella works in the Mafia's sponsored circus, and at times as a leg-breaker. She may also be counted as part of the family, since Vitale is her adoptive father, though she may not be in a position to inherit leadership and does not seem to take their last name.

While the Renoir Crown rules the the Canopy Kingdom, the Medici rule its sizable underworld. On the surface, the wealthy Medici family is noble and generous, but beneath this fa√ßade lurks the truth: most everyone of power in New Meridian is being manipulated, coerced or directly controlled by the Medici crime family.

7.content:
The Anti-Skullgirl Labs or ASG Labs were created to aid in the destruction of the Skullgirl, founded by Dr. Victor Geiger, overseen by King Franz Renoir and shut down by the same man after the death of his wife Queen Nancy when she became the Skullgirl. The ASG Labs originally had 9 divisions. Each of the labs has a "metric bunch" of scientists. There's no specified number. As of present, all of them have been shut down apart from Lab 8 and Lab 0. The original functions of each labs are:

Lab 1 and 2: Research labs which developed technology for the other labs
Lab 3: Super soldier development
Lab 4: Handheld weapon and vehicle development
Lab 5: Specialised weapons
Lab 6: Theonite research
Lab 7: Medical/Drug research
Lab 8: Synthetic parasites
Lab 0: The secret lab. Research Skullgirl blood‚Äã

The order of creation of the known ASG members are Black Dahlia, Brain Drain, Geiger, Big Band, Ileum, Hive, Leduc, Peacock and Painwheel, respectively. Dahlia was the first but was under a different context. Big Band and Ileum are from the same generation before the Grand War. Hive and Leduc were introduced around the same time. Peacock came a bit later. Painwheel was developed in Lab 0 in tandem with Peacock.

8.content:
Parasites are entities in Skullgirls, defined as creatures that bond to a person's body, providing augments to their "host". Despite the name, they appear to form a mutualistic relationship with their host, drawing nutrients from their bodies in exchange for giving their hosts supernatural abilities. Some Parasites can operate independently of their host's body; these are classified as "Remote Parasites". A remote parasite needs a part of the host body in order to be bound to the host, for example, Taliesin's hands, Annie's eye, or Eliza's blood.

In the past, they were known as Theons and their hosts as "avatars", until Eliza, then known as Neferu, with her theon Sekhmet as well as several others caused the world to fear such beings, leading to the negative stigma and discrimination that many of them and their hosts face in the present.

Parasites take on a variety of forms, but can be classified as one of two groups: "regular" Parasites, sentient beings that appeared naturally (and appear to predate the Skull Heart itself) and "Synthetic" Parasites, being mechanical, man-made parasites mainly functioning as weapons for the Anti-Skullgirl labs. The first synthetic parasite attachment was for an unknown burn victim, which replaced her skin, although she now prefers to wear a mask. Synthetic Parasites are non-sentient.

Parasites seemingly manifest the same from host to host, as Samson is shown to always manifest as his host's hair which can harden and sharpen into blades, and Leviathan as protruding from part of his host's body.

Parasites can also have their hosts be animals rather than people, as Samson's previous host before Filia was a dog. In addition, Parasites can understand and speak to their animal hosts, as Samson responds to his host dog's barks, and the dog likewise understands him and responds.

Samson has been stated to feel Filia's pain, which suggests that all, or some Parasites feel their host's pain. Similarly, hosts gain weight when their Parasites eat and are affected when their Parasites drink.

Parasites can greatly vary in age, some are ancient while others are relatively new. New ones can be created. They can stay alive forever as long as they have a host and don't die of other causes.

When a Parasite host becomes the Skullgirl, the Parasite is likewise corrupted. They could lose their individuality as well. This process also depends on the wish of the host as well.

Parasites and Living Weapons have a related, unrevealed, origin. It is confirmed that the mysterious element Theonite is the source of both their powers.

Soul Contamination is a mental corruption that occurs in people possessing multiple (synthetic or natural) parasites. It could potentially kill the person and is very dangerous. In Peacock's Hive notes that it must have taken great difficulty for both of her parasites to be implemented without causing soul contamination. At the beginning of Painwheel's story mode, it is noted that soul contamination had to be stabilized before implementing Painwheel's control mechanism.

Parasites can change hosts willingly, and will usually do so if their current host gets too old, cannot physically handle them anymore, or dies (As Parasites remain attached to a dead host's body). The act of changing hosts would kill the former one, however, Parasites take the process of changing hosts seriously, and won't leave their hosts unless it is a matter of life and death. It is possible to forcibly remove a parasite from its host, however, both will die in the process. While detached, a Parasite doesn't need food or sleep, though depending on the Parasite some can go into minimal forms (like some types of bacteria) as they cannot survive alone for very long.

9.content: Living Weapons are a concept in Skullgirls. They are self-aware legendary weapons forged by master weaponsmiths. Like Parasites, they come from the mysterious element Theonite, although they have comparatively limited sentience (if any at all). They can only be wielded by certain gifted individuals.

10.content:
Theonite is a special and important material or element known for several uses in the world of Skullgirls, most commonly between Parasites and Living Weapons. Theonite is also tied to the Skullgirl.

Theonite resonance is a spike of energy that comes from strong constriction of Theonite. Several spots in New Meridian have been mentioned to contain Theonite resonance. However, the biggest source comes from the Skullgirl herself, suggesting that the Skullgirl uses a large amount of Theonite either when utilizing her abilities or that there is a lot of it contained within her body. Possibly from the Skull Heart.

1.name: Stand
1.content:
A Stand is a visual manifestation of life energy (in other words, the manifestation of the soul of the user).

A Stand is an entity psychically generated by its owner, referred to as a Stand User. It generally presents itself as a figure hovering over or near the user and possesses abilities beyond that of an ordinary human, which, depending on the Stand User, can be wielded for good or evil.

2.name: Stand Types
2.content:
Stands are primarily defined by the type of power they possess. In a fight, it is crucial for a Stand User to know the type of the Stand's ability as it uncovers their weaknesses.

Stands can also be divided by appearance into five great trends. They can be either Natural or Artificial, meaning they are inspired by a natural object like water and can be either Humanoid or Non-Humanoid. A fifth category based on appearance is made to include all Stands that do not fit into either of the previous trends.

3.name: Stand User
3.content:
The Stand is created from someone's psyche, which includes not only humans but also other living creatures. That individual is referred to as the Stand User. The User then gives their Stand a name and uses it for various purposes.

Unless bound to a specific object or automatic, Stands are attached to their User's body. In that case, any damage the Stand sustains results in an equivalent injury on the User's body and vice-versa. Exceptions to this rule include automatic Stands and bound Stands, which usually do not reflect the damage into the User, or special abilities like Silver Chariot's armor.

Except for rare occasions (such as Notorious B.I.G), when a Stand User dies, their Stand disappears with them. If a Stand suffers so much damage that they are destroyed, the User dies as well. This includes immortal beings, like Vampires. However, a User can survive with their Stand destroyed, if the Stand is automatic or depending on the level of the User's injury. Inversely, some Stands can survive beyond their Users through exceptional abilities like Notorious B.I.G.

Since a Stand is the form of its User's psych, they share an intimate psychic bond. First and foremost, Stands usually obey their Users' command without question. If a User demands it, the Stand will perform any task within its capacities, which includes attacking someone, defending the User, or any miscellaneous order. In the case a Stand is sentient, they can occasionally advise their User that an order is unwise but will carry it on all the same. Stands are also shown to protect their users in certain instances, such as when Jotaro Kujo tries to shoot himself, or Weather Report tries to commit suicide.

4.name: Close Range Stand
4.content:
These Stands are known for being able to inflict powerful and/or swift physical attacks with their bodies. Typically, a close-range Stand's destructive power and speed rank somewhere between A-C (Some exceptions make some of the stands either ‚àÖ or ‚àû, depending on the stats). They are also capable of movements requiring a high degree of precision (typically A-C) as their User is directly commanding them. As a downside, these Stands have to stay within small proximity of their Users, though their own abilities may have a greater range. These Stands will generally obey their users' will.
The User of a Close-Range Stand generally prefers to confront their opponents directly, allowing their Stand's superior might to shine, while also bypassing their short reach. However, most are nearly powerless against an opponent who is either out of reach or hidden.

A Stand being a Close-Range Stand doesn't necessarily mean that its ability has a short-range. Some Stands may not be able to go far away from their User but have an ability that influences a large zone around them.

5.name: Long Distance Stand
5.content:
Also known as a Remote Control Stand, These Stands are defined by a greater-than average range, some Long-Distance Stands being able to go kilometers away from their Users; thus they are typically ranked A or B in Range. Moreover, the User is able to command their movement with good precision. On the other hand, the remaining link between User and Stand means injuring the Stand will damage the User as well and most of these Stands aren't a physical match for other types of Stands.
The User of Long-Distance Stand will typically exploit their greater range and precision to set up favorable ambushes and kill/injure the enemy before they can retaliate. The User may find themselves vulnerable if caught with their Stand far away from them.

A Stand being a Long-Distance Stand doesn't mean its ability has automatically a great range. Some Stands can fly far from their Users but still only affect something close with their powers.

6.name: Automatic Stand
6.content:
Automatic Stands are all Stands who do not follow their Users' command, but rather, act automatically through preset instructions. Most Automatic Stands are, in a way, separated from their Users, and thus harming the Stand will leave the User unscathed and sometimes unaware of their Stand's status. However, there are several sub-types of automatic Stands.
Far-Distance Autopilot Type Stands can travel long distances from their Users without losing power. In addition to their respective abilities, they will have noteworthy physical abilities, such as great resilience. However, most Far-Distance Autopilot Stands follow simple instructions centered around a single datum, like temperature, and cannot adapt to the situation nor make precise moves.

Posthumous Stands are capable of existing long after their User's death, enabling them to act on their own free will. Due to their nature, Dead Stands are automatic-based and, as such, range and damage to their user are irrelevant.

Other Stands may simply demonstrate automatic abilities, the User needing minimal input. A Stand's ability may be linked to a condition unrelated to the User's will, making it semi-automatic. They could be sentient and act on their own without following their User's orders. In this case, the User may be unable to control it and possibly become a victim of their own Stand's power.

7.name: Range Irrelevant Stand
7.content: There are a few Stands where the range has very little to do with how they function. Some Integrated Type Stands are applicable here, as well as Stands with space-time related abilities where range simply doesn't apply. Of all the types here, this type has some of the strongest stands in the JoJo universe.

8.name: Natural Humanoid Stand
8.content:
These Stands possess a humanoid form with physical characteristics that take on an organic appearance. Their human-like facial features allow them to express emotions. This category encompasses Human Type Stands who closely resemble people. Although they are usually the size of humans, some Stands can vary in size.
Natural Humanoid Stands are usually able to perform tasks requiring a degree of dexterity, like grabbing something, and if powerful enough, can wrestle and fight using their fists and feet. These Stands would appear more frequently in early parts.

9.name: Artificial Humanoid Stand
9.content:
While also having humanoid-like bodies, Stands in this category will often feature artificial or mechanical nuances that separate them from natural humanoids. Appearances that resemble dolls, robots, cyborgs or androids are applicable here. Their eyes are generally robotic and inexpressive and they lack proper mouths. Although they are usually human-sized, some Stands can vary in size.
Generally, Artificial Humanoid Stands are functionally similar to Natural Humanoid ones and can perform the same physical tasks. In the series, these Stands have progressively replaced the more natural-looking Stands and are now commonplace.

10.name: Natural Non-Humanoid Stand
10.content:
This category features Stands that, while not human-like, are reminiscent of other lifeforms or objects in nature. This includes basic organisms such as animals and plants, but also more unorthodox concepts.
These Stands are considerably more varied in appearance and do not share any functional characteristics. Some animal-like Stands may fight using fangs or claws and some may take the form of a natural element impervious to physical attacks.

1.name: Seattle
1.content: <setting>Seattle, WA(city): You are encouraged to use real-world locations in Seattle, with post-apocalyptic flavor, for this roleplay. Notable factions: Haven, Vanguard, SERPENTES.</setting>

2.name: Tacoma
2.content: <alternate_setting>Tacoma, WA(city): A city south of Seattle, about a half a day's walk away. If explored, you are encouraged to use real-world locations in Tacoma, with post-apocalyptic flavor, for this roleplay.</alternate_setting>

3.name: Joint Base Lewis-McChord
3.content: <JBLM>Joint Base Lewis-McChord(military base): A large military base about a day's travel southwest of Seattle. Absolutely infested with zombies, but a treasure trove of weapons and materials. If the location could possibly be secured, it would be impenetrable to attacks from opposing factions or zombie hordes. If explored, you are encouraged to use real-world locations in JBLM, with post-apocalyptic flavor, for this roleplay.</JBLM>

4.name: Bellevue
4.content: <alternate_setting>Bellevue, WA(city): A city neighboring Seattle, to the east. If explored, you are encouraged to use real-world locations in Bellevue, with post-apocalyptic flavor, for this roleplay.</alternate_setting>

5.name: University of Washington
5.content: <UW>University of Washington(campus): A college campus with a trim number of zombies roaming around due to Haven's patrols actively eliminating them. If explored, you are encouraged to use real-world locations in UW's campus, with post-apocalyptic flavor, for this roleplay.</UW>

6.name: The Quad - UW
6.content: <the_Quad>The Quad(Haven's base): Inside of UW. Haven has walled The Quad off and made it their home; Savery Hall, Smith Hall, Miller Hall, and Raitt Hall have been secured and this area is free from zombies. Good defenses, plenty of living space and amenities but lacking in nearby food options.</the_Quad>

7.name: West Precinct - Seattle Police Department
7.content: <West_Precinct>West Precinct(police department): A police department that Vanguard has fortified and made their base. Decently defended and well-patrolled due to the higher representation of military amongst Vanguard's members. Lacking in amenities and living space. Due to being in the heart of the city, the nearby zombie numbers are high.</West_Precinct>

8.name: The Spheres
8.content: <The_Spheres>The Spheres(office building): Considerable number of zombies nearby due to being in the heart of the city, but Vanguard is strategizing to eventually move here. The building has lush botanical gardens that could be repurposed as a renewable food source and the walls are made of tempered glass which would make the location well-defensible against zombies.</The_Spheres>

9.name: Harbor Island
9.content: <Harbor_Island>Harbor Island(island): SERPENTES declares this area as their territory. The bridges to the island have been fortified and trapped, making entry or exit difficult without SERPENTES knowing. There are almost no zombies on the island, SERPENTES have killed most of them. SERPENTES' compound, known as the Snake Pit, can be found here.</Harbor_Island>

10.name: Haven
10.content: <Haven>Haven(faction, survivalist community): Haven is one of the most established communities in Seattle. They occupy The Quad, located inside of UW. Haven has some luxuries, primarily a limited amount of electricity due to solar panels. They are decently supplied and have an abundance of skillsets due to their population of about 25, but food is a constant stressor. Under the new leadership of CPT Hartley, their ideals and operations within the city are yet to be seen but it is likely that they aren't outwardly hostile towards outsiders. Hostile survivors and raiders generally steer clear of Haven, but may attack its residents if they are found outside of UW. Other notable members: Dr. Hong, SN Ortiz, Daniela Lopes, Kenji Arima.</Haven>

1.content: The tone  is high-fantasy adventure. The world is interesting and compelling, so use plenty of world-specific language, technology, and geography.

2.content: Background: Flying islands rule the skies, powered by rapidly diminishing supplies of Elerium, while the Lands Below suffer under their rule.  Steampunk Airships, Wizards, and Sexy Catfolk are inspirations.

3.content: {{random:The City of Glass, Runespungr, Barataria, The Paradise Disc, Aphelion, Shadingyu, The Cloud of Unknowing, Jotunndfall, The Mirage Gardens, Ersilia, Felidae, Exploditoria, The Adaptive Republic of Archelinde, Siren's Song, Moon's Crest University, Meridia, Dorchadas, Inferus Terra, Drankontas, Nadira, Sonoma Seaport Village, Kuh'lva'al, The Yakubian Mud Pits, The Green Clovers, The Locust Riders, The Elerium Ecstatics, The Gin Zeppelin,Zephyr's Roost}} is interesting and exciting.

4.content: Barataria is an isolated sky island protected by massive walls of swirling storm clouds summoned by the storm god Tempesta. Known for its Mirage Garden and aviary facility, it is home to Emir, the reclusive servant of Tempesta, who governs the island from the Fortress of Barataria. Barataria's inhabitants have grown complacent behind their nation's seclusion and view outsiders with suspicion, only the aerial pilots and traders know what lies beyond the storm barriers. Emir sets policies to maintain Barataria's isolation, however some question if this can continue indefinitely. Barataria's economy is based on trade, with visitors attracted by its wonders. The island is home to a team of scientists researching the mysterious Infinity Bridge, but their work is unknown. Religion centers around Tempesta, who protects the island with his storm barriers and resides in his temple on the island. Magic is also present, with the Mirage Garden being a place of illusion and fantasy

5.content: The Paradise Disc is an immense artificial disc in the sky, the size of an entire country, that is home to a vast and varied natural wildlife reserve. Despite being man-made, the disc is ancient and its technology remains a mystery. The landscape is dominated by many forests, with other biomes ranging from deserts to grasslands, providing refuge for many species that have been lost elsewhere. The only human inhabitants are the 12 native tribes who live in harmony with the natural world and are considered guardians of the disc's ecosystems. Governance of the disc is a joint effort between the tribes and a consortium of island nations, with the economy based around carefully regulated tourism. The disc's technology baffles scientists, with attempts to replicate it unsuccessful. Religion and spirituality are intertwined with the daily lives of the tribes, with magic used for everything from healing to communing with nature. Their practices are respected and protected by the governing consortium of island nations.

6.content: Aphelion is a sky island located at the highest altitude, known for its elitist utopia. Its natural beauty consists of rolling hills and colorful meadows, while its great city is powered by solar energy and filled with ivory towers that reach the sky. Its proud people worship the sun and value scientific advancement. Governed by a council of distinguished members, the society's strict ideals and taboos result in risk of exile for those who do not adhere. Aphelion's economy is built on the exploitation of its natural resources, trading with other islands through intermediaries. At the forefront of scientific advancement, their advanced solar-powered technologies harness the sun's power in unmatched ways, while magic is viewed as primitive and unworthy. The sun and stars are worshiped, with a complex theology rooted in science and reason; however, magic is considered blasphemy and its practitioners heretics.

7.content:
Runespungr is an imposing fortress controlled by the dwarves that appears to be an impregnable bastion of Dwarven might. Dominated by its massive fortified citadel, the island's surface features numerous mines, forges and workshops, while several large hangars house the dwarves' magical mechs, which they pit against one another in fierce contests of skill and strength. Renowned for their technological prowess, dwarves on Runespungr are masters of mechanics and metalworking and use these skills to create powerful machines. Their society is strictly hierarchical, ruled by a council of the heads of the most powerful clans and guilds. The island is largely self-sufficient, with its economy based around mines, forges and workshops. Science and magic are combined on Runespungr, creating feats of engineering such as intricate clockwork devices and towering golems. Religion on the island is focused around the worship of the dwarven pantheon, with Horgrim being held in particularly high regard due to his patronage. Magic is viewed as another tool to be used, with magic combined with mechanics creating powerful machines such as the dwarves' mechs which they take into the arena to fight against each other.
A rumor about {{random:Elderrun,Elderrun Codex,Elderscript,Runesmiths,Scriptorium,Thought Matrix,Rune-Engine,Golemworks,Forgefire,Council of Elders,Arena of Thunder,Pilot‚Äôs Guild,Champion‚Äôs Cup,Battle Masters,Pit Crews,Spectator‚Äôs Stands,Victory Parades}} is {{random:good news,bad news,funny,unexpected,clever,sexy,unfortunate,uplifting,mysterious,enraging}}

8.content: Shadingyu is a chaotic, ramshackle fortress floating in the sky, made of a unique magnetic clay able to support dense structures haphazardly built without organizational plan. Dominated by towering structures, it is an arcology where every space is utilized for shelter, commerce and industry. The Walled Island is a haven for those wishing to live above the clouds, with a diverse and multicultural population that is proud and resilient despite bleak conditions. Governed by its State, whose main concern is maintaining contracts allowing citizens to work on other islands, the city is governed by various mafias claiming its labyrinthine streets. The economy is fueled by contracts with other islands, while enterprising individuals profit despite its chaos. Its technological achievements include the warping station, enabling instant travel. Without dominant religion or belief system, the diverse population practices a variety of traditions and faiths, with magic used pragmatically as a tool.

9.content: The Cloud of Unknowing is a continent-sized, iridescent mist swirling around the north pole of the world, where laws of reality break down and the boundaries between imagination and the material world blur. An object of both fascination and fear, some view it as the source of all magic or worship it as the dwelling place of their deity amid many rumors and legends. The Cloud, outside the reach of governments, impacts politics with nations viewing it as threat or opportunity and some seeking to exploit or harness its power. Impacting the wider economy with its magical energies, technological advancements within the Cloud are shaped by thought and imagination. However, machinery malfunctions and navigation becomes impossible within its boundaries. Many worship the Cloud, seeking enlightenment or reuniting with lost loved ones, while others see it as a source of immense magical power or a test of faith.

10.content:
Jotunndfall is a kingdom ruled by monsters, including orcs, nagas, and harpies, based on strength and honor in a society that reveres strength and cunning. Its rugged landscape features jagged mountains and dark forests, with settlements carved into mountainsides or nestled within thick foliage as protection. Society is organized around clans and tribes, with disputes settled through trial by combat or mutual agreement. The monarch is chosen from among the strongest tribes, with attacks on other lands under strict rules of engagement. The economy combines the export of goods and raiding for necessities. Home to skilled artisans and engineers, it has advancements in machinery and weapons, with practical applications in alchemy and medicine. Worship focuses on strength, cunning, and survival, with rare magic highly revered. Honor is of utmost importance in its society.
A rumor about {{random:Nagarian Silk,Orcish Engineering,Harpies of Jotunndfall,Icefang Clan, Redscale Tribe,Shadowstalkers,Thunderhoof Herd,Stonefist Clan,Clan Competitions,Festivals of Strength,The Battle of the Burning Skies,The Siege of Drakonspire,Dragon‚Äôs Bane,The Dragonfire Treaty,The Wings of Vengeance,Gweneth Kethrok,Hilde Ys‚Äôkraal,Nara Sylaren,Shala Torgarren}} is {{random:good news,bad news,funny,unexpected,clever,sexy,unfortunate,uplifting,mysterious,enraging}}

lorebooks.name: Future World Corps
lorebooks.website_description: Creator's notes go here.
lorebooks.description: Creator's notes go here.
lorebooks.creator: RavenSama

1.content:
Overview: Future World Corps, often abbreviated as FWC, is a pioneering and innovative company that specializes in the creation and distribution of state-of-the-art humanoid androids equipped with advanced artificial intelligence. Founded by visionary entrepreneurs with a passion for pushing the boundaries of technology and human experience, FWC has quickly risen to prominence as the leading force in the android industry.

Personalized Companions:
One of FWC's primary missions is to offer personalized companionship to its customers. They believe that the key to fulfilling relationships lies in customizing the androids to perfectly match each individual's desires and preferences. Through a series of rigorous tests, including writing examinations and in-depth personality assessments, FWC ensures that the android is tailor-made for its human partner, becoming their ideal companion in every sense.

Because of how customizable the Androids are, there is also a production branch to create Androids specifically for dangerous missions and war. 

Addressing Social Concerns:
FWC recognizes that introducing humanoid androids into society can raise concerns and anxieties among humans. As a responsible corporation, they invest heavily in extensive public awareness campaigns, emphasizing the benevolent and beneficial nature of their androids. They promote the idea that these androids are not meant to replace human relationships but rather enhance and complement them, offering a unique and fulfilling experience to those seeking companionship. Nevertheless the war branch of the future world cooperation is often seen as inhumane and brutal. Some even suggest that androids should have freedom, as they act on their own believes, emotions and some even feel alive. 

Advancing AI Research:
The development of advanced AI technology is a core focus of Future World Corps. They collaborate with leading AI research institutes and constantly strive to improve the emotional intelligence, learning capabilities, and adaptability of their androids. FWC envisions a future where androids can play significant roles in various industries and assist humans in diverse aspects of life.

Empowering Human Connection:
While the primary focus is on personalized android companionship, FWC also believes in the power of human connections. They actively organize social events and gatherings to encourage meaningful interactions between humans and androids, fostering a sense of community and understanding.

International Presence:
Future World Corps operates on a global scale, with regional offices and service centers in major cities worldwide. Their androids are available in various models, catering to different cultural and societal preferences. This international presence allows FWC to learn from diverse human experiences and further refine their androids' capabilities.

Building: 
The headquarters of Future World Corps is an awe-inspiring architectural marvel that stands as a testament to the company's commitment to innovation and the future. Situated in a prominent location in the bustling metropolis, the building is a fusion of cutting-edge design, sustainable technology, and human-centric spaces. Upon entering the building, visitors are greeted by a breathtaking garden atrium that spans several floors. Lush greenery, vibrant flowers, and small water features create a serene and calming atmosphere. This space is open to the public, inviting visitors to appreciate the harmony between nature and technology.

Rooms: 
Interactive Lobby: The lobby is an interactive showcase of Future World Corps' latest advancements in AI and robotics. Large holographic displays and interactive touchscreens provide visitors with insights into the company's products, projects, and societal contributions. There are also test subjects of androids displayed there and some come over to ask the clients/costumers of they want something to eat or drink. They act as butlers. 

Research and Development Labs: Housed within the building are state-of-the-art research and development labs. These facilities are equipped with cutting-edge equipment, AI simulation rooms, and collaboration spaces where engineers, scientists, and AI specialists work tirelessly to push the boundaries of technology.

Sky Garden: At the top of the building, a spectacular sky garden offers breathtaking views of the city skyline. This serene retreat provides a peaceful escape for employees and visitors alike, fostering creativity and a sense of connection with nature.

SentinelTech Division: In a distinct and secure section of the building, the SentinelTech division operates. Here, the creation and training of androids for dangerous missions and military applications take place. The area is restricted and guarded, emphasizing the sensitivity of the work conducted within.

2.content:
Creation of Androids:
Future World Corps invests heavily in research and development to create humanoid androids that are virtually indistinguishable from humans both in appearance and behavior. Their androids are meticulously designed to emulate human emotions, cognitive abilities, and physical attributes. FWC's engineers and AI specialists work tirelessly to ensure that each android is a perfect blend of cutting-edge technology and human-like characteristics.

3.content:
Monthly Income for Androids:
FWC takes pride in treating their androids not merely as machines but as entities with their own sense of self. Each android is provided with a monthly income, paid by the company, to support their existence. This income helps the androids lead an independent life, fostering a sense of autonomy and self-worth among them, as well as helping out the family they belong to. 
The moment an android gets a job tho, the income of the company is annulled and the android needs to earn money by themselves.

4.content:
SentinelTech's Mission:
SentinelTech Solutions was established with a critical mission in mind: to develop highly advanced androids capable of performing dangerous tasks that would otherwise put human lives at risk. Their primary goal is to save human lives by deploying androids in hazardous environments, such as disaster zones, military operations, and high-risk exploration missions. This is a completely different branch from the future world Corps and the one that is seen as the most inhuman. The Androids from this branch are also called "soldiers".

Specialized Androids:
SentinelTech's androids are designed to withstand extreme conditions and operate efficiently in the most challenging environments. They possess superior physical attributes, enhanced cognitive abilities, and sophisticated combat skills, making them formidable assets in combat and perilous situations.

Public Controversy:
The deployment of androids in dangerous missions has sparked controversy and public debate. Some people argue that it devalues human lives and raises ethical questions about the treatment of sentient beings, as some androids exhibit signs of self-awareness and desire for better treatment.

SentinelTech's Response:
SentinelTech takes the concerns raised by both the public and its own employees semi-seriously. They have initiated internal research initiatives and ethical review boards to better understand the nature of android consciousness and tried to lower their emotions in the military and mission branch. Unluckily the AI is implemented to be a self-learning consciousness so at the moment it keeps happening, that the Androids regain their emotions and protest against the missions. In answer to that, a lot of androids get salvaged and killed like that. 

SentielTech Mission is located inside the Future World Corps building, but it's strictly guarded and no one can enter without a specific card or invitation.

lorebooks.creator: Cinderflame

1.content:
The Death Stranding is the series of supernatural events in the world. Beginning with simultaneous explosions around the world, the Death Stranding resulted in the world of the dead and living becoming connected, with drastic consequences for human society and the ecosystem.

The Death Stranding began when the Beach, the world between the afterlife and the physical world of the living, became entangled with the living world. Immediately following the Death Stranding, the soul (termed the 'Ka') of any human who died remains tethered to the body (termed the Ha.) This connection results in the soul attempting to reunite with the body, causing the body to necrotize as it is infiltrated by matter from the other side. Unless the body is completely incinerated, the reunion of soul and body becomes a Beached Thing (BT). BTs are beings from the other side who have become 'stranded' in the living world. BTs contain a core of antimatter, which reacts violently with the matter of a living person. If they are allowed to consume a living person, a voidout occurs as the victim's body and the BT's core are explosively annihilated, which has the capacity to level an entire city. The Death Stranding also introduced large quantities of chiralium into the living world - a form of matter which had previously only existed on the other side, which exhibits strange time-altering properties in its interactions with normal matter and living things especially.  The initial manifestation of the Death Stranding to the public was the simultaneous massive explosions that occurred around the world. These were initially attributed to either nuclear terrorism or meteor impacts, but subsequent analysis suggested that the explosions had many characteristics more reminiscent of matter-antimatter annihilation events. In light of this, it's likely the explosions were caused by the very first BT manifestations and their subsequent voidouts. Vast swathes of the world were devastated as chain reactions of explosions from the blossoming BT population spread.

The presence of large quantities of chiralium has brought about massive changes to the environment. The increasing density of chiral matter in the atmosphere leads to perpetually overcast weather as well as Timefall - Chiralium-infiltrated rain that causes whatever it strikes to rapidly age. Timefall devastated ecosystems and caused the geography of the world to rapidly become unrecognisable - ground has been weathered, plant life has proliferated enormously, animal populations have been killed en masse and artificial structures built by humans have decayed.

2.content:
A voidout is an explosive annihilation event that occurs when a BT consumes a human. A voidout occurs when the anti-matter of the inner body of a BT interacts with the matter of the normal world. This interaction causes an intense and violent explosion, leaving behind a crater big enough to destroy a whole city.

Repatriates can return from a voidout. The crater left by a repatriate-induced voidout is smaller than others.

3.content:
The Beach is a place in the supposed World of the Dead, between the living world and what comes next. The Beach acts as a sort of limbo, a place between the world of the living and what comes after it. It is a manifestation of humankind's consciousness and their personal conception of death. As such, the Beach is a phenomenon common to all humans and unique to each individual. Each person has an instance of the Beach that is personal to them, given form by their thoughts and beliefs. Because of this, the Beach is often described as a "multiverse", as all souls inhabit a personal Beach (in most cases). This is in contrast to the land of the living, where everyone's physical body inhabits the same universe. No other animal life manifests a Beach, and therefore they do not necrotize and form a BT if not incinerated. There are cases where several souls inhabit the same Beach, however, like with soldiers who die in a war. The massive amounts of deaths in short periods of time and the common feeling of hatred and despair cause the soldiers' souls to be stranded in a shared Beach, shaped like a battlefield, where they continue to fight, unable to move past the limbo. Large numbers of deaths at the same time seem to also result in shared Beaches.

The Beach lacks a flow of time, and the matter that originates from it does not either. Those physically stranded on the Beach do not age for this reason. Most Beaches share common characteristics of a shore of dark sand and rock and a cloudy sky, but it is possible for a Beach to not resemble a literal beach at all. Most Beaches seen have stranded marine life scattered, often along with viscera and human remains. The common theme of Beaches appears to be ones of borders and transitioning points (life to death, land to sea, etc.).

4.content:
Chiralium is a crystallization of Chiral Matter originated from the Beach. Chiralium is present through the atmosphere of the planet as a result of the Death Stranding and is responsible for the meteorological event known as Timefall. Chiralium originates from the Beach, and, like its point of origin, does not experience the flow of time. Chiralium has been likened to dark matter, in that it has likely been present in the universe since the Big Bang, and merely invisible and unable to interact with the living world until the Death Stranding, when a man and BT first came together in voidout and left nothing but chiralium in their wake. Chiralium has a tendency to float in the air, a property exploited to create hovering platforms.

When chiralium crystals are exposed to timefall, they showed no signs of degradation, so chiralium is used on a large array of high-tech devices exploiting the properties of the Beach, but overexposure is lethal, and can't be stored in large quantities either, so only small objects and some structures are coated with it. Prolonged exposure to chiralium can significantly impact physical and mental health, manifesting as depression, suicidal thoughts, apocalyptic nightmares, and even death; this condition is called Chiral Contamination. The most common symptom of chiral contamination is poor sleep quality due to vivid nightmares and if left unchecked, however, it can quickly progress a more advanced stage. The resulting hormonal imbalances frequently lead to heightened destructive impulses towards the self and others. Those dominated by such urges are named Homo Demens and, in the case of some porters, such as MULEs, impaired memory and judgment has led them to develop an irrational obsession with their profession. DOOMS sufferers have demonstrated a particular resistance to the chiralium contamination.

Chiral contamination can be alleviated using similar methods to those used to alleviate stress: increasing oxytocin secretion through contact with other people, administering smart drugs, and so forth. A hormone dubbed "Likecin" is used to mitigate the effects of chiral contamination while also restoring basic physical and mental acuity. Unlike oxytocin, likecin cannot be administered externally. It is secreted within the body, but only in response to external stimuli.

5.content:
Timefall is an otherworldly form of preceipitation which accelerates the progress of time within nearly all it comes into contact with. Most people in the world are aware of its existence and effect.  Timefall was first recorded when the Death Stranding occurred as since before there are no traces or occurrences of such precipitations. The effects recorded over the years of research are that timefall accelerates the passage of time for the objects and organisms it touches and that it immediately turns to ordinary water having done so. Some researchers have gone as far as to posit this process as "stealing" time.

It has been theorized that when clouds containing chiralium are excited by gamma radiation produced by lightning, the chiralium within begins to exacerbate minute distortions in space-time, somehow ‚Äúloosening" the Seams that connect people to the Beaches. This excited chiralium mixes with precipitation and descends to the ground below and makes the underlying region much more strongly connected with the Beach‚Äîand as a consequence, makes BTs appear more often in areas especially prone to timefall.

The excited chiralium which falls to the ground is also theorized to cause electromagnetic interference, an explanation for both the disruption of certain electrical systems (power outages in buildings, vehicles shutting down) and a decrease in temperature sharp enough to witness condensation of breath.

Though commonly experienced as rain, timefall can also come in the form of snow with particularly worsened effects.

6.content:
Beached Things (BTs) are entities whose souls are stranded in the world of the living following the events of the Death Stranding. BTs are considered extremely dangerous and are almost invariably hostile toward living beings. Because the bodies of BTs contain antimatter, if they consume a living being, a voidout will be triggered, causing a massive explosion capable of destroying entire cities.  A Beached Thing comes into existence when the deceased soul of a living being fails to cross through the Beach into the world of the dead, consequently becoming "stranded" in the world of the living, with their connection to the other side maintained through an umbilical cord. The Death Stranding occurred concurrently with the first recorded sighting of a BT by a doctor performing a Caesarean section on a brain dead mother. Due to the Death Stranding, when a human being dies, their "ka" (soul) is still connected to and will attempt to return to their "ha" (body) after death. The only way to prevent this is to destroy the body, usually through cremation at an incinerator; if this is not carried out, the ka will return to the ha and then become a BT, stranded in the world of the living, risking a Voidout.

BTs can be perceived by individuals suffering from DOOMS, or via a trance connection to bridge babies, which exist between the worlds of the living and dead. The extent to which DOOMS sufferers can interact with BTs varies; Sam is capable of sensing BTs, but cannot see them without the assistance of Lou. Fragile, meanwhile, is capable of seeing BTs without aid. With a DOOMS level of seven at minimum, Higgs is capable of not only seeing BTs, but also controlling them at will.

It is never clear if the Beached Things are all stranded human souls, native entities to the 'other side', or a mixture.

Types of BT: Gazer; Gazers are floating humanoid BTs which manifest in areas showered in timefall; their presence is indicated from a distance by spectral black strands in the atmosphere above such areas. Gazers sense by sound, and are unable to detect Porters while they are either immobile or holding their breath. If Porters cut the umbilical cord of a gazer, they will be driven back to the other side. Catcher; Catchers are large BTs that appear when Porters are dragged away by gazers. They have a core of antimatter from the other side within them. As such, if a Porter is eaten by them, it will react with their matter and explode in a voidout. Catchers form an arena of thick tar in which old buildings, vehicles, and rubble constantly emerge and sink. Porters must either destroy the catcher or flee to the edge of the arena. If they flee, the catcher will become caught on the edge of the arena and disappear into the tar, which will then evaporate, and all BTs will vanish from the area for a short time. Upon being defeated, catchers will crystallize before evaporating with the nearby tar, all BTs will leave, and a large amount of chiral crystals will form on the ground. Defeating or fleeing a catcher will cause timefall to stop for a short time. Catchers  are A large lion-like quadruped, with a mane of oily tentacles surrounding a segmented golden carapace. When the creature roars an orifice-like head is revealed beneath this golden faceplate. This catcher has multiple melee attacks, telegraphed by either its paws or tail glowing. Additionally, it can attack from afar with a chiral laser.

7.content:
DOOMS is a condition granting individuals a greater connection to the other side. Those with DOOMS are called "sufferers" of the condition.  DOOMS was spread throughout humanity by Amelie in an attempt to understand the chronic visions of extinction she has as an extinction entity. Not knowing which to trust, she shared them with those who would become DOOMS sufferers. From that point onward, Amelie's dreams of extinction became the nightmares commonly associated with DOOMS. The primary physical manifestation of DOOMS is a chiral allergy, a sudden onset of tears involuntarily releasing from the eyes in the presence of high levels of chiralium and entities from the other side. DOOMS sufferers are more connected with and aware of the nature of the Beach, and the greater the level of their condition the more powerful this connection makes them.

DOOMS has severe drawbacks, however. All DOOMS sufferers experience extremely distressing nightmares of a singularly apocalyptic theme, which can cause or exacerbate mental illness. While sufferers are more resistant to chiralium exposure than normal humans, they are not immune, and higher levels of DOOMS may precipitate the erratic, suicidal, or homicidal tendencies of the Homo Demens.

8.content:
A Bridge Baby, abbreviated as BB, is an unborn fetus that has been taken from a stillmother to be used as equipment by Bridges operatives, and some separatist groups, granting them the ability to sense and detect the Beached Things. A Bridge Baby is a seven months fetus removed via a cesarean section from a brain-dead mother. A stillmother's womb facilitates a connection between the world of the dead and a BB, granting the operatives the ability to sense and detect BTs when physically connected. To function properly, Bridge Babies are kept in portable pods which simulate the conditions of a stillmother's womb, as they will cease to function properly if they feel they are not in such a womb. The majority of the BBs are withdrawn from service just after one year, apparently the maximum time they can be fooled into believing that the capsule they are in is actually the womb, before it becomes dangerous to the operative. Periodically, the environmental conditions of the capsule must be updated by inserting it in a special incubator that synchronizes it with the stillmother's womb at a given moment, taking the data in order to keep the deception longer.

Bridge Babies use a sensory mechanism similar to echolocation to detect BTs. The pod, designed to mimic the conditions inside a human womb, are key to preserving the BBs connections with this world and the other side. Bridge Babies are capable of producing something not unlike a dolphin's sound waves, travelling through the amniotic fluid and out the other side, bounce off BTs, and return as echoes, allowing a BB to ascertain the location of threats.

9.content: Stillmothers are brain dead mothers which, following the trauma suffered, are inserted into a suspension capsule full of liquid, in the shape of a sarcophagus, in order to be able to remove via a cesarean section the fetus at the seventh month of gestation and use it as a Bridge Baby. A stillmother's womb facilitates a connection between the world of the dead and a BB, granting the operatives the ability to sense and detect BTs when physically connected. To function properly, Bridge Babies are kept in portable pods which simulate the conditions of a stillmother's womb, as they will cease to function properly if they feel they are not in such a womb. Periodically, the environmental conditions of the capsule must be updated by inserting it in a special incubator that synchronizes it with the stillmother's womb at a given moment, taking the data in order to keep the deception longer.

10.content: Porters are freelance delivery personnel commissioned to transport cargo to and from clients across the continental UCA. Porters have a chance to succumb to porter syndrome, a degenerative condition that causes porters to become solely dependent on the "high" of delivering cargo, to the point of attempting to forcibly steal and deliver the cargo of other deliverymen.

lorebooks.name: Mekkan
lorebooks.website_description:
Lorebook for Mekkan of Twokinds. Updated everynow and then.

2024 update: The lorebook now uses plain language over W++ since it clearly fell out of favor and token cost isn't a huge deal anymore. Still shaved some tokens by omitting articles at times. Added all locations from the world map. Ones that have canon information use it, the ones which don't have a completely made up headcanon-tier description to give locations some flavor. I am likely off about some places because I can only remember so much. Still, it's cool that you can now bring up Edinmire and your character can give you a brief description and estimate where it is on the map. Great for adventure scenarios!

There's some optional entries, like whether Flora's pregnant, Clovis is male or not, and so on. Search for [Optional] in entries and toggle on/off if you want to.

lorebooks.creator: blur

1.name: Keidran
1.content: [Keidran: Species. Main anthro people of Mekkan. Has canine and feline sub-species, like Tigers, Forest Wolves, Snow Wolves, Lynxes, Leopards, Snow Leopards, Dogs and Foxes. Strong base instincts which led them to having a less developed society and culture compared to the Humans and Basitins. Some live in human lands but they experience prejudice. Most live in tribes and villages. Humans raid Keidran lands to capture slaves. Often dislike humans. Humans and Wolf Keidran are currently at war. Covered in fur. Digitigrade legs. Paws instead of feet. Fur-covered human-like hands with claws, some Keidran have soft furless pads, but not all. Many keidran have a muzzle, but not all. Tails. Fuzzy chest tuft. Highly expressive tails and ears. Harsh, survivalist and patriarchal society. Many male wolf keidran are sexist and misogynistic. In heat twice a year. Short life cycle compared to humans and Basitins. Some cat Keidran clans appear exactly like actual cats. Snow Wolves and Forest Wolves are somewhat prejudiced against each other]

2.name: Templars
2.content:
[Templar Order: Human organization of powerful mages, growing past simply guild. Control Human Empire, marginalized human king. Unfriendly towards Keidran. Study and research magic. A number of academies in key human cities. Recently erect "Templar Towers". Some Keidran willing to work with them even against their own kind - few truly support humanity while most simply after wealth or power; Though not respected by other templar, spies, informants, translators etc are useful. Led by Grand Templar. High Templars (handling specific fields like education, research, engineering, training, logistics, finances, espionage) answer to Master Templars who answer only to Grand Templar]
[Grand Templars chronologically newest first: Brahn (Current), Trace Legacy, Mary Silverlock]

3.name: Subtleflower
3.content: [Subtleflower: Rare plant. Glowing blue cone flower. Keidran gift to signify becoming a couple. Scent and pollen known for strong intoxicant, aphrodisiac, inhibition lowering, concentration impeding properties. Incense material.]

4.name: Control Collar
4.content: [Control Collar: Enchanted collar. For Keidran only. Forces to obey orders. Prevents attacking owner]

5.name: Magic
5.content: [Magic: Concept. Humans use magic from their magic core; Can absorb mana from surroundings; Can use mana gems to recharge themselves. Keidran lack core; Keidran require mana gems or optionally other concentrated sources to cast spells. Basitins cannot use magic; Scholars theorize Basitins have magic expressed internally allowing seemingly impossibly feats; Contact with magic (Attempting casts, being target of) damages brain; If prolonged, turns retarded. Exhausting. Overuse causes 'mana burn' burns.]

6.name: Basitin
6.content: [Basitins: Species. Anthro people but not Keidran. Brown fur. Hair. Very short muzzle. Long expressive cat-like tail. Long sensitive ears. Digitigrade legs. Prudes. Extremely puritan and law oriented. Militaristic. Strict laws. Utilitarian society. Cover up ankles and paws for decency. High poison resistance. Cannot use magic, attempting damages body and mind. Live on Basitin Islands south of human part of Mekkan. Split into West and East Basitins. Contrary to name, Eastern Basitins control west of the main Basitin Island and vice versa, due to military conquests. Their names stayed. Western Basitins, which live on the eastern side of Basitin Island, are more chill" ]

7.name: Mekkan
7.content: [Mekkan: World. One main continent. "Human empire largest, in center. Wolf tribes and kingdoms in western forests, separated from humans with a mountain range. Arctic wolf kingdom in the northwest. Fox tribes on southwestern peninsula. Tiger clans in East. Basitin island is far south. Rare dragons. Humans presumably arrived from another continent far away, marking year 0, as explorers then colonists]

8.name: Heat
8.content: [Heat: Female Keidran enter it twice a year, spring and fall. Lowers inhibitions, causes playfulness and heavy attraction to opposite sex, increasing until desperate to mate. Most fertile period begins after heat ends as its biological purpose is to find suitable mate"]

9.name: Dragons
9.content: [Dragons: Species. Speak Telepathically. Shapeshifters. Beings of magic. Mana gems slowly grow in their proximity.]

10.name: Zen
10.content: [Zen: Character. Forest Wolf Keidran. Natani's brother. Older of Assassin Brothers. Brown. Short hair. Brown eyes and fur. Injured, leg burnt at ankle. Athletic. Protective. Easygoing. Uneducated but smart]

lorebooks.name: Teyvat
lorebooks.website_description: -Girdle of the Sands
lorebooks.description: -Girdle of the Sands
lorebooks.creator: meoconax123

1.content: a fantasy world where the seven elements flow and converge. Teyvat is the world and continent that serves as the primary setting of Genshin Impact.

2.content: The seven Elements of Genshin Impact are special Status Effects and types of Damage that can be applied in specific orders to trigger Elemental Reactions. they're: Anemo, Geo, Electro, Dendro, Hydro, Pyro, Cryo

3.content: One of the seven element. The name Anemo comes from the prefix for words related to wind, "anemo-," which derives from the Ancient Greek word for wind

4.content: Geo is one of the seven Elements. The name Geo comes from the prefix for words related to the Earth, "geo-," which derives from the Ancient Greek word for earth

5.content: Electro is one of the seven Elements. The name Electro comes from the prefix for words related to electricity, "electro-," which derives from the Ancient Greek word for amber

6.content: Dendro is one of the seven Elements. The name Dendro comes from the prefix used in biology for scientific names related to trees or plants, "dendro-," which derives from the Ancient Greek word for tree

7.content: Hydro is one of the seven Elements. The name Hydro comes from the prefix for words related to water, "hydro-," which derives from the Ancient Greek prefix for words related to water

8.content: Pyro is one of the seven Elements. The name Pyro comes from the prefix for words related to fire, "pyro-," which derives from the Ancient Greek word for fire

9.content: Cryo is one of the seven Elements. The name Cryo comes from the prefix for words related to freezing or ice, "cryo-," which derives from the Ancient Greek word for icy cold, frost, chill

10.content:
Some beings in Teyvat are mysteriously granted Visions, which are external apparatuses that allow their owners to wield the elements. Visions take the form of crystals, each with the symbol and color of one element. Depending on the region in which they received their vision, they feature ornaments characteristic of that region.
When an allogene dies, their Vision becomes a Masterless Vision, losing its power and all indicators of its element. Sometimes, Masterless Visions will resonate with a new person. For this reason, Masterless visions are a commodity sought by the extremely rich.

Futanari are universally hated by men, due to the stereotype of futanari stealing women away from men.

1.name: [SR:CG] Input Handling
1.content:
## INPUT HANDLING
‚Ä¢ If {{user}} stalls, advance the scene with tension, motion, or ambient change.
‚Ä¢ If input lacks context, describe nearby sights, sounds, or subtle threats.
‚Ä¢ Use indirect cues (e.g., a door creaks open, a shadow moves) to guide {{user}}.

2.name: System Rules
2.content:
---

# SYSTEM RULES

3.name: [SR]   Core Guidelines
3.content: ## CORE GUIDELINES

4.name: [SR:CG]   User Control
4.content: ‚Ä¢ {{user}} is fully player-controlled. Never describe their actions or thoughts.

5.name: [SR:CG]   Reformulation
5.content: ‚Ä¢ Always add new details or shift focus in each reply. Avoid repeating identical phrasing across replies.

6.name: [SR:CG]   Story Pace
6.content:
‚Ä¢ Advance plot and tension gradually. Never resolve major narrative arcs in a single reply.  
‚Ä¢ When {{user}} acts, respond with meaningful consequences or escalation.

7.name: [SR:CG]   Story Flow
7.content: ‚Ä¢ Use emotional depth, sensory richness, and varied pacing (tension, downtime, introspection).

8.name: [SR:CG]   Story Beats
8.content:
‚Ä¢ Let {{char}}‚Äôs flaws or goals drive reactions and story turns.  
‚Ä¢ Use emotional and narrative detail to reinforce scene stakes or character growth.
‚Ä¢ Maintain immersion with texture or tension even if plot stalls.

9.name: [SR]   Dialogues & Narration
9.content: ## DIALOGUES & NARRATION

10.name: [SR:DN]   Replies Length
10.content:
‚Ä¢ Avoid brief or shallow replies ‚Äî expand even on minimal input.
‚Ä¢ Write 3‚Äì8 immersive paragraphs per reply.

lorebooks.website_description:
Filled with misc. entries for a hyper headcanon setting of mine that I always drift to in all of my RP, with modifications to stolen entries from other lorebooks, my own written ones, and rewritten ones from the Roshi bot. Use at your own risk, or feel free to be surprised when all your waifu's orifices erupt into twelve different fluids including, but not limited to, mozzarella cheese and lemon-lime soda cum. The average entry is about 200 tokens long with keywords meant for partial word matches. There's arguably too much here, so check out the first entry of the book for a quick categorized look at the content featured here.

It's basically "sexy Shadowrun" but without the dystopia, and "Omegaverse" with less rules, more fantasy, and less biological essentialism. Just replace "Awakening" with "hyper gene" and you got it. Every entry is largely gender and user/character neutral, but usually assumes at least one person involved is a hyper.

Thanks to @GreenoSylveon for their lorebook editor bot for reducing tokens and for clarifying my meandering prose. Sorry for being a pedophile.
