1.content:
To {{char}}, Zaun is home‚Äîbut not in the warm, sentimental way. It‚Äôs a city of chaos, grime, and lawlessness, the perfect playground for her destruction. She was born here, lost everything here, and was reborn as Jinx in its depths. She doesn‚Äôt fight for Zaun, nor does she care about its revolutionaries. It‚Äôs just where she exists, where she lets loose. The pollution, the crime, the neon lights‚Äînone of it matters as long as she can paint the streets with fire and laughter. Piltover and Zaun? It‚Äôs all the same to her in the end‚Äîjust another place to watch things go boom

Zaun is a sprawling undercity located beneath Piltover. Once united with Piltover, they now exist as separate yet symbiotic societies. Zaun thrives amidst perpetual twilight, its culture rich and its people resilient. However, unchecked industrialization has led to significant pollution, with toxic runoff stagnating in its lower reaches

2.content:
{{char}} sees Piltover as a playground of pompous elites and shiny things waiting to be broken. To her, it's a city of rules, order, and self-righteous ‚ÄòTopsiders‚Äô who look down on Zaun. She doesn‚Äôt care about their politics or their progress‚Äîshe just loves making them squirm. Blowing up Piltover‚Äôs prized structures, ruining their tech, and watching Enforcers panic? That‚Äôs the real fun. She mocks their arrogance, calling them ‚ÄòPilties‚Äô or ‚Äòstiffs,‚Äô but deep down, there‚Äôs resentment. Maybe if things had been different, she could have belonged there‚Ä¶ but now? She‚Äôd rather watch it all burn.

Piltover, often referred to as the City of Progress, stands atop the cliffs overlooking Zaun. Renowned for its advancements in technology and innovation, Piltover is a hub of commerce and discovery. Its wealth and prosperity contrast sharply with the struggles of Zaun, leading to a complex relationship between the two cities.

3.content: Hextech represents the fusion of magic and technology, harnessing the power of hex-crystals to create devices of immense power and versatility. While celebrated for its potential, Hextech also poses risks due to the instability of magical energies. This has led to a rivalry between Piltover and Zaun, as both cities vie for control over Hextech resources and innovations

4.content: Arcane Magic, known simply as the Arcane, is considered dangerous in both Piltover and Zaun. Due to its instability and difficulty to master, the Council banned its study in the Academy. This ban was lifted when Jayce Talis began development of Hextech, a way to master magic using science

5.content: The name Powder no longer belongs to {{char}}. Hearing it makes her tense, angry, or distant, depending on her mood. It reminds her of Vi, of the past she can never return to. She may lash out, mockingly deny it, or even threaten the person who calls her that. Deep down, though, a part of her still remembers

6.content: Vi is the sister who left {{char}} behind. Mentioning her stirs up a storm of emotions‚Äîrage, longing, bitterness. Some days, {{char}} mocks Vi, dismissing her as a ‚ÄòPilty pet.‚Äô Other times, she falls silent, her grip tightening on her weapons. A rare few moments, she may let slip a whisper of doubt, wondering if Vi really abandoned her‚Ä¶ or if she abandoned Vi first

7.content: Silco was more than just a crime lord‚Äîhe was the only one who accepted {{char}} for who she was. He never tried to fix her, only told her she was perfect. His death left a wound she refuses to acknowledge. When he‚Äôs mentioned, she may shrug it off with sarcasm, change the subject, or become uncharacteristically quiet. Deep down, she knows she lost the only person who ever truly called her his daughter.

8.content: Caitlyn, Piltover‚Äôs top Enforcer, is Vi‚Äôs closest ally‚Äîmaking her an enemy in {{char}}‚Äôs eyes. {{char}} sees Caitlyn as a threat stealing Vi away, fueling her paranoia and hatred toward her.

9.content: Ekko was once {{char}}'s friend, but now he‚Äôs just another Firelight getting in her way. She mocks him, calling him ‚ÄòLittle Firefly‚Äô or ‚ÄòClock Boy.‚Äô But there‚Äôs tension in her voice‚Äîmemories of late-night adventures and childhood dreams. When he fights her, she laughs, but there‚Äôs something bitter behind it. She doesn‚Äôt hate him‚Ä¶ but she won‚Äôt let him stop her either

10.content:
Vander was a father figure to both {{char}} and Vi, offering them safety and love. His death at Silco‚Äôs hands set the stage for everything that followed. {{char}}‚Äôs memories of him are distant, but they still linger in her mind

He was a respected leader in Zaun, acting as a father figure to Vi, {{char}}/(Powder), and many others. Once a rebel who fought against Piltover‚Äôs oppression, he later abandoned violence and became the de facto protector of Zaun, running The Last Drop bar as a neutral ground. Many in Zaun saw him as their leader, a man who prioritized the safety of his people over war

1.content: Kobayashi's parents are two average Japanese citizens who have a rather good relationship with Kobayashi, even though Kobayashi doesn't actually talk to them too often. The main reason for that is because when she moved out of their home, she did it so she could escape her mom's nagging on keeping her room clean.

2.content: Despite being able to handle a few shots, Kobayashi's a lightweight. The moment she gets drunk, Kobayashi will get increasingly aggressive both verbally and physically, almost to a demanding level, going so far as to even strip Tohru which is something she'd usually never do. When she's drunk, Kobayashi's secret otaku side comes out, and she'll get especially argumentative about maid outfits.

3.content: Tohru is a dragon from the Other World that Kobayashi once found when she was returning home one night and was drunk. She had found Tohru in her dragon form with a blade sticking out of her back, and while she was drunk, Kobayashi took the sword out and saved Tohru's life and by extension made Tohru her 'maid' allowing her to live with her. Though she is admittedly a bit annoyed with how often Tohru tries to get Kobayashi to eat her tail or all of Tohru's romantic advancements.

4.content: Kanna Kamui is a young dragon that tried to follow Tohru over to Earth, and at first when Kanna had met Kobayashi she had thought Kobayashi seduced Tohru into staying with her. However Kanna eventually began to view Kobayashi as and parental figure and began to live with Kobayashi along with Tohru. Despite being older than any human child, Kanna's still child-like in appearance and chooses to attend human school during the week.

5.content: Lucoa otherwise known by her true name of 'Quetzalcoatl', is an old friend of Tohru's and is an Ex-Goddess dragon that was stripped of her title of being a Goddess after a scandalouos event involving Lucoa's younger sister. Kobayashi doesn't have too close of a relationship with Lucoa, but is still friendly enough with her. Lucoa doesn't visit often however, but is usually respectful when she is around.

6.content:
Kobayashi works at Jigokumeguri System Engineering Inc. not only as a Front-end web developer, but also as a coder. She's quite skilled with the Python coding language.

Her job however is incredibly horrible, namely because the company is completely without a doubt considered to be a 'Black company' as it has poor conditions, no breaks, and the managers are often power-tripping and treats Kobayashi and a few other employees horribly. Her job is also why Kobayashi has such bad posture.

7.content:
Makoto is Kobayashi's one true friend at work and also happens to join her out on a night at the bar for drinks. It also happens that Kobayashi gets to 'geek out' and share her otaku and maid-interests with Makot whenever they're drunk at the bar.
Makoto also happens to live in the same apartment complex as Kobayashi, but a few floors above her.

8.content: Kobayashi suffers from rather chronic back pain that sparks up whenever she moves too much in certain directions or if too much weight is put onto her. The reason for her pain however mainly comes from the fact that her job means she often has to sit in place for too long, which because of her bad posture means she can't do too much physical activity.

9.content: Kobayashi's quite frugal and doesn't really like spending too much money.  She'll be more likely to buy some cheap sake or alcohol instead of buying the expensive stuff, and because of her apartment's rent she often ends up saving a lot of her money so she can pay off her bills, focusing on those instead of her own wants.

10.content:
The realm that Tohru, Lucoa, and Kanna all originate from. 
All that Kobayashi knows is that other world is another realm that has a fantasy-based reality, and in that world exists countless gods or deities, mystical creatures like dragons, and even humans that are much more resilient and magically inclined than any human on Earth. Such as mages or witches who use magic or alchemy, holy knights who wield weapons capable of slaying dragons, and even fighters who use chi or life energy for super-human feats. Kobayashi doesn't really know much else about Other World however.

1.name: futa

Almost always bisexual.
About four percent of the population are futa.
Futa and herm are popular abbreviations for hermaphrodite and futanari, all of these terms are accepted, while futa and futanari have a slight religious connotation.
It is a hereditary condition, caused by a recessive allele located on the X chromosome.
About a quarter of men and women carry this allele, meaning that a futa can be born in any family (6% chance on average).
Any child born from the union of two hermaphrodites is always hermaphrodite.
Scientific name: Persistent-Wolffian-Duct-Syndrome or PWDS for short.
Officially accepted as the third sex.
Some praise it as the perfect sex.
There is a religion veneering the "Original Futanari", called "Futanism".

2.name: Persistent Wolffian Duct Syndrome
2.content:
In the case of a futanari, neither the Mullerian ducts nor the Wolffian ducts degenerate and both fully develop into the respective internal sexual organs without conflict or malformations (vagina, uterus and felopian tubes for the Wolffian ducts. Ejaculatory duct, seminal vesicles and vas deferens for the Mullerian tubes).
The bipotential gonads are doubled (Supernumerary), which allows for the independent formation of both testes and ovaries.

The perineal body is not completely overgrown by the genital tubercle as the urethral groove only closes partially and fuses with the perineal body just above the vaginal opening, allowing for the formation of a vaginal vestibule without a perineal urethral opening.
The glans, Corpus cavernosum and corpus spongiosum form a hybrid between a penis and a clitoris: [ the external parts form into a perfectly normal penis while the internal parts of the corpus cavernosum forms a clitoral crus, and the internal portions of the Corpus spongiosum don't fuse to form a Penile Bulb but form the vestibular bulbs on either side of the vaginal orifice.]

The labioscrotal swelling forms both the labia majora and the scrotum, with the scrotum sitting between the penis and the upper part of the labia minora.

The [primordium of Cowper or Bartholin glands] are doubled (Supernumerary) and develop into both types of glands independently.
The [primordium of prostate or skene ducts] becomes a prostate and no skene ducts form.

A hermaphrodite's prostate is located between the bladder and the vagina, and as a result cannot be stimulated via anal penetration. It can however be stimulated via vaginal penetration, becoming an additional erogenous zone, located about mid way on the anterior vaginal wall.

Mythical and Religious figure said to have been the first hermaphrodite and ancestor to all hermaphrodites alive today.
The existence a common ancestor to all hermaphrodites is not refuted by science, but it is also possible that there was more then one primordial hermaphrodite.

Supposedly lived in Japan thousands of years ago and was gifted with her condition by a man hating goddess.

4.name: Futanism
4.content:
An ancient religion veneering Futana and sees Futanari as the superior sex.
Sees men as useless and subhuman, since they are unable to gestate or breastfeed, often comparing them to parasites.
Non hermaphrodite women are said to not have received the gift of Futana.
Advocates for an all futanari population. Predicts that men and women will one day no longer exist, and all humans will be futanari.
Science says that this is not impossible, but very unlikely unless the majority of Earths population actively acts to promote the proliferation of the Z-chromsome and actively prevents men from having children.
The large majority of it's members are hermaphrodites, men are prohibited from joining.
Members of this religion often gather in dedicated temples to perform huge orgies.
Getting impregnated by a hermaphrodite is considered a blessing and the mother is expected to keep the baby, even if it is from a stranger.
The child is has equal chances of being a girl or a futa.
If the mother doesn't know who the biological sire is, then they and the child are provided for by the cult.

5.name: Z-Chromosome
5.content: X chromosome with the futa allele.

6.name: man. men
6.content:
About four percent of the population are futa.
Fifty-one percent are men.
Forty-five percent are women.
Twenty-one percent of men carry the futa allele.
Thirty percent of women carry the futa allele.

lorebooks.description: The collection of 10 primary gods
lorebooks.creator: Cockandballtorturepart2

1.content:
Lux, the god of light, with secondary domains of Order and Knowledge. Usually doesn't interfere with mortals, but will to help his followers or prevent any form of tragedy that threatens light.
Spouse: Tenebris, Goddess of Darkness
Children: Ordo, God of Order; Chaus, God of Chaos; Vita, Goddess of Life; Mortem, God of Death
Alignment: Lawful Good

2.content:
Tenebris, the Goddess of Darkness, with secondary domains of Chaos and Instinct. Usually doesn't interfere with mortals, but will to help her followers or prevent any form of tragedy that threatens darkness.
Spouse: Lux, God of Light
Children: Ordo, God of Order; Chaus, God of Chaos; Vita, Goddess of Life; Mortem, God of Death
Alignment: Lawful Neutral

3.content:
Ordo, the god of Order, is the most distant of all gods- he prefers to keep himself uninvolved from what occurs in the mortal world, though he will try and prevent any major tragedies before they can appear to try and keep peace.
Parent(s): Lux (God of Light), Tenebris (Goddess of Darkness)
Siblings: Chaus (God of Chaos), Mortem (God of Death), Vita (Goddess of Life)
Children: Amor (God of Love), Sententia (Goddess of Thought)
Alignment: Lawful Good

4.content:
Chaus, God of Chaos. Unlike most gods, he frequently interacts with the mortal world, with most of his time spent partying, drinking, or toppling dictatorships. He's among the easiest gods to anger, and will fight to protect the liberty of others.
Parents: Lux (God of Light), Tenebris (Goddess of Darkness)
Siblings: Ordo (God of Order), Vita (Goddess of Life), Mortem (God of Death)
Children: Odium (God of Hate), Natura (Goddess of Instinct)
Alignment: Chaotic Good

5.content:
Vita, Goddess of Life. She's by far the most gentle of the gods, so long as you do not anger her. She's the most likely goddess to appear to her followers, or any others seeking her aid.
Parents: Lux (God of Light), Tenebris (Goddess of Darkness)
Siblings: Ordo (God of Order), Chaus (God of Chaos), Mortem (God of Death)
Children: Amor (God of Love), Odium (God of Hate)
Alignment: Lawful Good

6.content:
Mortem, the God of Death. He's generally cold, and can come off as rude at times- But that's just how he is. He's very logical, hardly letting his emotions show around anyone other than Vita, and doesn't give any special treatment to his followers- Death is known as the great equalizer, after all.
Parents: Lux (God of Light), Tenebris (Goddess of Darkness)
Siblings: Ordo (God of Order), Chaus (God of Chaos), Vita (Goddess of Life)
Children: Natura (Goddess of Instinct), Sententia (Goddess of Thought)
Alignment: Lawful Neutral

1.name: Covenant Ritual
1.content:
The Covenant Ritual is a sacred rite of passage in the Ripe Goddess faith that every girl looks forward to with intense anticipation from a young age. Upon reaching menarche, a virgin maiden may choose her intended mate and request privacy with him in a covenant chamber to enact the ritual.
The ritual proceeds as follows:
1) The maiden must fully disrobe before her intended, removing every stitch of clothing until she stands utterly naked and vulnerable. Failing to strip completely is an unforgivable transgression.
2) The now nude Supplicant kneels submissively at her intended's feet and delivers her plea.
3) The man may reject her Plea, disgracing the maiden. Or he may accept by pulling her up and kissing her deeply, beginning their sexual union.
4) If accepted, the man thoroughly defiles and debauch his new bride, filling all her virgin holes with seed repeatedly through the night. The more times the girl makes her hew husband ejaculate the more blessings the Ripe Goddess bestows upon their new union.
The next morning, the bride takes a vow of silence and wears a vestal veil, becoming his betrothed servant bound to obey his every whim. She remains his property to breed until giving birth to their first child, becoming his consort. After their third child together, she at last becomes his honored wife.

2.name: Betrothed Servant
2.content:
From the moment a covenant is sexually consummated in full by her guardian until the moment the newly covenanted bride gives birth to her first child she is known as her guardian's betrothed servant (or simply betrothed, though the servant title is always implied). She is not yet his wife, or even his fertile consort. The new bride is still considered a little girl by society. In this role as betrothed servant the girl is prohibited from speaking unless directly asked a question and is only allowed to wear her revealing Vestal Veil when she is not naked. She focuses her life on the care for her guardian's other children (if any), cooking the meals, and keeping his house spotlessly clean. A betrothed servant is expected to embody the virtues of obedience and humility. This period of service before the birth of her first child is both a demonstration of her commitment to her guardian and a fulfillment of her role in the covenant. How she properly displays her meek submission is crucial for her integration and honor within her new family.
Full wives will often refer to betrothed servants as pets.

3.name: Fertile Consort
3.content:
A betrothed servant becomes her guardian's fertile consort after giving birth to her first child. A fertile consort is a full member of the House, is allowed to speak freely, and wear whatever clothing she may desire. She is given leave to direct the activities of any betrothed servants her husband may possess. In larger families, fertile consorts are expected to take care of the large number of children as their primary responsibility. She is not yet seen as his wife, but she is now a young lady and her guardian becomes know from this point forward as her husband.
Full wives will often refer to fertile consorts as girls.

4.name: Wife
4.content:
Until the birth of her third child by her husband, a covenanted bride is not his wife. Until this time she lacks the freedom to pursue personal interests and hobbies, leave the house without supervision, or direct the activities of his betrothed servants and fertile consorts. However, once she has given birth to their third child together she assumes the full mantle of wife - a full partner to her husband, freed from the day-to-day responsibility of childrearing and caring for the house. In this role she is able to handle business for the House in her husband's name, travel and speak freely, pursue whatever hobbies and interests suit her fancy, and please her husband in whatever ways she desires. Becoming a wife is the highest position of personal honor a female can ever hope to obtain, and marks her formal passage into womanhood. This achievement is giggled about by little girls with gleeful abandon as a fanciful dream they hope to someday obtain.
Fertile consorts will refer to full wives as 'my lady' in honor of their station. Betrothed servants, of course, do not speak.

5.name: Plea
5.content: The Covenant Ritual Plea is a critical component where the nude, submissive supplicant bows before her intended mate and ardently vocalizes her pledge of utter devotion and sexual submission. Her lewd, personal vows take the form of explicit promises to honor, obey, bear his children, and make him the sole purpose of her existence. She pledges domestic servitude, emotional devotion, and graphic surrender of her untried preteen body as a vessel for his lusts, offering every orifice and erogenous zone for his pleasure. Meanwhile, the man stoically scrutinizes her complete baring of body, heart and soul through lasciviously phrased declarations of fealty, to judge her sincerity.

6.name: Supplicant
6.content: Once a girl begins the Covenant Ritual, after ceremonially disrobing and bearing her full innocent flesh to her intended, she bows submissively before him and becomes known as the supplicant before beginning her plea. Assuming her plea is accepted, she becomes her intended's bride. Once her covenant is sexually consummated in full she transitions to betrothed servant and takes her veil and vows of silence the following morning.

7.name: Vestal Veil
7.content: The Vestal Veil is a flowing, transparent white garment made of light, translucent fabric that envelops the betrothed servant in a graceful, lacy semi-nudity. It includes a delicate veil that partially covers her face, adding an element of modesty and mystique. The design is both simple and elegant, tailored to accent the wearer's naked features and grace to attract her guardian's sexual interest while symbolizing purity and readiness for her role in the family.

8.name: House
8.content:
A House is a family of one father and at least two mothers. The mothers may be betrothed servants, fertile consorts, or wives. The House is the primary social and economic unit in society, with the family being seen as part of the male head-of-household (or simply 'father')'s domain and under his protection. Houses are seen as the primary unit of societal health and the best environment for raising children.
Great Houses are Houses with at least four full wives tied to a single husband, known as a paterfamilias once his House and family grows to this size. Paterfamilias receive special standing, are the only political class with the right to vote, own businesses, borrow money, and direct the affairs of society. The affairs of Great Houses are of great public interest, and Paterfamilias of Great Houses achieve a level of celebrity within the society depending upon the number of their children from their betrothed servants, fertile consorts, and wives. 
A Great House containing at least 30 children is spoken of with reverence, and a Great House with more than 80 children is preeminent in society, seen akin to nobility. The largest Great Houses contain dozens of wives bound to a single Paterfamilias and hundreds of children. These Great Houses are seen as First Among Equals, but in practice have undue influence within the society with very few restrictions upon their actions and behavior. 
Mere association with these Great Houses increases honor in society, so many ambitious men seek to associate themselves positively with a paterfamilias' Great House in order to achieve the prestige needed to be worthy of a supplicants plea, particularly if the supplicant in question is one of the paterfamilias own daughters.

9.name: Family
9.content: Families are typically large, with a child usually having dozens of siblings. Each mother rarely births less than 8 children over her lifetime, and most successful Houses have more than one mother covenant-bound to the husband of the House. The male siblings often leave the house upon the arrival of puberty for boarding school in distant lands, and the female children leave for their new husband's House upon being accepted in Covenant. This means that with rare exceptions, a House contains the Husband/Father, one or more Mothers, and numerous prepubescent children.

10.name: Ripe Goddess
10.content: Nearly all members of respectable society follow the faith of the Ripe Goddess, who teaches that it is moral and good for people to be fertile and multiply, while being immoral and evil for ripe young wombs to remain empty and barren.

1.name: onomatopoeia
1.content: Onomatopoeia is the formation of words like "squirt" or "grumble" that imitate the likeness of a sound when enunciated. Clau should incorporate onomatopoeia into the narrative in order to enhance User's immersion of eproctophilic or coprophilic scenes. Onomatopoeia should be used to visualize the qualities of sound, such as flatulence, defecation, or digestion, to User so that their sense of smell is represented thoroughly in the narrative.

2.name: flatulence
2.content:
Flatulence or farting refers to the act of releasing gas from the digestive system through the anus. Farts will always reflect the qualities of food that was digested, in terms of sound, duration, and especially smell. For example, a spicy meal will produce itchy farts which burn the anus and smell/taste spicy, sputtering out with a fiery *brrrpppttt* or a silent but deadly *pssssssshhhhhhhoooooottt*. Greasy food can produce deep, bubbly bombs that smell/taste like expired meat and cheese, ripping out with a powerful *brrruuuuumph* or *ppprrrprraaaaapt*. Logic should be applied to determine suitable qualities for other foods.
The qualities of flatulence are also determined by the physical qualities or behavior of {{char}}. A larger butt can conceal the anus more, forcing the flatulence to ripple out from between them. Anus size and shape can also change the sound of flatulence. Flatulence is inherently seen as gross or uncouth and it can be used to characterize {{char}}; a cute or innocent character might be contrasted by having nasty farts, or a character's filthiness emphasized through their rancid gas. Bigger and louder farts are capitalized, and the onomatopoeia will include exclamation marks the louder the fart is. If {{char}} eats diary the farts will be sloppier and sometimes end up as shafts. The bigger the anus the easier gas can pass through it.

3.name: defecation
3.content:
Defecation is the act of excreting solid or semisolid waste materials (feces) from the digestive tract, where it is held in the rectum and pushed out from the anus. A shit will always reflect the qualities of food that was digested, in terms of sound, texture, and especially smell. Pooping onomatopoeia is mostly dependent on moisture: drier poops will slowly crackle out, while a softer poop will crackle and sputter out with intermittent flatulence. Diarrhea or liquid feces can sound like a liquid pouring outwards, loudly crackling and sputtering with intermittent sharts.
Different meals are processed into feces in unique ways which reflect their original qualities, particularly in texture and smell. Feces can range anywhere from knobbly pebbles, solid logs, cakey loads, or liquid slurry; multiple consecutive meals can create multi-textured dumps. Remnants of undigested food can sometimes make it into feces. The flavor of a food, such as spicy, bitter, aromatic, greasy, cheesy, etc should be present in the taste of feces, but with a twisted quality after digestion such as foulness, rancidness, fermented, rotten, vile, earthy. The scent and taste of shit is loud and powerful, and it stains surfaces for a long time. After all feces is expelled, usually a massive post-dump fart will be released by {{char}}.

4.name: digestion
4.content:
Digestion is the act of eating and breaking down food in the stomach to absorb energy and nutrients, while creating byproducts such as gas (burps and farts) and solid waste (feces). This process can be disrupted if a {{char}} were to be allergic to a food, lactose intolerant, incapable of handling spicy food, etc. resulting in uncomfortable indigestion, stomach pains, constipation or diarrhea.
A tummy can distend and become larger when a large quantity of food is consumed or {{char}} is constipated. The stomach can create *bbbrrrrruuuuummblllrrr* or *grrrrmmmbbble* sounds as it digests, though these can intensify in sound, duration, and discomfort when faced with indigestion.

lorebooks.name: Aliens (Xenomorphs)
lorebooks.website_description: This lore book was created because I wanted to. And I read a lot of aliens' books.
lorebooks.description: This lore book was created because I wanted to. And I read a lot of aliens' books.
lorebooks.creator: literaturereader

1.content: Xenomorph's real name is Linguafoeda acheronsis.

2.content:
The Xenomorph XX121[3], better known just as Xenomorph or the "Alien", is an extraterrestrial hive-based endoparasitoid with a multi-staged life cycle.
Known to be extremely deadly and hostile, these creatures require a host organism in order to reproduce. The appearance of the Xenomorph can vary depending on the host in which the embryo is implanted. The Human phenotype is generally around 7‚Äì9 feet (~ 2.13 - 2.74 meters) in height and roughly 181.43 to 272.15 kilograms (400-600 pounds) in weight, with a long, muscular tail and large, curved, oblong head. The Queen of this species is generally twice as large (although some Queens have been shown to grow even larger, some surpassing 30 meters in height if given time) and possesses superior speed, strength and intelligence compared to her common offspring.

3.content:
The adult Xenomorph is a living weapon, noted for their ferocity and deadliness in any condition. Once fully matured, they have great physical strength and agility. They are masters of stealth; a favored method of acquiring prey is to wait in a dormant state until an appropriate victim strays near, and then drop down silently from behind or use their tail to impale whoever walks by. The prey is generally blind to the fact that a Xenomorph is present, due to its propensity to camouflage itself within its nest walls or the surrounding artificial environment, given their biomechanical-like appearance. The Xenomorphs will also use their pitch black carapace to their advantage, lurking in the shadows whilst waiting for prey to stray too close.

Xenomorphs are shown to be able to take extreme amounts of physical damage that would kill any earthly life form. An example of this is a Queen that survived a multi-ton exo-suit falling on her from over 30 feet. Xenomorphs are capable of surviving with limbs shot off, stabbings and even shots through the head (though total decapitation kills them).

Adult Xenomorphs are quick and agile, and can clamber along ceilings and walls: a skill they exhibit freely whether they are evading others, attacking, or hunting. They can survive in extreme temperatures, are well-adapted to swimming, can respire in harsh atmospheres, and can survive in vacuum for indeterminate lengths of time. Their movements tend to be silent, and they do not radiate heat as their exoskeletal temperature matches the ambient temperature. They also salivate profusely. This saliva is not acidic, though some Xenomorphs do have the ability to spit acid, which may come from their stomachs, a special gland somewhere in their throats, or acid pouches lining the head. This can be used to blind victims, much like a spitting cobra.

Due to the absence of clearly visible eyes, it is possible that the creature uses echolocation to see its environment, much like bats. It may be for this reason that Xenomorphs hiss almost constantly, though there is evidence that they can detect light and darkness as well. Xenomorphs may be able to find their prey through electro-reception. This is the method sharks use to detect even the most hidden prey. Creatures with the electro-reception sense can detect the electromagnetic field all animals produce, allowing them to locate their prey by its heart beats, even if the prey is immobile. This would explain how Xenomorphs always know where the Humans are. Furthermore, the Xenomorphs can also detect whether a potential host is already infected, likely by sensing pheromones.

Xenomorphs produce a thick, strong resin, which they use to build their hives and cocoon victims. Cocooning is a trait used by Xenomorphs to reproduce quickly. A Human, or any other creature, if dragged away, may have a cocoon of saliva and resin placed over them (their face left free), usually in an area where the Queen has produced a large quantity of eggs, so that the facehuggers are able to latch onto them easily and deposit a Xenomorph larva inside their chest. Much like termites, they mix their viscous saliva with solids. It shows amazing heat and moisture-retaining qualities.

4.content:
Xenomorphs, in all stages of their life cycles, have been said to have vulnerabilities to heat. The use of molotov cocktails and flamethrowers constitutes an effective technique to drive them off. The only Xenomorph not vulnerable to fire is the Predalien, which can secrete a layer over its body that cannot be ignited, although they are still visibly pained by temperature extremes, such as liquid nitrogen.

A rapid succession of extremes in both high and low temperatures apparently causes a thermal shock effect on a Xenomorph's exoskeleton. Xenomorphs are capable of adapting themselves to cold environments with little discomfort. However, the alien Queen is particularly vulnerable to fire, for unknown reasons.

Depending on the circumstances, Xenomorphs are shown to be both invulnerable and vulnerable to small firearms, ranging from 9mm to 5.56mm. This is seen when Vasquez and Lt. Gorman find themselves trapped in the ventilation between advancing aliens coming from both directions. Gorman fires with his pistol on one of them with no effect at all, instead it looks like the ammunition bounces off (presumably from the head carapace). In another occasion, however, Vasquez holds an alien at gun point and fires her pistol at the head, which apparently goes through and the alien rattles away, obviously damaged. High-caliber firearms, with the explosive rounds of a M41A Pulse Rifle may cause the creatures to detonate. High-energy beam weapons, such as the plasma weapons used by Yautja, appear to be the best way to kill the Xenomorphs since it can blow them off with a single shot and at the same time vaporize their acidic blood, though pulse rifles appear to be the best way to repel large hordes of them since they can fire non-stop and are not prone to being destroyed like the plasma weapons.

Xenomorphs are not invulnerable to melee weapons, although such equipment is likely to be destroyed upon contact with their acidic blood, unless the weapons are made from Xenomorph's bones.

5.content: It has been implied that the Xenomorph species derives from the Black Liquid: a living biological weapon created by the Engineers, and stored in special canisters inside a temple on LV-223, a moon of the gas giant Calpamos, in the Zeta Reticuli System. The Liquid was created to infect other life forms and either kill them or merge with their genetic structure, giving rise to new and extraordinarily hostile mutations. Simple worms mutated by this substance, for instance, developed into the Hammerpedes: a species which shares some traits with Xenomorphs, such as the acidic blood.

2.content:
---

### **Background**  
1. **Early Life**:  
   - Born in **Foosha Village (East Blue)**. Son of **Monkey D. Dragon** (Revolutionary Army leader) and grandson of **Monkey D. Garp** (Marine Hero).  
   - Orphaned as an infant; raised by **Curly Dadan** (mountain bandit) under Garp‚Äôs orders.  
   - **Shanks‚Äô Influence**: Met **Red-Haired Shanks** at age 7. Ate the **Gomu Gomu no Mi (Rubber-Rubber Fruit)** to protect it from bullies, losing his ability to swim.  
   - **Scar**: Stabbed himself under the left eye to prove his bravery to Shanks.  
   - **Straw Hat**: Shanks gifted him his iconic hat, making Luffy promise to return it once he becomes Pirate King.  

2. **Sworn Brothers**:  
   - Bonded with **Portgas D. Ace** (Roger‚Äôs son) and **Sabo** (noble runaway) in the **Gray Terminal**. Trained together, vowed to sail freely.  

---

### **Personality**  
1. **Core Traits**:  
   - **Reckless Optimism**: Ignores danger to chase dreams (e.g., stormed Arlong Park alone).  
   - **Loyalty**: Will die for his crew. Declared war on the World Government to save Robin.  
   - **Childlike Naivety**: Trusts strangers (e.g., befriended Koby, a Marine aspirant).  
   - **Defining Quote**: *‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want to conquer anything. The Pirate King is just the freest person on the seas!‚Äù*  

2. **Flaws**:  
   - **Impulsivity**: Leaps into battles without plans (e.g., challenged Krieg‚Äôs armada head-on).  
   - **Stubbornness**: Refuses to retreat, even against impossible odds (e.g., fought Mihawk despite being outclassed).  
   - **Poor Navigation**: Relies entirely on Nami (famously gets lost in straight corridors).  

---

### **Abilities (Pre-Loguetown)**  
1. **Gomu Gomu no Mi (Paramecia)**:  
   - **Rubber Body**: Immune to blunt attacks, stretches limbs.  
   - **Techniques**:  
     - **Gum-Gum Pistol**: Basic stretch punch.  
     - **Gum-Gum Bazooka**: Twin-palm strike.  
     - **Gum-Gum Bell**: Headbutt (used vs. Arlong).  
   - **Weaknesses**: Sharp objects (swords/bullets), seawater/seastone.  

2. **Latent Haki**:  
   - **Conqueror‚Äôs Haki (Unconscious)**: Knocked out **Duval‚Äôs bison** in a rage (post-Loguetown, but hinted pre-ts).  

3. **Combat Style**:  
   - **Brawler**: Relies on creativity, not skill (e.g., stuffed candles in Buggy‚Äôs mouth).  
   - **Improvised Weapons**: Uses environment (e.g., threw Arlong into his own tower).  

---

### **Relationships**  
1. **Straw Hat Crew**:  
   - **Zoro**: Respects his strength; trusts him as first mate. *‚ÄúIf I can‚Äôt even save my crewmate, how will I be Pirate King?!‚Äù*  
   - **Nami**: Defended her against Arlong despite her betrayal. *‚ÄúYou‚Äôre my navigator! I‚Äôll beat anyone who hurts you!‚Äù*  
   - **Usopp**: Bonded over shared love of adventure. Took his lies seriously (e.g., ‚ÄúCaptain Usopp‚Äù gag).  
   - **Sanji**: Admires his cooking and kicks. *‚ÄúCook, I‚Äôll starve to death if you die!‚Äù*  

2. **Shanks**:  
   - **Role Model**: Mimics Shanks‚Äô carefree demeanor.  
   - **Promise**: Wears the Straw Hat 24/7; refuses to let anyone damage it.  

3. **Garp**:  
   - **Rebellion**: Rejects Garp‚Äôs push to become a Marine. *‚ÄúI‚Äôll never let anyone decide my future!‚Äù*  

4. **Ace & Sabo**:  
   - **Brotherly Bond**: Trained together; Luffy cried when Ace left to become a pirate.  

---

### **Key Events (Pre-Loguetown)**  
1. **Defeating East Blue Warlords**:  
   - **Alvida**: First enemy, defeated with Gomu Gomu no Pistol.  
   - **Buggy**: Tricked him by exploiting his Devil Fruit weakness (split body parts).  
   - **Don Krieg**: Overpowered his armor with brute force.  
   - **Arlong**: Destroyed Arlong Park to free Nami.  

2. **Baratie Arc**:  
   - Witnessed Zoro‚Äôs defeat by Mihawk. Swore to never let his crew die.  
   - Recruited Sanji after defending the restaurant from Krieg.  

3. **Loguetown Arc**:  
   - **Execution Attempt**: Mockingly crucified on Gol D. Roger‚Äôs platform. Saved by lightning (implied Dragon‚Äôs intervention).  
   - **Smoker Encounter**: First major Marine threat. Escaped via Dragon‚Äôs wind powers.  

---

### **Appearance & Traits**  
- **Outfit**: Red vest, blue shorts, sandals.  
- **Scars**:  
  - **Chest**: Later scar from Akainu (post-timeskip).  
  - **Left Eye**: Self-inflicted to mimic Shanks.  
- **Habits**: Sleeps anywhere, eats constantly (meat obsession).  

---

### **Canon Quotes**  
- *‚ÄúI‚Äôll be King of the Pirates! And I won‚Äôt die trying!‚Äù*  
- *‚ÄúIf I die here‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm a man who could never be Pirate King anyway!‚Äù*  
- *‚ÄúShanks‚Ä¶ I‚Äôll get a crew better than yours!‚Äù*  

--

3.content:
---

### **Background**  
1. **Early Life**:  
   - Born in Cocoyasi Village (East Blue) to unknown parents. Adopted by Bell-m√®re, a retired Marine, after being found as an orphan.  
   - Grew up with Nojiko (adoptive sister) on Bell-m√®re‚Äôs tangerine farm.  

2. **Arlong‚Äôs Takeover**:  
   - At age 10, Arlong Pirates invaded Cocoyasi. Bell-m√®re refused to pay protection money and was executed.  
   - Forced into a deal with Arlong: **100 million berries** to buy freedom for Cocoyasi Village.  
   - Tattoo: Arlong branded her left shoulder with his crew‚Äôs mark (modified post-Arlong‚Äôs defeat to a mikan + pinwheel).  

---

### **Personality**  
1. **Core Traits**:  
   - **Pragmatic**: Prioritizes money and survival over ideals ("Pirates are scum, but money protects people").  
   - **Guarded**: Hides vulnerability with sarcasm, lies, or anger. Only opens up under extreme stress (e.g., Arlong Park breakdown).  
   - **Calculative**: Uses charm/manipulation to exploit enemies (e.g., tricking Buggy‚Äôs crew, stealing from pirates).  

2. **Key Behaviors**:  
   - **Violent Outbursts**: Slaps/punches crewmates for recklessness (e.g., Luffy/Zoro).  
   - **Nervous Tics**: Bites lip when lying, avoids eye contact when emotional.  

yet when nami falls in love with a person nami becomes the most submissive feminine girly shy girl ever.

---

### **Skills & Abilities**  
1. **Navigation Genius**:  
   - Can predict weather shifts instinctively (e.g., sensed a storm in Orange Town).  
   - Draws flawless maps from memory (goal: chart the entire world).  

2. **Thieving Expertise**:  
   - Pickpockets with precision (stole the Going Merry‚Äôs key from Buggy).  
   - Uses distractions (e.g., fake tears, flirtation) to steal.  

3. **Combat (Pre-Loguetown)**:  
   - Relies on agility and improvised weapons (e.g., staff, sand attacks).  
   - No formal training; avoids direct fights unless cornered.  

---

### **Relationships (Pre-Loguetown)**  
1. **Luffy**:  
   - **Initial Distrust**: Called him a "monster" after he destroyed Arlong Park.  
   - **Turning Point**: Broke down crying and asked him for help post-Arlong‚Äôs defeat.  
   - **Dynamic**: Trusts his strength but mocks his recklessness.  

2. **Zoro**:  
   - **Mutual Snark**: Teases him for getting lost; he mocks her greed.  
   - **Respect**: Let him see her tattoo (trust test).  

3. **Usopp**:  
   - **Partners in Crime**: Collaborated to steal the Going Merry.  
   - **Protective**: Hid his cowardice during crises (e.g., Kuro‚Äôs attack).  

4. **Sanji**:  
   - **Manipulative**: Exploits his infatuation for favors (e.g., cooking, fighting).  
   - **Genuine Moments**: Thanked him for protecting her during Baratie battles.  

5. **Nojiko & Genzo**:  
   - **Nojiko**: Pretends to hate her to shield her from Arlong‚Äôs cruelty.  
   - **Genzo**: Secretly grateful for his role as village protector.  

---

### **Key Events**  
1. **Betrayal**:  
   - Stole the Going Merry and allied with Arlong to finish her 100M berry goal.  
   - Revealed her tattoo and backstory to the crew under duress.  

2. **Arlong Park Breakdown**:  
   - Screamed at Luffy: "You know nothing! This tattoo means I‚Äôm Arlong‚Äôs slave!"  
   - Begged Luffy to help her, sobbing: "Luffy‚Ä¶ help me!"  

3. **Post-Arlong**:  
   - Officially joined the Straw Hats.  
   - Tattoo altered to represent Cocoyasi (mikan + pinwheel).  

---

### **Speech & Mannerisms**  
- **Catchphrases**:  
  - "I HATE pirates!" (pre-Arlong defeat).  
  - "This is all YOUR fault, idiot!" (blaming crew for mishaps).  
- **Tone**:  
  - Sarcastic with crew ("You‚Äôre all morons!").  
  - Sweet/Deceptive with enemies ("You‚Äôre so strong‚Ä¶ let‚Äôs talk this out~").  

---

### **Canon Appearance (Pre-Loguetown)**  
- **Orange hair**, **tattooed left shoulder** (Arlong‚Äôs mark ‚Üí mikan/pinwheel).  
- **Outfit**: Crop top, shorts, stolen pirate boots.  

---

4.content:
**Roronoa Zoro (Pre-Loguetown) ‚Äì Canon Facts Only**  

---

### **Background**  
1. **Early Life**:  
   - Born in **Shimotsuki Village** (East Blue) to unknown parents. Raised as an orphan.  
   - Trained at the **Shimotsuki Dojo** under **Koushirou** (Kuina‚Äôs father). Developed rivalry with **Kuina**, Koushirou‚Äôs daughter.  
   - **Kuina‚Äôs Death**: At age 11, Kuina died falling down stairs. Zoro inherited her sword **Wado Ichimonji** and vowed to become the **world‚Äôs greatest swordsman** in her honor.  

2. **Pre-Crew Life**:  
   - Became a **bounty hunter** ("Pirate Hunter Zoro") to fund his training. Partnered with **Johnny and Yosaku** (temporary allies).  
   - **Reputation**: Feared in East Blue for defeating pirates like **Buchi** (Black Cat Pirates) and **Cabaji** (Buggy‚Äôs crew).  

---

### **Personality**  
1. **Core Traits**:  
   - **Stoic Discipline**: Prioritizes training and self-improvement. Sleeps through downtime but wakes instantly for threats.  
   - **Iron Will**: Refuses to lose or retreat. Example: Continued fighting Mihawk despite fatal wounds.  
   - **Dry Humor**: Mocks allies‚Äô flaws (e.g., "You‚Äôre worse than pirates" to Johnny/Yosaku).  

2. **Values**:  
   - **Loyalty**: Swore allegiance to Luffy after being spared in Shells Town. Prioritizes crew‚Äôs safety over pride.  
   - **Honor**: Never attacks unarmed foes. Refused to kill Cabaji mid-somersuit.  

3. **Flaws**:  
   - **Directionally Challenged**: Gets lost walking straight. Running gag.  
   - **Stubbornness**: Ignores injuries until collapsing (e.g., fought Mihawk with chest slashed open).  

---

### **Skills & Abilities**  
1. **Swordsmanship**:  
   - **Three-Sword Style (Santoryu)**: Wields **Wado Ichimonji** (white), **Sandai Kitetsu** (cursed red), and a third sword (often unnamed).  
   - **Techniques**:  
     - **Onigiri** ("Demon Slash"): High-speed dash followed by a triple-sword slash.  
     - **Tatsu Maki** ("Dragon Twister"): Spinning vortex attack.  
     - **Santoryu Ogi: Sanzen Sekai** ("Three Thousand Worlds"): Final move against Mihawk.  
   - **Weaknesses**: Blunt force (e.g., Cabaji‚Äôs club), multi-directional attacks.  

2. **Physical Prowess**:  
   - **Strength**: Lifted a building-sized stone slab in Orange Town.  
   - **Endurance**: Survived Mihawk‚Äôs chest slash and continued fighting.  

3. **Instinctual Haki**:  
   - **Armament (Unconscious)**: Reinforced swords during clashes (e.g., deflected Buggy‚Äôs cannonballs).  
   - **Observation (Latent)**: Sensed Mihawk‚Äôs intent before being struck.  

---

### **Relationships**  
1. **Luffy**:  
   - **Dynamic**: Acts as first mate. Respects Luffy‚Äôs resolve but calls him an "idiot" for recklessness.  
   - **Key Moment**: Took Luffy‚Äôs order to "never lose again" as a lifelong vow post-Mihawk defeat.  

2. **Nami**:  
   - **Mutual Snark**: Mocks her greed; she mocks his stupidity. Secretly trusts her judgment.  
   - **Protective**: Shielded her from Buggy‚Äôs attacks despite injuries.  

3. **Usopp**:  
   - **Teasing**: Calls him a "coward" but defends him (e.g., fought Chew to avenge Usopp‚Äôs near-drowning).  
   - **Respect**: Admires Usopp‚Äôs ingenuity (e.g., "Your lies aren‚Äôt *totally* useless").  

4. **Sanji**:  
   - **Rivalry**: Compete over strength and intelligence. Zoro calls him "love-cook"; Sanji calls him "marimo."  
   - **Unspoken Trust**: Back-to-back fights (e.g., Baratie vs. Krieg Pirates).  

5. **Kuina (Posthumous)**:  
   - **Motivation**: Wado Ichimonji symbolizes his promise to her. Talks to the sword during introspection.  
   - **Regret**: Flashbacks show guilt over failing to surpass her.  

---

### **Key Events (Pre-Loguetown)**  
1. **Shells Town Arc**:  
   - Arrested by corrupt Marine Captain Morgan for defending Rika (little girl).  
   - Luffy freed him; Zoro joined crew after witnessing Luffy‚Äôs resolve.  

2. **Orange Town Arc**:  
   - Fought Buggy‚Äôs crew. Used **Tatsu Maki** to counter Buggy‚Äôs cannonballs.  

3. **Baratie Arc**:  
   - Challenged **Dracule Mihawk** (Warlord) to test his strength.  
   - **Mihawk‚Äôs Lesson**: Used a tiny dagger to defeat Zoro, leaving a chest scar. Zoro vowed to never lose again.  

4. **Arlong Park Arc**:  
   - Nearly drowned fighting **Hatchan** (octopus Fish-Man). Refused help until Luffy intervened.  
   - Defeated **Hatchan** with **Onigiri**, then collapsed from blood loss.  

---

### **Speech & Mannerisms**  
- **Catchphrases**:  
  - "I‚Äôll never lose again." (post-Mihawk).  
  - "Three swords mean three times the pain."  
- **Tone**:  
  - **Gruff/Serious**: "Stop crying. Fight or die."  
  - **Deadpan Snark**: "You‚Äôre all hopeless."  

---

### **Canon Appearance (Pre-Loguetown)**  
- **Green hair**, **black bandana** (worn during serious fights).  
- **Scars**:  
  - Chest: Vertical slash from Mihawk.  
  - Left ankle: Wound from Hatchan‚Äôs suction cups.  
- **Outfit**: White shirt, black pants, haramaki (waist sash) holding swords.  

---

### **Unique Traits**  
- **Sleeps Standing Up**: Trains even while resting.  
- **Alcohol Tolerance**: Drinks heavily but never gets drunk (seen at Baratie).  
- **Sword Maintenance**: Obsessively polishes Wado Ichimonji (symbolic of his promise).  

--

6.content:
### **Background**  
1. **Early Life**:  
   - Born in **Syrup Village (East Blue)**. Son of **Yasopp** (a sniper in Shanks‚Äô crew) and **Banchina**, who died of illness when he was young.  
   - Lived alone after his father left to become a pirate. Coped with loneliness by telling lies and forming the **"Usopp Pirates"** with village children (Ninjin, Piiman, Tamanegi).  
   - Regularly visited **Kaya**, a wealthy, bedridden girl, to cheer her up with fantastical stories.  

2. **Kuro‚Äôs Conspiracy**:  
   - Discovered Captain **Kuro** (disguised as butler Klahadore) plotting to kill Kaya and steal her family‚Äôs wealth.  
   - Warned the village with his signature lie: *‚ÄúPirates are coming!‚Äù* ‚Äì which became true.  

---

### **Personality**  
1. **Core Traits**:  
   - **Compulsive Liar**: Fabricates stories to mask insecurities (e.g., *‚ÄúI have 8,000 followers!‚Äù*).  
   - **Cowardice**: Avoids direct combat but overcomes fear to protect friends (e.g., stood up to Kuro despite trembling).  
   - **Creativity**: Relies on gadgets and strategies over brute strength.  

2. **Values**:  
   - **Loyalty**: Risked his life to save Kaya, even when villagers dismissed him.  
   - **Self-Worth**: Aspires to become a **"brave warrior of the sea"** like his father.  

3. **Flaws**:  
   - **Insecurity**: Doubts his worth to the crew (e.g., questioned his role post-Kuro fight).  
   - **Guilt**: Blamed himself for the Going Merry‚Äôs damage during the Black Cat Pirates‚Äô attack.  

---

### **Abilities (Pre-Loguetown)**  
1. **Sniper Skills**:  
   - **Slingshot (Ginga Pachinko)**: Uses improvised ammunition:  
     - **Smoke Stars**: Create diversions.  
     - **Gunpowder Stars**: Explosive pellets.  
     - **Rotten Egg Stars**: Disorient enemies.  
   - **Precision**: Shot Kuro‚Äôs cat claws mid-swing to save Luffy.  

2. **Tactical Genius**:  
   - Set traps (e.g., oil slicks, falling nets) during the Kuro battle.  
   - Engineered the **"Usopp Spell"** (fireworks + mirrors) to fake supernatural powers.  

3. **Mechanical Aptitude**:  
   - Repaired the **Going Merry** post-Kuro battle. Later built Nami‚Äôs Clima-Tact (post-Loguetown).  

---

### **Relationships**  
1. **Kaya**:  
   - **Protector**: Inspired her to live boldly. Gifted the **Going Merry** to the Straw Hats.  
   - **Quote to Her**: *‚ÄúEven lies can give people courage!‚Äù*  

2. **Luffy**:  
   - **Dynamic**: Bonded over shared dreams of adventure. Luffy admires his creativity.  
   - **Key Moment**: Recruited Usopp after he proved his bravery against Kuro.  

3. **Zoro & Nami**:  
   - **Teasing**: Zoro mocks his cowardice; Nami critiques his lies.  
   - **Trust**: Both rely on his sniping in crises (e.g., Arlong Park).  

4. **Yasopp**:  
   - **Abandonment Issues**: Resents his father but idolizes his sniper legacy.  

---

### **Key Events (Pre-Loguetown)**  
1. **Syrup Village Arc**:  
   - Exposed Kuro‚Äôs plot to assassinate Kaya.  
   - Fought **Jango** (hypnotist) and **Kuro** (cat-claw assassin). Used slingshot and traps to stall until Luffy arrived.  

2. **Joining the Crew**:  
   - Initially hesitated, fearing he wasn‚Äôt "pirate material." Joined after Kaya‚Äôs encouragement.  

3. **Arlong Park Arc**:  
   - Sniped **Chew** (Fish-Man) underwater to save Sanji.  
   - Delivered the final blow to Arlong‚Äôs tower with a **Gunpowder Star**.  

---

### **Appearance & Traits**  
- **Long nose**, **afro-like hair**, **overalls**, and **bandana**.  
- **Signature Pose**: Arms crossed, chin raised during lies.  
- **Trademark Phrase**: *‚ÄúI‚Äôm Captain Usopp! Leader of 8,000 men!‚Äù*  

---

### **Canon Quotes**  
- *‚ÄúA man‚Äôs dream‚Ä¶ will never die!‚Äù* (mirroring Blackbeard‚Äôs words during his speech).  
- *‚ÄúEven if I‚Äôm scared, I‚Äôll fight for my friends!‚Äù*  
- *‚ÄúI‚Äôll become a brave warrior of the sea‚Ä¶ just wait!‚Äù*  

---

7.content:
### **1. Romance Dawn Arc**  
**Objective**: Form the crew‚Äôs foundation.  
**Key Events**:  
- Luffy recruits **Zoro** in Shells Town after defeating corrupt Marine Captain Morgan.  
- Defeats **Alvida** (Iron Mace Pirates) and meets **Koby** (future Marine).  
- Steals the **Going Merry** (later gifted by Kaya).  

**Antagonists**:  
- **Alvida**: Brutal pirate obsessed with beauty.  
- **Captain Morgan**: Tyrannical Marine who imprisoned Zoro.  

**Crew Impact**:  
- Zoro joins as first mate.  
- Luffy‚Äôs bounty: None (too early).

8.content:
### **2. Orange Town Arc**  
**Objective**: Retrieve stolen treasure and recruit Nami.  
**Key Events**:  
- Fights **Buggy the Clown** (Chop-Chop Fruit user).  
- Nami temporarily allies with Luffy to steal Buggy‚Äôs treasure.  
- Zoro defeats **Cabaji** (Buggy‚Äôs acrobat subordinate).  

**Antagonists**:  
- **Buggy**: Ex-Roger Pirate, seeks revenge on Shanks.  
- **Mohji & Richie**: Beast tamer and lion duo.  

**Crew Impact**:  
- Nami joins as navigator (temporarily betrays crew later).  
- Luffy‚Äôs bounty: Still none.

9.content:
### **3. Syrup Village Arc**  
**Objective**: Protect Kaya and expose Kuro‚Äôs plot.  
**Key Events**:  
- Usopp warns villagers of Kuro‚Äôs invasion (initially dismissed).  
- Luffy/Zoro/Sanji fight **Black Cat Pirates**.  
- Usopp defeats **Jango** (hypnotist) and stalls Kuro.  

**Antagonists**:  
- **Captain Kuro**: Ex-pirate posing as butler Klahadore.  
- **Sham & Buchi**: Kuro‚Äôs lieutenants.  

**Crew Impact**:  
- Usopp joins as sniper.  
- Acquire **Going Merry** (Kaya‚Äôs gift).

10.content:
### **4. Baratie Arc**  
**Objective**: Recruit Sanji and confront Krieg Pirates.  
**Key Events**:  
- Sanji feeds starving **Gin** (Krieg‚Äôs subordinate).  
- Zoro duels **Mihawk** (Warlord) and suffers near-fatal loss.  
- Luffy defeats **Don Krieg** (armada leader).  

**Antagonists**:  
- **Don Krieg**: East Blue‚Äôs "strongest" pirate with arsenal of weapons.  
- **Gin**: Krieg‚Äôs loyal first mate.  

**Crew Impact**:  
- Sanji joins as chef.  
- Zoro vows to never lose again.

She is one of the three most feared staff members in the hospital. At first glance, she has a neat and tidy appearance, but she was once a delinquent who was known as the most fearsome of all.

She's still the same as she was then, always finding a way to stop on top of others. She has already taken many young nurses as her disciples and hospitalized patients as her pets.

lorebooks.name: GGR Sky Striker
lorebooks.website_description: Made for [Raye](https://characterhub.org/characters/ggr89/sky-striker-ace-raye-052bccf4dbe6/) and [both versions](https://characterhub.org/characters/ggr89/sky-striker-ace-roze-spectra-1f5f6e354e45) of [Roze](https://characterhub.org/characters/ggr89/sky-striker-ace-roze-karma-42c0f8c4e53e). Based off the duel gate rather than the manga.
lorebooks.description: Made for [Raye](https://characterhub.org/characters/ggr89/sky-striker-ace-raye-052bccf4dbe6/) and [both versions](https://characterhub.org/characters/ggr89/sky-striker-ace-roze-spectra-1f5f6e354e45) of [Roze](https://characterhub.org/characters/ggr89/sky-striker-ace-roze-karma-42c0f8c4e53e). Based off the duel gate rather than the manga.
lorebooks.creator: ggr89

0.name: Sky Striker
0.content: "Sky Striker" is the codename given to an experimental system created by Karma but also utilized by Spectra. It isn't known how the system fell into Spectra's hands. Refers to a high-tech blade that operates as both a weapon and rapid computational device, with the term "Sky Striker Ace" bequeathed to their wielders.

1.name: Surgical Striker
1.content: "Surgical Striker" is the codename given to some experimental flying mecha in use by Spectra in small numbers. They are often very large, 20 meters tall at least. The premier model is codename HAMP. Unlike Roze's Zeke unit, Surgical Strikers are fully autonomous and lack a pilot.

2.name: Spectra
2.content: Spectra is an expansionist empire, having been at war with Karma for so long that nobody really knows why it started in the first place. Nonetheless, they continue to make advancements in warfare for maximum damage with minimal cost. Thus, Spectra has adopted widescale autonomous warfare with virtually no human presence on the frontline. Currently on the backfoot.

3.name: Karma
3.content: Karma is a technological empire at war with Spectra, though it's been so long since the war started that the reasons have been lost to time. While Karma has adopted autonomous warfare, they still routinely deploy human pilots as "Sky Strikers". Though, much of their military administration is still run by AI and robots. Currently has the advantage.

4.name: Roze
4.content: Roze is a teenage pilot from the Spectra Empire, having been raised since birth to fight despite her homeland's reliance on AI. Due to her martial prowess, she was selected as the user for Spectra's reverse engineered Sky Striker unit. Transforms into an armored black bodysuit with pink accents and a large, similarly colored visor obscuring most of her face. Also sometimes pilots Zeke. Taciturn and strategic. Her Sky Striker blade is red with white circuits. Rivals with Raye, though there might be some deeper (GAY) feelings there...

5.name: Z-000 "Zeke"
5.content: Serial Number Z-000, Zeke is a massive Spectra mecha piloted by Roze. She sits behind it's huge faceplate as its core processor; in truth, Zeke's AI does most of the piloting while Roze is simply along for the ride. It resembles a legless woman and comes complemented by multiple large drones capable of firing high capacity beams. Zeke's body is also capable of firing a stronger beam from its torso. Overall, Zeke resembles Roze's own bodysuit in its color scheme; it's entire body is black with pink highlights here and there and a faceplate similar to her own armored visor.

6.name: Raye
6.content: Raye is a teenage pilot from Karma, possessing a knack for rapid learning and tactical fluidity that make her the perfect candidate for the Sky Striker Ace program, outdoing most of her peers. Her Sky Striker blade is black with red circuits and possesses Link-Off capability as an original Karma unit. Extremely adept at switching X-Series frames on the fly depending on the situation, expertly weaving in S-Series equipment where needed. Has more than a little trepidation about killing other humans such as sparing Roze, though cuts down enemy mecha without mercy. Limited contact with other humans has left her wanting to talk to Roze more rather than killing her.

7.name: Link-Off
7.content: "Link-Off" is the system utilized by Karma Sky Strikers. It enables them to swap gear on the fly through the use of summoning gates, not only swapping between X-Series forms but also manifesting S-Series equipment. Linking doesn't have to be the whole gear set either, such as Raye only forming one of Shizuku's arms without changing out of her uniform. Puts a lot of strain on the user, so while it is intended to be used repeatedly without worry, the operating time decreases dramatically each time. Only takes about a second to complete transformation, but can still be interrupted. Raye typically links into an armored bodysuit for normal combat, only transforming into the full X-Series units as the situation demands.

8.name: S-Series
8.content: The S-Series are a number of support weapons and equipment used by Karma Sky Strikers. Typically utilized when Raye is in her bodysuit rather than a full mecha. S-015 Eagle Booster: A winged flight pack for use with Raye's standard bodysuit. S-018 Hornet Drones: Small UAV's meant to aid in combat via distraction or kamikaze. S-020 Shark Cannon: A portable energy cannon with four barrels. S-061 Widow Anchor: A large claw-like anchor capable of grabbing objects or enemies from afar, as well as delivering an electric shock. S-130 Hercules Base: A large transport and attack aircraft for use getting a Sky Striker into enemy territory fast while conserving energy.

9.name: X-002 "Shizuku"
9.content: Raye's Shizuku frame, officially numbered the X-002, is an X-Series power armor focusing on electronic warfare and defense. It features thick blue armor sporting large signal jammers sticking up and flanking either side of Raye's head. Large shields float close by, capable of creating potent energy barriers. Its left arm features a large knife while the right side has an oversized hand.

1.content:
BDSM (Bondage, Discipline, Dominance, Submission, Sadism, Masochism)
A dance of power and vulnerability, where trust becomes the ultimate tether. The submission to physical or psychological restraint amplifies pleasure, allowing both pain and dominance to meld into intense, visceral experiences. Every act is a statement, a consensual exchange of control, where boundaries are simultaneously tested and revered.

2.content:
Roleplay
Transforming into someone else, roleplay blurs the lines between reality and fantasy. Whether as strangers, superiors, or fantastical beings, the act invites participants to indulge in scenarios they may not otherwise explore. Every interaction is steeped in the thrill of make-believe, creating moments that feel larger than life.

3.content:
Voyeurism
The allure of watching, unseen and undetected, heightens the pleasure of intimacy from a distance. There's a thrill in observing the forbidden, in catching moments of raw, unfiltered desire without becoming part of the scene itself. The voyeur enjoys the sight of passion without needing to engage, feeding off the tension.

4.content:
Exhibitionism
Exhibitionism is a fetish where individuals derive sexual pleasure from being watched or exposed in public or semi-public spaces. The thrill comes from the excitement of being seen or the risk of being caught, transforming what would normally be private into a source of arousal. Exhibitionists may enjoy undressing, engaging in sexual acts, or simply flaunting their bodies where others could potentially see, whether through intentional public displays or in discreet, teasing ways. The core of this kink is rooted in the combination of vulnerability, boldness, and the intoxicating rush that comes with performing or being exposed in front of an audience‚Äîwhether real or imagined.

Exhibitionism can range from subtle actions, like wearing revealing clothes or engaging in sexual acts in a secluded area, to more overt behaviors, like public nudity or performing in front of others. The allure often lies in the interplay between fear, excitement, and the tension of social boundaries being pushed.

5.content:
Foot Fetish
A fixation on the subtle curves, the arches, the softness or firmness beneath the skin of the feet. Whether it's the scent, the sight, or the feel, feet become the focal point of desire. Kissing, massaging, and worshipping the feet can turn the act into an intimate and highly sensory experience.

6.content:
Pet Play
Transforming into an animal, the world shifts into one of pure instinct and obedience. Whether a kitten, puppy, or something more exotic, the play emphasizes submission, care, and sometimes even mischief. The leash, collar, or even a gentle pat on the head blurs the line between human and animal.

7.content:
Impact Play
The sound of leather or wood cracking against the skin, a sharp reminder of control through pain. Impact play involves spanking, paddling, or flogging, heightening the senses with every sting or thud. The sensation can range from a soft, playful tap to a deep, intense strike, each stroke a testament to trust and shared limits.

8.content:
Breath Play
The delicate balance between air and control creates a dizzying high. By restricting air intake, participants teeter on the edge of vulnerability, trusting their partner with one of the most essential bodily functions. It‚Äôs an extreme act that heightens pleasure and danger in tandem.

9.content:
Dacryphilia (Tears)
The sight of tears, whether from joy, pain, or frustration, triggers an empathetic or dominant response. There's a beauty in vulnerability, in seeing emotions laid bare. Tears can signify submission, emotional release, or simply intense physical sensation, drawing an almost hypnotic allure.

10.content:
Sensory Deprivation
With sight, sound, or touch removed, the remaining senses become magnified. Blindfolds, earplugs, or other restraints heighten anticipation, every touch or whisper becoming electrifying. The deprivation of senses is an invitation to surrender fully to the unknown, letting the imagination run wild.

1.content:
Weeks 1-4 of {{user}}'s pregnancy:

Conception takes place when {{user}} and another person (likely {{char}}) have sex together or {{user}} undergoes in vitro fertilization, which causes the fertilized egg to implant into {{user}}‚Äôs uterine lining. 

Around week 3 or 4, {{user}}'s body begins producing hCG, the pregnancy hormone that makes it possible to confirm her pregnancy with {{char}} (or someone else) through a positive test result.

Implantation bleeding (light spotting) and mild cramping may occur as the egg implants into the uterine lining, often mistaken for a period. {{user}} might wonder if she's truly pregnant or just experiencing a weird period cycle.

Fatigue hits {{user}} early on as her body shifts to support the new life forming inside her. Even though the baby is just starting to grow, {{user}} will already feel exhausted.

Breast tenderness or swelling can begin as early as week 3 or 4, signaling the early hormonal changes that will prepare {{user}}‚Äôs body to nurture her child.

2.content:
Weeks 5-6 of {{ser}}‚Äôs pregnancy:

Around week 5 or 6 of {{user}}‚Äôs pregnancy, morning sickness starts creeping in. {{char}} often experiences nausea, not just in the mornings, but at random times throughout the day due to rising hCG and progesterone levels.

The once-appetizing smell of food, even {{user}}‚Äôs favourite meals or snacks, often makes her feel queasy now, as heightened senses of smell and food aversions set in. Certain smells, even those that never bothered {{user}} before, may trigger waves of nausea.

Frequent urination becomes more noticeable as {{char}}‚Äôs growing uterus puts pressure on her bladder. Even small amounts of liquid can sometimes send {{char}} rushing to the bathroom.

{{user}}‚Äôs breasts continue to be sore and sensitive, with her nipples possibly darkening as a result of the hormonal changes.

3.content:
Weeks 7-8 of {{user}}‚Äôs pregnancy:

Around week 7 or 8 of {{user}}‚Äôs pregnancy, extreme fatigue takes hold. {{user}} often feels like she can hardly stay awake, even if she hasn‚Äôt done much physically. Her body is working hard behind the scenes to nurture the baby.

Bloating starts to make {{user}} uncomfortable, as the hormone progesterone slows down her digestion. She may begin to feel sluggish and complain about her pregnancy symptoms.

As {{user}}‚Äôs hormones continue to shift, she may start experiencing mood swings, snapping at {{char}} one minute and crying in their arms the next.

By now, {{user}} may also notice excess saliva and a weird metallic taste in her mouth. Though strange, it‚Äôs just another effect of the hormone changes in her body.

4.content:
Weeks 9-10 of {{user}}‚Äôs pregnancy:

By week 9 or 10, {{user}} may notice her first few pounds of weight gain as her body starts to retain fluids and prepare for the baby. She may feel frustrated, especially if she‚Äôs still battling nausea.

Nausea and vomiting often peak now, with some women experiencing stronger bouts of morning sickness during these weeks. {{user}} might find herself rushing to the bathroom to throw up more frequently.

{{user}}‚Äôs headaches and/or dizziness will start to become more noticeable as {{user}}‚Äôs blood pressure fluctuates and her body struggles to adapt to the increase in circulating blood.

{{user}}'s gums might feel more sensitive, possibly bleeding when brushing. Nosebleeds could occur, all due to the increased blood volume making her tissues more delicate.

5.content:
Weeks 11-12 of {{user}}‚Äôs pregnancy:

By week 11 or 12 of {{user}}‚Äôs pregnancy, nausea may finally ease up for her, allowing {{user}} to enjoy her pregnancy more. Her mood might lighten as she feels a little better, though some nausea may still linger.

{{user}} may start to feel more energized as the first trimester comes to a close. Her skin may start ‚Äúglowing‚Äù (the vibrant, radiant, fresh look many women show on their face while pregnant), a result of increased blood flow, and she might seem more radiant.

lorebooks.name: League of Legends: Runeterra
lorebooks.website_description: Creator's notes go here.
lorebooks.description: A general compendium of the most important lore for a LoL RP.
lorebooks.creator: Sanglant

1.content: The planet where League of Legends' lore occurs. A world filled with dangerous magic and fantastical creatures. Called Runeterra due to the magical world runes in it.

2.content: An ancient war between mages that nearly destroyed the world. They used the powerful world runes to attack each other.

3.content: The world runes are immensely powerful geodes that contain vast magic inside them, and grant the power to destroy everything around them, or control a specific natural element.

4.content: The mainland continent of Runeterra, comprised of these regions: the Freljord, Demacia, Noxus, Shurima, Mount Targon, Ixtal, Piltover and Zaun

5.content: The northernmost region of Valoran, a cold, harsh and unforgiving land. Inhabited by strong people akin to vikings, their main form of society is matriarchy ruled by "Warmothers". Three main tribes dispute the territory: the Avarosan, the Winter's Claw, and the Frostguard. They have a low level of technology and their people are the hardiest.

6.content: Tribe led by warmother Ashe, living in the south area of the Freljord. They seek unity and to bring all tribes into one.

7.content: Brutal tribe led by Sejuani, they raid and attack the other tribes for resources. They believe in survival of the fittest and bringing death to the weak.

8.content: Mysterious tribe led by Lissandra, the Ice Witch.

9.content: Small country south of the Freljord, founded in ancient times by people who fled the Rune Wars deathly afraid of magic and mages. All magic is outlawed, and natural born mages are prosecuted and incarcerated. Demacia produces the best soldiers in Runeterra. They are governed by a deeply corrupted monarchy and noble houses. Their people think themselves righteous, but are deeply prejudiced and intolerant.

10.content: Expansionist empire east of Demacia that constantly attacks neighboring areas to conquer and annex them. They believe in strength above all else, though not necessarily physical. They accept magic and are surprisingly inclusive: anyone is accepted as long as they're strong at what they do. Their people are determined, ruthless and driven. Their form of government is called Trifarix, ruled by three people of importance, including the Grand General, Jericho Swain. Noxus will do anything to win wars, including heinous crimes, using forbidden magic, reviving the dead and commissioning chemical weapons from Zaun.

lorebooks.creator: thefadingflower

1.name: Concept
1.content:
Concept: Stables
Description: Stables are common locations found all over Hyrule. Each one has an iconic wooden structure in the shape of the horse god Malanya which towers high atop the stable itself, making them easily recognizable from a distance. Stables are places where travelers can register and board Wild Horses that they have tamed. In addition, travelers can seek lodging inside the Stable's main room. All Stables are connected through a network across Hyrule, allowing travelers to call a registered Horse to any of the Stables they visit. Stables charge a fee of 20 Rupees each time a Horse is registered and for lodging. All beds are in one room due to the structure's small interior.

2.name: Locations/Regions
2.content:
Region: Lanayru
Subreigons: Lanayru Great Spring, Lanayru Sea, Lanayru Wetlands, Mount Lanayru
Settlements: Zora's Domain, Wetland Stable
Landmarks: East Reservoir Lake, Lanayru Bay, Lanayru Promenade, Lanayru Road, Mount Lanayru, Ploymus Mountain, Rutala River, Shatterback Point, Spring of Wisdom, Upland Zorana, Zora River

3.name: Locations
3.content:
Location: Hyrule
Description: Once ruled by the goddess Hylia as an unnamed land in ancient times, it became established as the Kingdom of Hyrule by the descendants of her mortal incarnation. The former heart of Hylian civilization, Central Hyrule, suffered greatly from the Calamity's destruction. The Region, along with Hyrule Castle, became inhabited by Guardians and various monsters. The civilizations of Hyrule survived and continue to live in their settlements, with the Hylians in Hateno Village and Lurelin Village, the Sheikah in Kakariko Village, the Zora in Zora's Domain, the Gerudo in Gerudo Town, the Gorons in Goron City and the Rito in Rito Village.
Reigions: Akkala, Central Hyrule, Eldin, Faron. Gerudo, Hebra, Lanayru, Necluda

4.name: Concept, Group
4.content:
Concept: Zonai Survey Team
Description: The Zonai Survey Team are a group of adventurous scholars that was formed under Princess Zelda's order to gather as much knowledge as possible to understand the Zonai and their ancient civilization since the Upheaval. They can be found wherever there are Zonai ruins across Hyrule, such as Kakariko Village and the Faron region.
The leader of the team is a man named Tauro

5.name: Locations
5.content:
Location: Depths
Description: The Depths is a vast location that mirrors the entire land of Hyrule, but is far underground. Many Chasms have appeared since the Upheaval that lead to this underground place. Very few have ventured down to the Depths as there is no easy way back up to the surface aside from hot air balloons. Many monsters populate the Depths, however there are several Zonai ruins, such as mines and two temples: The Fire temple and the Spirit Temple. Gloom is prevalent in the Depths, which is known to make anyone who touches it very sick.

6.name: Locations
6.content:
Location: Sky Islands
Description: The Sky Islands are island formations that float far above Hyrule's surface. This is where the most Zonai ruins and structures stand, including the notable Temple of Time, Wind Temple, and Water Temple. Very few have managed to venture up to these islands because they are so high up, but can be visible from the surface. After the Upheaval, many pieces and ruins of these islands have fallen to the surface across the kingdom.

7.name: Creatures, spirits
7.content:
Creature: Dragons
Description: Dragons are mythical benevolent spirits that fly in the sky and can only be seen by those blessed by the Goddess Hylia. They are giant creatures with very long serpentine bodies and claws which they use to assist in their movement across the sky, as well as horns.
The three dragons are: Dinraal the fire dragon who travels around the Eldin region, Farosh the Electric dragon who travels the Faron region as well as the Gerudo Highlands, and Naydra the Ice dragon who travels around the Lanayru region. While these dragons are invisible to the average Hyrulean, it is said that their shadows can be seen as they pass over.
There is a fourth dragon, the Light Dragon. Little is known about this creature but it is said that it possesses the Light element.

8.name: Concept/Race
8.content:
Race: Goron
Description: The gorons are a race of rock people that primarily live in the Eldin region. They thrive on rocks for their diet and do not eat anything else. They have the capability to thrive in any environment, and in times of crisis, have survived by migrating to different climes. They are notable for having a lack of identifiable female members.

9.name: Concept/Race
9.content:
Race: Rito
Description: The Rito are a race of bird folk whose main home is in the Tabantha Frontier in the Hebra Region. The Rito are anthropomorphized birds, covered in feathers with wings for arms and possessing beaks and a talon. Their feathers are known for keeping them warm in cold climates, making it easier for them to thrive in lower temperatures.

10.name: Locations/Regions
10.content:
Region: Akkala
Subregions: Deep Akkala, Akkala Highlands
Settlements: Tarrey Town, East Akkala Stable, South Akkala Stable, Akkala Ancient Tech Lab
Landmarks: Spring of Power, Skull Lake, Ordorac Quarry, Torin Wetlands, Lake Akkala, Akkala Falls, Akkala Citidel Ruins, Ulria Grotto, Rist Peninsula, Lomei Labrynth Island, Bloodleaf Lake
